Sandy tannins frame the dry palate, which combines structural power with balanced depth, offering flavors of black currant and burned caramel that are buoyed by bright acidity.

title: Bethel Heights 2016 Aeolian Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Named to acknowledge the windy corridor that gives this estate's fruit its grip and concentration, this is a fine entry into an outstanding portfolio. Complex and supple, it's loaded with fruit flavors of blueberry, plum and cherry. Oak aging has added nuanced notes of cinnamon and cedar.

title: Biondi 2016 Pianta Bianco  (Etna)
description: Made with 90% Carricante and 10% Catarratto. Aromas of Spanish broom, yellow apple, candied citrus zest and a whiff of Mediterranean herb follow through to the fresh, elegant palate along with a note of honeyed nut and a hint of exotic spice. An almost salty mineral note lingers on the finish.

title: Cellers Baronia del Montsant 2011 Englora Red (Montsant)
description: Maple and mocha aromas are cedary and rich. An intense palate brings the power but also elegance. Flavors of oaky vanilla and lemon peel accent baked fruit and sweet maple notes. On the finish, coffee and cocoa join latent berry flavors in a slow fade. Drink through 2023.

title: Chiron Wines 2015 Candor Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Densely concentrated and rich in red fruit, this 100% varietal wine also offers complex layers of tobacco, earth and dried herb, mingling it all together into a cohesive whole. The tannins are plush and polished, giving the wine strength with purpose.

title: Collet 2008 Brut Millésime  (Champagne)
description: From one of the many fine Champagne vintages this century, this intense wine is structured and still young. There is some richness from the ripe Pinot Noir in the blend but ultimately this tight wine would benefit from further aging. Drink from 2020.

title: Delamotte NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Based in Le Mesnil-sur-Oger in the heart of the Côte des Blancs, this producer knows a thing or two about Chardonnay Champagnes. The proof is in this intense, mineral and citrus-driven wine. It has depth of flavor giving concentration as well as richness. Drink this bottling from 2019.

title: Domaine Divio 2016 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Each of the winery's Pinots showcases a specific AVA, and each is quite distinctive. Here, the sharply etched scents suggest raspberry jam and preserved lemon, and the following flavors retain that tight focus. Notes of blood orange and pineapple highlight the acidity, and the wine continues on with herbal notes. The tannins, still a bit stiff, will benefit from further bottle aging.

title: Domaine Fouassier 2016 Le Clos de Bannon  (Sancerre)
description: This producer, now in its 10th generation, sources the grapes for this wine from a seven-acre vineyard on clay and chalk soils. Made from biodynamically grown grapes, this rich wine is full of generous apple and apricot flavors that are now mature enough to drink. The wine could also age, so drink now or until 2022.

title: Twisted River 2017 Bin 168 Riesling (Mosel)
description: Savory hints of hay and barley permeate through sweeter tones of candied pineapple and yellow cherry in this medium-dry Riesling. It's approachably plump and fruity but has bright acidity. A slightly rustic wine to enjoy now.

title: Viña Vilano 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of wood grain, mint, clove and smoke ride into a rock-hard palate with fierce tannins. Burnt oak, black fruit and hard-spice flavors give way to heat and forced spice on the finish.

title: 4 Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Black raspberry, black currant, spice, green pepper and reductive aromas are followed by soft, plump black currant flavors, with the concentration seeming light. It needs more structure to stand it up.

title: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2016 Gemini Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: You'll have to look closely to spot the Gemini designation on the front label, that differentiates this from the estate's Trouble cuvée. Leathery aromas and flavors dominate, along with sweet grape candy, but then the bitter tannins take over.

title: Aveleda 2014 Casal Garcia Sparkling (Vinho Verde)
description: This is an attractive crisp, bubbly wine with lively acidity and some sweetness. It is fruity with ripe apples and lightly perfumed. Drink now.

title: BK Wines 2015 One Ball Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)
description: This wine carries bright citrus and toasted nut aromas, masked by an oniony note that blows off some with time. The palate comes with a chalky texture and a pithy, spicy bite.

title: Bleasdale NV The Red Brute Sparkling Shiraz (Langhorne Creek)
description: A classic Shiraz nose of ripe cherries, plums, chocolate and earthy, peppery spice leads into a rich, velvelty-textured palate that is equally fruity and spicy. Gentle bubbles and some sweetness gives this wine a slightly lazy feel.

title: Bougrier 2017 Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: This fresh, light and creamy wine is bright with citrus flavors. Its herbal nature is still young but is attractive for its upfront, fruity character. Drink this wine now.
designation: Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc

title: Cave des Vins de Sancerre 2017 Les Ruettes  (Sancerre)
description: This soft, ripe wine is made to be instantly drinkable. The texture hints at minerality while it is also full of rich white fruits, a rounded texture and balanced acidity. Drink now.

title: Chakana 2016 Nuna Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Grapy aromas of cassis and purple flower are jumbled. This is high in acidity but short on depth and richness. Tart black fruit flavors are smacking and taste of saline on an acidic finish.

title: Coelho 2016 Bunny Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The so-called Bunny Cuvée refers to the unnamed front label graphic of a rabbit, which adorns this new series of inexpensive Coelho wines. This is as light as a feather, with scents of mushrooms and flavors of salmonberry.

title: Innocent Bystander 2017 Moscato (Swan Hill)
description: This syrupy sweet bubbly comes with a pretty sunset hue, ultraripe aromas of red berry, watermelon candy and grape juice. At 5.5% abv, this could be an easy sipper ice cold with a dessert like raspberry tart.

title: Lujon 2017 Riesling (Willamette Valley)
description: This new vintage is not optimally ripened, and it carries a touch of shallot in the nose. Despite its 25 g/L of residual sugar, it remains disjointed, with an awkward mix of grapy sweetness and wild greens. Another year in bottle should help smooth it out.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2013 HZ Abascal Vineyard Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy aromas of oak and tobacco meet brandied cherry and plum about halfway. On the palate, this is screaming with acidity, making for a shrill mouthfeel. Flavors of oaky vanilla and sour cherry finish with sizzle and sour red-currant notes. The most notable problem is unresolved pesky acidity.

title: Paumanok 2016 Minimalist Chenin Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: This spontaneous ferment Chenin offers aromas of sauced apples and pears on the nose. Light in feel, the palate is straightforward in nature, displaying spiced tree fruit flavors carried along by a healthy vein of acidity.

title: Quinta dos Murças 2017 Assobio Rosé (Douro)
description: The wine is ripe and soft with red-berry fruits and touches of caramel. It has a rounded character, it's full of fruitiness and it has a gentle texture. Drink this easy wine now.

title: Sanguinhal 2017 Sottal Leve White (Lisboa)
description: Perfumed Moscatel is cut by crisp Arinto and Vital in this lively wine with its light frizzante character. It is fruity, crisp with citrus and with an edge of sweetness. Drink the wine immediately.

title: Taliano 2015 Montersino  (Barbaresco)
description: Subdued aromas of chocolate-covered raisin, withered violet and camphor emerge from the glass. The raw palate offers espresso, coconut and prune while grainy, astringent tannins clench the finish.

title: Thierry Delaunay 2017 Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: Very herbal and crisp, this currant-flavored wine is all fruit and acidity. It has hints of more tropical flavors as well as an attractive perfume. Drink the wine now.

title: Abadia Retuerta 2014 Pago Valdebellón Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: Damp, mossy, earthy berry aromas are murky as a whole. This Cabernet is massive and pounding on the palate, with tannins as hard as nails. A green-leaning flavor profile with coffee, mint and blackberry notes finishes with heavy oak, burnt toast and green spice flavors.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: Pascal Jolivet 2017 Clos du Roy  (Sancerre)
description: From a southern-exposure, 3.7-acre vineyard, this presents a rich style of Sauvignon Blanc. It has all the minerality the chalk soil can give, at the same time offering ripe citrus and zesty acidity. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Quevedo 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a wine that is already so well balanced while also having an intense structured future. It is powered by tannins and by a dark concentration of its structure and its powerful black fruits. Drink this wine from 2028.

title: Ramey 2014 Cole Creek Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: The producer's third vintage from this relatively cool site, this wine is beautifully wrapped in lavender and smoky grilled meat. There is 6% Viognier cofermented with the Syrah. Turned earth, game and white pepper give it varietal complexity and integrity, with a powerfully bright thread of acidity and silky freshness.

title: Riverbench 2016 Pommard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Ripe red cherry compote, turned earth and chaparral spice aromas of sagebrush and wild mint converge for a very complex and inviting nose on this clonal selection. Tart cherry and cranberry flavors grow tangier with a hint of orange rind on the palate, which is dusted with peppery spice and finishes on a rounded strawberry kick.

title: Roco 2015 RMS Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)
description: The blend is 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay, within spitting distance of the 2014 cuvée. Made in the traditional méthode Champenoise, it's a savvy, sexy bottle of bubbly. Lightly candied fruit flavors of orange peel, pineapple and poached pear penetrate deeply into the palate, with a fine bead and a burst of toast.

title: Schloss Gobelsburg NV Brut Reserve Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Subtle yeast and wet stone notes on the nose promise seriousness. The palate delivers this in a subtle, almost gentle fashion. Beautifully delineated apple and stone fruit are perfectly integrated with a sonorous hint of yeast and immense lemon freshness. This manages to be rich and slender at the same time. Lovely now but sure to develop further. Drink now–2025.

title: Siduri 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Sultry and elegantly integrated aromas of purple flower and black raspberry decorate the nose of this single-vineyard expression by veteran Adam Lee. Pungent fruit shows on the palate, where baked black cherry and boysenberry are lifted by wild thyme and chaparral spice.

title: Stolpman 2016 Originals Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Ripe aromas of blackberry, black plum, spice cake, white pepper and cola show strongly on the nose of this bottling from the Stolpman family's original block of vineyard. Strong and mouth-filling tannins provide ample structure to the clean, peppery, pure purple flavors of the expertly balanced palate. Drink 2020–2036.

title: Tornatore 2016 Rosso  (Etna)
description: Rose, wild red berry, Mediterranean brush and crushed stone aromas form an enticing fragrance. Smooth, linear and vibrant, the ethereally elegant palate delivers crushed strawberry, raspberry, blood orange and mint alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. A tangy saline note lingers on the close. Drink through 2026.

title: Veuve Doussot 2013 Cuvée Ernestine  (Champagne)
description: This wine is named after Ernestine Doussot, the widow (veuve) who created this producer. Rich but tautly textured, it is balanced, elegant with a strong streak of acidity and minerality as well as tense citrus fruits. Drink from 2020.

title: Westerly 2015 Cote Blonde Syrah (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Hearty, deep and polished aromas of black currant, black plums and blackberry-laced fudge are thick and impressive on the nose of this bottling, which includes 3% Viognier. Power is the message on the palate, where booming black-currant and charred beef flavors ride firm tannins that tighten on the finish. Drink 2019–2030.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2013 Esporão Private Selection Red (Alentejo)
description: A rich blend of Alicante Bouschet, Aragonez and Syrah, this wine is ripe but still elegant. It is dense in color, almost black, with layers of dark fruits, structured tannins and a fine, juicy aftertaste. Drink this impressive wine from 2019.

title: Blackett 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Perfumed and generously textured, this is a rich wine whose fine tangy fruits are balanced by its powerful tannins. Its perfumed character is very prominent and needs to calm down. The potential of the wine is there, drink from 2028.

title: Bob Cabral Wines 2015 Troubadour Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Forest floor, clove, black tea and ash mark this lush, full-bodied and textured wine. It offers plenty of red and black cherry flavors atop a delicate undercarriage of freshness and grace.

title: Davies 2016 Hyde Vineyards Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From one of the appellation's great vineyards, this wine does the site justice in a quiet, expressive opening note of spicy fruit. A light, high-toned lift of acidity complements the bolder notions of oak and tannin, allowing all to open slowly in the glass.

title: Delamotte 2008 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Drawing on fruit from the Côte des Blancs, this wine is concentrated and still young. Density comes from the strong minerality that is balanced by a lemon flavor. Textured and taut, this wine needs time in the cellar. Drink from 2020.

title: Deutz 2013 Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Still young, this crisp, fruity wine is tangy and packed with red-currant flavors and acidity. The fruit balances with the fresh, tangy character that will allow this wine to age well. Drink now for its freshness, but the wine will be best from 2020.

title: Diamond Creek 2015 Red Rock Terrace Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Exotically earthy, this block designate is defined in graphite, tobacco and cocoa powder, with a gritty, grippy profile of tannin at its core. Savory, soft and supple in nature, it also shows concentration and structure within a full-bodied frame of mountain ripeness.

title: Domaine Jean-Paul Balland 2016 Grand Cuvée  (Sancerre)
description: Based in the notable wine village of Bué, this producer has made a rich wine, partially aged in wood. Intensely juicy with tropical fruits cut with citrus and hints of toast, the wine is full, ripe and already delicious. Drink now.

title: Domaine Laporte 2016 Le Grand Rochoy  (Sancerre)
description: From the oldest vines in the estate, this is an intense, rich and still-young wine. Its currant and citrus acidity are concentrated and show great depth. Juicy acidity blends into the mineral character of the wine. Let it mature and drink from 2020.

title: Truett Hurst 2016 The One Armed Man Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A Zin-based blend that offers the variety's friendly personality, this has seasonings of smoked oak and leather with maximum-level ripeness that presents as syrupy and sweet. Dark chocolate, blackberry jam and vanilla all figure in.

title: Twisted River 2017 Late Harvest Bin 568 Riesling (Mosel)
description: While the nose is intensely earthy, suggesting savory notes of dried herbs and pollen, the palate here offers juicy lemon and grapefruit flavors. Medium-sweet on the palate, it's balanced crisply by vivacious lime acidity. Drink now.

title: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This is a soft rosé, smoothly textured and approachable. It has layers of rich strawberries as well as touches of red currant attractively wrapped in ripe acidity. The bottling is ready to drink.

title: Viejo Isaias 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Herbal berry and plum aromas are savory and a touch green. An edgy palate pulls back and is drawing, while this tastes of herbal berry fruits and cured meat. Mouthcoating tannins take elegance away from the finish.

title: Vranken NV Demoiselle Tête de Cuvée Brut  (Champagne)
description: A lower dosage than in the past allows the fruit of this wine to shine. With crisp acidity and delicious creamed-apple flavors, it is a balanced wine, zesty and fresh. The bottling could age a little and will be better from 2019.

title: Wakefield 2016 Jaraman Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
description: This Pinot offers up aromas of blueberry, red berry, cocoa and plenty of spicy oak, which lead into a palate that's less plush than the nose. There's a good lick of acidity and rather hard, stalky tannins.

title: Waterbrook 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cocoa, herb, dark chocolate, vanilla and cherry aromas are out front. Fruit and barrel flavors play off each other and continue to intertwine through the finish. Grippy tannins back it up.

title: Ca'Romè 2015 Maria di Brun  (Barbaresco)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals toasted oak, scorched earth and a hint of spearmint. The assertive palate delivers coconut, sour cherry and espresso alongside grainy, astringent tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Ca'Romè 2015 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)
description: Subdued aromas evoking toasted oak and mocha slowly appear in the glass. The tight assertive palate offers roasted coffee bean, clove and licorice alongside raspy tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: De Bortoli NV DB Family Selection Brut  (Australia)
description: This is a straightforward bubbly that's fruity and crisp in feel, with a slightly slippery texture. It ticks all the boxes.

title: Schmitt Söhne 2017 Relax Riesling (Mosel)
description: Whiffs of saffron and pollen lend a savory tone to this medium-sweet wine. It's easy-drinking yet vibrant, with notes of orange peel, lemon and dusty minerality. Racy acidity offers levity on the finish.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2017 Bridão Clássico Branco White (Tejo)
description: A typical local blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, the wine has rich green-plum flavors while also having balance. It is a fruity wine that is round, full, with plenty of freshness and acidity. Drink this bright wine now.

title: Anonymous 2015 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon work well together in this blend, which also contains Petite Sirah, Malbec and Zinfandel. Reduced and concentrated, there's a moderate richness and rounded quality to the palate, dotted in red plum and cinnamon.

title: Areté 2016 Brut Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine offers a rusty yellow gold, with scents of bruised apple. It seemed much older than its vintage, partially oxidized, but with plenty of fruit. A metallic note crept into the finish. Just one bottle was provided, so no chance to retaste.

title: Bellangelo 2015 Chardonnay (Seneca Lake)
description: Shy aromas of citrus and toast carry to the weighty palate. This is well balanced in feel, with bright acidity carrying the flavors along, yet straightforward in nature.

title: Bodegas Fos 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Scratchy aromas of spicy red fruits and tree bark hold up to scrutiny, as do the oaky notes that create a vanilla essence to go with gamy berry flavors. A chewy, meaty finish belies this Crianza's low price tag.

title: Butternut 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A rusty shade of pink in the glass, this bottling starts with slightly sour aromas of raspberry, strawberry and iron. The palate is a little muddy with dried plum and rusty earth flavors.

title: Campo Viejo 2016  Rioja
description: Gritty plum and raspberry aromas suggest asphalt. In the mouth, this is mild, fresh and highly basic in structure and feel. Plum and raspberry aromas are floral, while this is fleshy on a simple finish.

title: Cedergreen Cellars 2016 Gamay Noir (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Examples of this variety are an extreme rarity in the state, with this one coming from Skyline Vineyard. Aromas of raspberry jam, spice and campfire lead to plentiful mesquite and red fruit flavors. Smoky notes linger on the finish.

title: Colosi 2016 Rosso Red (Salina)
description: A blend of Nerello Cappuccio and Nerello Mascalese, this has subtle aromas suggesting red berry, Mediterranean scrub and a whiff of cooking spice. The straightforward palate offers crushed raspberry and a hint of star anise alongside rounded tannins. Drink soon.

title: Fattoria La Rivolta 2012 Terra di Rivolta  (Aglianico del Taburno)
description: Juicy and polished, this offers aromas of sunbaked earth, mature plum, leather and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. On the dense, full-bodied palate, close-grained tannins give structure to dried cherry, raspberry jam, star anise and a dusting of bitter cocoa before a rather drying finish. Drink 2020–2027.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2016 Grande Cuvée  (Sancerre)
description: This is an extra-rich wine, concentrated with ripe fruits. It is still young with no holds barred in its power and intensity. With its dense texture and upfront fruit, it needs to age. Drink from 2020.

title: Francis Blanchet 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: From old vines, this rich wine is beautifully concentrated and fruity. Apples and crisp green plums go with citrus to give a wine that has delicious potential. Drink from 2019.

title: Fullerton 2016 Croft Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Relative to the rest of Fullerton's 2016 Pinots, the Croft seems the most tannic, with a thicker presence in the mouth. Blackberry, black cherry and cola components are the defining flavors, with black olive and dark chocolate highlights running through the tannins.

title: Geyser Peak 2015 Merlot (California)
description: Excellent fruit concentration and very good balance make this full-bodied wine a winner. Minty cedary aromas accent the vivid black-cherry and pomegranate flavors as moderate tannins and fresh acidity add appetizing structure.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Crisp waves of cherry vanilla are complemented by citrus-driven acidity in this light bright wine that's well made and memorable. Textured, it is lengthy and has ample body to work on its own or with food.

title: Grace + Vine 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Red-cherry compote, balsamic-glazed berries and a pinch of dried sage show on the nose of this bottling from a new label that's made by a secret group of winemakers. It's relatively light on the palate but full of flavors, from sour cherry and cranberry to pepper dust and dried marjoram.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2015 Solo Barrique Malbec (South Coast)
description: Deep, dark and lush aromas of blackberry, black plums, lilac and smoked meat show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is well rounded and cohesive, showing berry, plum and espresso-bean flavors.

title: Jacquart 2010 Cuvée Alpha Rosé Vintage Brut  (Champagne)
description: With lower than the standard dosage in the Jacquart range, this wine shows off its rich, maturing fruit. A strong line of minerality comes from the 52% of Chardonnay in the blend of grand and premier cru wines. Drink now, or, even better, wait until 2020.

title: Jordan 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a tense, tart and crisply mineral-laden white wine, thick on entry in peach and melon flavor. The midpalate finds peace and balance, allowing a slight bit of reduction to linger and the finish to focus in acidity.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2012 Alambre  (Moscatel de Setúbal)
description: Pure Moscatel, aged in old wood, gives a luscious, raisin and spice flavored wine. It is sweet, unctuous and rich, smoothly textured to be ready to drink. Orange peel and honey come through strongly at the end. Drink now.

title: Joseph Jewell 2014 Starscape Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This vineyard used to be called the Floodgate Vineyard and has been a consistent source of grapes to the producer. Soft, plush and brimming in dark rustic cherry and cardamom, this wine is also plenty earthy, a mix of turned earth and dried herb. The tannins are thick and strong.

title: Joseph Perrier NV Cuvée Royale Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This stylish wine balances crisp fruit with a mineral texture and well-structured acidity. The wine is still young, with a tight, zesty texture and crispness. It should be better from 2019.
designation: Cuvée Royale Brut Blanc de Blancs

title: King Estate 2016 Pinot Envy Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The front label picture of Sigmund Freud underscores the punny name for this new entry into the winery's lineup. The wine was treated to 18 months in 30% new French oak. Its generous, fruit-driven flavors of raspberry and cherry come with a streak of cola, while the tannins are lightly dusty and proportionate.

title: Koehler 2015 Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Cranberry, white pepper, dried herbs and wet gravel make for a complex aromatic entry to the nose of this bottling. Bright flavors of red cherry, oregano and rose petals give depth to the lighter-bodied style and make it quite easy to quaff.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas are suggestive of raisin, baked plum and pastry. In the mouth, this Crianza is chewy and solid, but not too heavy. Plum, raspberry and wood-spice flavors are lasting and steady across the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Martinelli 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Amped up in gritty texture and a big tannin profile, this is robust, richly concentrated red wine, able to deliver expertly on its style. Rich dark cherry, toasted oak and a thick thread of earthiness combine effortlessly and with a tenacity that's impressive.

title: Mastroberardino 2017 Nova Serra  (Greco di Tufo)
description: White spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and white almond aromas take center stage. On the round, fresh palate, a light mineral note adds depth to mature yellow apple, juicy pear and tangy lemon zest.

title: Montesole 2011  Taurasi
description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, scorched soil, leather and a whiff of game follow over to the enveloping palate, along with juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and tobacco. It's already delicious and velvety, so no need to wait to enjoy. Drink through 2022.

title: Naggiar 2016 Estate Grown Root 49 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)
description: The tasty fruit flavors ring clear as a bell in this berry- and cherry-drenched and mouth-filling wine. It's grapey in a good way, very open and generous in character, and there's little or no oak to mask the fruit.

title: Boffa 2015  Barbaresco
description: This opens with varietal aromas of strawberry, new leather and tobacco. The savory palate offers crushed raspberry, clove and white pepper alongside solid, fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2021–2030.

title: Castell 2016 Casteller Kugelspiel Erste Lage Trocken Silvaner (Franken)
description: While hints of crushed stone and wild herb are demure on the nose, fresh white peach, quince and tangerine are bold and fruity in this dry white. It's light bodied yet silky, with a lingering green herb finish.

title: Castello d'Alba 2015 Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: A wine that is dominated by old-vine Touriga Nacional, it comes from vineyards in the Douro Superior. Its powerful tannins are reinforced by the immense black fruits and dry core from wood aging. This is not a wine from the faint-hearted. Drink from 2020.

title: Cusumano 2017 Alta Mora Bianco  (Etna)
description: Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit and crushed herb delicately drive the aromas. Reflecting the nose, the fresh, savory palate delivers juicy yellow pear, lemon zest, wild sage and a graphite note. A saline note perks up the linear finish.

title: Cuvaison 2016 Mariafeld Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Light cranberry and strawberry flavors show impressive depth and breadth in this full-bodied expressive wine. Cola and cinnamon provide spicy seasoning that melds well with the fruit, the entirety textured in layers of velvety softness.

title: Devona 2015 Mount Richmond Vineyard Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: As Devona wines are still produced in Walla Walla, these single vineyard efforts bear only the generic Oregon AVA on the label. This Elk Cove vineyard is now part of Devona's single vineyard lineup. Principally Pommard clone, it spent time in 30% new French oak, adding scents of toast and cigar box to the mix. The cherry fruit also has a tobacco flavor component, and the firm, smooth tannins finish with a touch of black tea.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This estate white is full of crushed rock and wet stone elements that blend with tones of apple, oak and salt. Light bodied and restrained, it shows a wealth of structure and aging potential. Enjoy 2020–2025.
designation: Year of the Ram Single Vineyard

title: Dunning Vineyards 2015 Reserve Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Dark cherry and boysenberry aromas meet with a hint of anise on the nose of this bottling from Paso Robles' Westside. Flavors of strawberry compote and boysenberry paste are lifted by clove and gingerbread on the rich palate.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light aromas of black raspberry, cranberry jam and a hint of oak smoke kick off the nose in this study of a popular clone. The smoky elements mask the fruit at first on the sip, but ripe berries and mulberry slowly arise alongside the charred pork flavors, bolstered by a long-simmering acidity.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Feudi Studi Candriano  (Taurasi)
description: French oak, mature plum and exotic spice aromas form the nose. The palate is tight and primary, offering sour cherry, cranberry, espresso and a hint of bitter cocoa alongside drying, close-grained tannins that clench the finish. Don't even attempt until after 2025.

title: Foxen 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Lighter in the glass, this appellation blend shows pomegranate sorbet, cranberry skins, rose petals and wild herbs on the nose. The palate is crisp and tart with raspberry fruit that's lifted by chaparral spice and wild thyme.

title: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2016 Rosso Passorosso  (Etna)
description: Woodland berry, smoke, wild rose and Mediterranean scrub lead the way on this vibrant red. Racy and succulent, the savory, focused palate delivers juicy strawberry, red cherry, star anise and chopped herb alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. A saline note gives it a tangy finish. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Grace + Vine 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Candied aromas of ripe cherry meet with dark wild herbs and a hint of cedar on the nose of this bottling from a secret dream team of regional vintners. The wood element shows on the sip, where flavors of red plum and mulberry are lifted with fennel frond and herbal spices.

title: Grgich Hills 2016 Fumé Blanc Estate Grown Dry Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A grip of reduction on the nose in tones of flint and matchstick is consistent for the producer's style. On the palate are light-bodied layers of green olive, pineapple, peach and lemon, a contrasting set of fruit and savory elements that work seamlessly together.

title: Irene Badalà 2017 Santo Spirito Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Aromas of Spanish broom, orchard fruit, baked bread and wild herb form the nose. On the full-bodied palate, fresh acidity lifts raspberry compote, candied orange zest, and a hint of pastry cream. The finish lends a tangy mineral note evoking oyster shell.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy, seductive and soft, this well-made wine offers tones of forest floor, pomegranate and strawberry. It delivers plenty of flavor beneath a delicately crafted body.

title: J. Wright 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Firmly anchored in black fruits, this is the current release (mid-2018). Details include black olive and coffee grounds, lightly applied, and the wine shows impressive depth and flavor persistence. It's truly a reserve-level Pinot at an entry-level price.

title: J Wrigley 2016 828 Single Clone Estate Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Firm and precise, this pushes tart cranberry/raspberry fruit up front, with a seam of citrus oil and rind. Grapefruit highlights and lemony acidity flow into a lingering finish, with a comet's tail of chocolate.

title: Johannishof 2017 Johannisberg V Kabinett Riesling (Rheingau)
description: There's an earthy complexity to this Kabinett, suggesting notes of smoke, dried earth and candle wax melding into brighter tones of tangerine and lemon. Light on its feet and delicately honeyed, it finishes on lingering bolts of lemon and lime acidity.

title: LaRue 2014 Rice-Spivak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Succulent and bright, this interweaves crunchy red fruit into a cohesive whole of balanced freshness and high-acid tenacity, the tannins supportive in providing weight and grip.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Cammi Ridge Vineyard Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Dried blackberries, pepper-crusted meats and dried lilac aromas make for a lively nose on this bottling. The palate combines roasted meat with plump berry flavors, proving quite juicy, and even veering into candied red-apple and melon flavors.

title: Xavier Flouret 2017 French Blonde  (Sancerre)
description: Produced by the Millet family, this ripe wine with touches of minerality is about rich fruits and balanced acidity. Hints of apricots and pineapple balance the citrus thread that goes through the wine. Drink now.

title: Zonte's Footstep 2015 Avalon Tree Cabernet Sauvignon (Fleurieu Peninsula)
description: This is a full-bodied wine that is rich and likable. Black cherry, vanilla and green bell pepper notes are held up by a dusty, earthy spine and drying, tight tannins. This could use some time for those tannins to soften. Drink now–2028.

title: Ca'Romè 2013 Chiaramanti Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Cedar, espresso and grilled herb aromas lead the nose. The assertive palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and toasted oak alongside raspy tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Colosi 2014 Passito Moscato (Terre Siciliane)
description: Made with dried Moscato grapes, this opens with aromas of beeswax, candied apricot and marzipan. The sweet, straightforward palate offers chestnut honey and almond.

title: Acumen 2014 Mountainside Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 7% Merlot plus smaller amounts of Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this well-made wine is understated in its rich rounded smoothness, decadent in black cherry and a caramelized taste of vanilla.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Terras de Cartaxo Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: Cartaxo is a village on the west bank of the Tagus river that's home to eastern-facing wine vineyards. This wine, bold and fruity, shows the warmth of the vineyards, bringing out fine black fruits, rich tannins and final juicy acidity. It is young and packed with fruit at this stage and will certainly be better from 2019.

title: Aljibes 2014 Selectus Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Ripe aromas of blackberry, prune, vanilla and cola are a high point on this muscular blend from Albacete in warm central Spain. A soupy palate could be dismissed as too heavy and woody. Flavors of clove, chocolate and thick berries are minty, chocolaty and a bit hot on the finish. Lovers of massive reds will be happier than fans of leaner, more traditional Old World wines.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Balletto 2017 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a crisp, clear and freshly focused wine, direct in its lemon freshness and strong flavors of grapefruit, green apple and tenacious acidity.

title: Baron Albert NV L'Universelle Brut  (Champagne)
description: This open, fruity wine offers good acidity and a soft texture. The 70% Pinot Meunier in the blend, grown in the Marne Valley, gives a rounded, warm character to the wine. Drink now.

title: Batasiolo 2014 Brunate  (Barolo)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting porcini mushroom, tilled soil, new leather and star anise that carry over to the austere palate along with clove, dried cherry and powdered sage. Tight close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity provide support. Drink 2019–2024.

title: Battaglio 2015  Barbaresco
description: This opens with underbrush, mocha and dark-fruit aromas. The assertive palate offers sour cherry, tobacco and clove alongside bracing tannins that lead to a clenching finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Bel Vino 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Freshly smashed red fruits meet with hints of pine oil and herbs on the nose of this bottling. It lands somewhat sweetly on the palate with ripe red cherry, and then comes a wave of light, pleasant herbs.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 DOM Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: The nose is initially quite earth-laden, but opens with aeration to reveal delicate aromas of tangerine and lemon zest. A pristine white-grapefruit flavor on the palate is marked by hints of lime and salt. This is a dry, briskly composed wine to enjoy now–2023.

title: Bodegas Caro 2015 Caro Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Compact aromas of prune and desiccated berry fruits lead to a plump but somewhat flat palate that's lacking in verve. Burnt, spicy black fruit flavors include a note of green, while this blend is distinctly herbal and minty on the finish.

title: Bougrier 2017 Domaine Guenault Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: This soft, ripe wine has attractive layers of apricot fruitiness as well as crisper citrus acidity. Together these two flavors give the wine delicious freshiness and zesty acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Broadside 2016 Margarita Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dried berries, loamy earth and dried mint show on the nose of this fairly priced Cab that's great for everyday sipping and versatile with a variety of foods. The palate combines dried plum flavors with a strong sense of dried herbs and earthy elements.

title: Bulas 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This sweeter style of Port has generous tannins surrounded by full blackberry fruits. It is rich, certainly, packed with fruit and with a core of dryness that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2027.

title: Buttonwood 2016 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This fresh, twist-top bottling makes for a great weekday table win, starting with aromas of light red fruit, oregano and damp wood. There's a strong herbal kick to the palate, which gives depth to the tangy cranberry fruit and lighter texture.

title: Ca' del Baio 2013 Asili Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with toasted oak, tobacco and dark-skinned fruit aromas. The taut palate offers sour cherry, mocha and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Cortes de Cima 2015 Amphora Red (Alentejano)
description: Fermented and aged in clay amphorae, the wine is full of red-berry flavors. It has a lean character, bringing out tannins and acidity as well as the fruit. The juicy fruit and attractive balance of the wine show that it is ready to drink.

title: Coyote Canyon 2017 Albariño (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Pleasing aromas of pear, melon and banana chips are followed by pure fruit flavors with a rounded feel. It brings a pleasing snap of acidity on the banana-filled finish.

title: Cusumano 2017 Alta Mora Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Delicate scents of wild rose, woodland berry and Mediterranean herb lead the nose. The fresh palate offers red currant, pomegranate and a hint of saline alongside tangy acidity.

title: D'Arenberg 2016 The Olive Grove Chardonnay (McLaren Vale-Adelaide Hills)
description: Bursting through the gate with peach, lemon balm and ginger spice, this is a medium-bodied, fruity little number with a good whack of toasty oak. It's simple but enjoyable.

title: Delfino 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Umpqua Valley)
description: A buttery mouthfeel and a palate loaded with sweet spices make this instantly charming. It's forward and certainly flavorful, though off-center as far as varietal specificity. Aged 18 months in French oak, how much was new unspecified, it hides its black cherry fruit in a wash of spicy tannins.

title: Di Meo 2010 Vigna Olmo Riserva  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, underbrush, withered violet, black-skinned grape and eucalyptus mingle with a whiff of wet fur that eventually blows off. The palate is rather evolved, showing prune, espresso, clove and toasted hazelnut alongside drying tannins.

title: Domaine Fouassier 2016 Sur le Fort  (Sancerre)
description: Light, bright and still fresh, this is a fruity wine. Its acidity, green fruits and light texture push it forward and lead to a refreshing, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Domaine Jean-Paul Balland 2016  Sancerre
description: This perfumed, red-cherry-flavored wine has just a hint of wood. It is young and full of juicy fruit with a dry core that will soften to give a rounded, bright wine. Drink from 2020.

title: Domaine La Croix Canat 2017 Chantepleure  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Under the same ownership as Domaine Tinel-Blondelet, this estate has made a crisply textured wine, intense with acidity and still very young. Its freshness and brightness need to soften, so drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2017 Enclos de Malmbray  (Sancerre)
description: Malmbray is the home village of the Roblin winery. The Kimmeridgian chalk soil gives intensely crisp wines, like this, that are full of taut citrus and herbal flavors. Drink from 2019.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Fumé Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This remains one of the best wine values on the planet: a Loire-style, stainless-steel fermented beauty that the winery has been making for 46 years. Guava, peach and apricot surround buzzy acidity in a crowd-pleasing quaff of undeniable quality and freshness.

title: Emerald Hare 2016 Red (Mendocino)
description: This is an elegant, dry wine with great balance, a sleek texture and plenty of black-cherry and dark plum flavors. Equal parts Zinfandel and Merlot plus a dash of Cabernet Sauvignon form the blend. Good acidity and moderate tannins give it some nice heft on the palate and there is little oak influence to take away from its fruit focus.

title: Encostas de Estremoz 2017 Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: As its name indicates, this wine comes from vineyards around the hilltop town of Estremoz. It is a young fruity wine with soft tannins and open juicy black-fruit flavors. It is rich and ready to drink.

title: Gratavinum 2011 2?R Red (Priorat)
description: Raisiny aromas of prune and desiccated cassis feed into a full pudgy palate. This is rich to the breaking point, with ultraripe flavors of baked plum and berry fruits. Chocolate is the main flavor on an oaky, thick finish.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2014 Cold Fusion Red (South Coast)
description: This blend of Grenache, Syrah and Petite Sirah starts with tart red-currant aromas mixed with marjoram, oregano, light licorice and soil. The lighter-bodied palate is strongly herbal and minty.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2017 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)
description: All about ripe, tropical fruits and freshness, this is an immediately attractive wine. It is open, easy and developing quickly. Already the bright fruits and tangy acidity are forward and refreshing. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Hyland 2016 Dijon 115 Old Vine Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: The winery has added “Old Vine” and “Single Clone” to its labels, though without much information as to how old the vines may be. It's an unregulated term to begin with, so specific information would be welcome. Purple berries, orange juice and some alcoholic burn comprise this rather straightforward effort. Drink now–2022.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County-Santa Barbara County)
description: Sonoma County provides the majority of the fruit for this multi-appellation red, a bold, richly layered wine with grippy, gritty texture. Full-bodied boysenberry flavor upholds seasonings of licorice and cardamom, remaining velvety on the finish.

title: J Wrigley NV Jubilation Rosé of Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Sealed with a crown cap and sporting a festive label, this bursts forth with lush fruit flavors of hard cherry candy and strawberry soda. You won't mistake it for true Champagne, and you won't mind that a bit. It's fresh, lively and flat-out fun.

title: Jacquart NV Extra Brut Mosaïque  (Champagne)
description: This wine makes up for the low dosage with the clean, perfumed richness of the fruit. A blend of all three main Champagne grapes, but with a slight preponderance of Chardonnay, it has a crisp texture, touches of minerality and a bright, lively and freshly fruity aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2017 Rioja Bordón Rosé (Rioja)
description: Peach and fleshy cantaloupe aromas are on the wan side. This blend of Garnacha and Viura lacks acidity, and hence is aimless on the palate. Dry, powdery flavors are less than exact, while this shows little to no kick on the finish.

title: Monowai 2017 Pinot Rosé (Hawke's Bay)
description: Deep orange/pink in color, like that of drying rose petals, this wine falls on the flat and overripe side, with a cabbage-like vegetal quality amidst the dense red berry fruit. The palate is heavy and finishes on a bitter note.

title: San Pedro 2017 1865 Selected Vineyards Pinot Noir (Elqui Valley)
description: Aromas of latex, iodine, cocoa powder and spiced red currant are funky in an Elqui way. A tight, drawing palate is far from elegant, while this tastes of weedy currant and plum. A pervasive green character lingers on the finish.

title: Univitis 2016 L'Heritage du Marquis de Greyssac  (Bordeaux)
description: This soft, lightly tannic wine suggests red berries and a touch of spice. The wine is open and ready to drink.

title: Black Box 2016 Red (California)
description: This wine has a brothy veggie aroma and fruity flavors that are slightly sweet and overripe like raisins and prunes. It is medium bodied and a bit syrupy in texture.

title: Millésimé 2014 Orange Muscat (Santa Barbara County)
description: Nutty and oxidized on the nose, this bottling offers an apple-cider aroma. Sour yellow apples show on the sip.

title: Montecillo 2017 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Aromas of chewing gum are about all this lacking rosé has to offer. A flat, chunky palate announces a wine that's quickly fading, while this tastes bitter and fruitless on the finish.

title: Viaggio 2014 Outta the House! Tempranillo (Lodi)
description: This is a basic table wine, light and a bit brownish in color, that tastes a little tired and has flavors like tea and raspberry vinegar.

title: Errazuriz 2017 Max Reserva Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Herbal, gamy aromas are short on fruit and ripeness. This feels big but awkward and out of balance. Saucy plum and red currant flavors are broken and taste of oak and chicken fat. A clipped finish confirms that this is a strained and lacking Pinot Noir.

title: Maison Hebrard 2016 Bel Air  (Bordeaux)
description: This unfocused wine has hard tannins and a firm structure. What's missing is the fruit, which may not come through.

title: Paal 2014 01 Syrah (Navarra)
description: Out of the chute, this Syrah is downright weird, with roasted, funky aromas of red fruit, citrus and green herb. A fleshy, sticky, thick mouthfeel is lacking in balance, while this tastes of burnt, nutty berry fruits that finish green and herbal.

title: Estampa 2017 Reserva Viognier-Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)
description: Light floral and lemon aromas are chemical and unconvincing. This odd blend of 90% Viognier with 10% Chardonnay is dilute in feel. Briny melon flavors have no depth, while this is flat on the finish due to low acidity.

title: Junta 2018 Reserve Momentos Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)
description: Aromas of clove, mint and wood grain smell cheap and a bit fake. This Cabernet is thick and grabby, with rough tannins. Clove, oak and generic berry flavors finish with a lasting flavor of artificial minty oak.

title: Berberana NV Gran Tradición Semi Seco Sparkling (Cava)
description: Mint gumdrop is about the only discernible aroma this off-dry Cava offers. A thick, chunky palate is unrefined and lacking in vitality and clarity. Briny yet sweet white fruit flavors are oddly tomatoey on the finish.

title: Messina Hof 2017 Dry Cuvée Sauvignon Blanc (Texas)
description: This wine is offers pungent aromas of banana, gooseberry and gummy bears. The palate brings more of that intense banana along with Macintosh apple and pineapple. Zippy lime acidity flows through out ending on a grapefruit pith and green banana note.

title: Cigar Box 2016 Old Vine Hand Harvested Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Soupy, grassy aromas announce an underripe, unimpressive Cabernet. A chunky, gummy palate holds green, grassy flavors of mint, alfalfa and clove. Weedy berry flavors and drying tannins confirm that this is sketchy at best.

title: Butternut 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Piney, petrol aromas and smoky, oaky, herbal flavors give an unusual profile to this medium-bodied wine. It's not what most people expect in a Chardonnay.

title: Casas del Bosque 2015 Gran Reserva Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
description: A bright gold color and briny, oily aromas of mango, nectarine and pumpkin are more common to a late-harvest Pinot Gris than to a dry Chardonnay. A viscous palate is tired and seemingly spent, while this tastes of botrytized, oxidized stone fruit along with squash.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2016 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Up front, there's no fruit to this and instead aromas of rot and chemicals. A bitter flavor profile dominated by grape skin and petrol culminates in a flat and tasteless finish.

title: Roblar 2016 Estate Petit Verdot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Fresh aromas of black raspberry, lavender, wet gravel and cedar are an impressive welcome to this estate focus on a variety that's rarely used alone. The palate balances chalky, firm tannins with black-currant, blackberry-jam and dark slate flavors.

title: Terredora Di Paolo 2011 Pago dei Fusi  (Taurasi)
description: Pipe tobacco, star anise, baking spice, blue flower, menthol and blackberry aromas are front and center in this fragrant red. On the taut, medium-bodied palate, fine-grained tannins give structure to crushed raspberry, juicy Marasca cherry, licorice and a hint of incense. Drink 2021–2031.

title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2015 Sisters Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The Sisters designate references the vineyard's three Pinot plantings—Blanc, Gris and Noir. Planted in 1987, the mix of Pommard and Wadenswil clones is scented with orange blossoms and shows elegant flavors of watermelon and strawberry. Clean and fresh, this wine, as with all the Eyrie Pinots, will age quite beautifully.

title: Tornatore 2015 Trimarchisa Rosso  (Etna)
description: Aromas of tobacco, menthol, coconut and a whiff of oak-driven spice lead the bouquet of this wine. The firm, focused palate boasts fine-grained tannins that lithely support flavors of dried black cherry, ripe raspberry, star anise and espresso. Drink 2020–2025.

title: Quinta do Sagrado 2016 Sagrado Tinto Red (Douro)
description: This concentrated wine is packed with tannins and dark fruit. Still young, it has a firm structure, rich fruitiness and acidity and a solid dry core. With all this power, it needs to age. Drink this fine wine from 2021.

title: August Kesseler 2017 The Daily August Riesling (Rheingau)
description: There's an invigorating lime and mineral exuberance to this wine that's reminiscent of a gin and tonic on a blistering summer afternoon. It's a light-bodied, frisky Riesling full of crisp-tart green plum, lime and lemon flavors. The finish is long and refreshingly mineral. Enjoy now–2023.

title: Barale Fratelli 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)
description: This fragrant red opens with aromas of rose petal, new leather, wild berry and menthol. The racy ethereal palate offers wild strawberry, sour cherry, star anise and thyme framed in polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2024.

title: Bernardus 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Elegantly earthy on the nose, this bottling starts with aromas of pomegranate, rose petals and dried herbs. The palate is quite tart with flavors of sour Montmorency cherry, and the savory dusting of herbs and baked earth balances the sip.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: While demure on the nose, sweet yellow peach, mango and melon flavors are exuberant on the palate of this sun-kissed Kabinett. Medium-sweet in style, its offset by zesty lemon-lime acidity and just a hint of slate minerality. A delightfully juicy wine to enjoy now through 2023 for its dazzling fruit and perfume.

title: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2015 Carodorum Crianza  (Toro)
description: Blackberry-jam aromas are full, flush and lush, but not what you'd call complex. A choppy lively palate with bruising tannins isn't shocking for Toro, while this tastes of ripe black fruits, mocha and chocolate. Despite having massive tannins, this Crianza finishes just smooth enough. Drink through 2024.

title: Boniperti 2014 Barton  (Fara)
description: Vibrant and loaded with finesse, this delicately fragrant red offers scents of wild berry, star anise and aromatic herb. The linear elegant palate delivers strawberry compote, crushed raspberry, orange zest and white pepper framed in bright acidity and refined tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: Bouchié-Chatellier 2016 Premier Millésimé  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This is called “premier” because the grapes in this wine were the first to ripen in 2016. It has a perfumed character with good acidity to balance the tangy, herbal fruits. The texture and the fruit are now fully integrated and this wine is ready to drink.

title: Brandlin 2013 Henry's Keep Proprietary Red (Mount Veeder)
description: From the proprietor's mountain estate, this combines 73% Cabernet Sauvignon with 14% Malbec, 7% Petit Verdot and 6% Cabernet Franc. Together, they mingle in a planky, oak-driven midpalate of compost, cedar and blackberry, with swathes of dark chocolate running through.

title: Briceland 2017 Phelps Vineyard Chardonnay (Humboldt County)
description: Rather reserved in style, this wine from remote Humboldt County on the Pacific Coast offers mild fruity, savory aromas, a good broad mouthfeel and flavors that blend pear and apple with more mineral and flinty accents. It's not overtly oaky but interesting and subtle.

title: Bruno Paillard NV Première Cuvée Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: A selection from 35 Champagne vineyards, this nonvintage cuvée is ripe and mature, with a great balance between fruit and secondary flavors. It shows a fine poise and is ready to drink.

title: Cálem 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Jammy and luscious, this ripe wine's tannins are embraced by the rich texture. Its structure and big blackberry flavors are already well integrated giving a wine that has both great fruit and a backup of tannins. Drink from 2026.

title: Cascina Bruciata 2013 Rio Sordo Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of red berry, underbrush and tobacco lift out of the glass. On the structured palate, firm acidity balances red cherry, cinnamon, vanilla and a sprinkling of nutmeg while fine-grained tannins leave a polished mouthfeel. Drink 2022–2029.

title: Cellers Baronia del Montsant 2010 Clos d'Englora AV15 Red (Montsant)
description: Rich aromas of coffee, mocha, tobacco and formerly ripe but now dried berry fruits are highly appealing and shout quality. A rushing palate is full of acidity and unresolved tannins, while vanilla notes soften core cherry and plum flavors. A racy, amped finish suggests that this still has some years to go; drink through 2022.

title: Clos La Chance 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Rounded aromas of honeysuckle, lemonade, tangerine rind and gardenia make for a nose that's both broad and sharp on his wine. The palate is crisp and tight with citrus, but also shows Pink Lady apple, ripe pear, white peach and a pinch of salt.

title: Davey Family 2013 D Block Reserve Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: Showing signs of age in all the best ways, this wine displays heady aromas of chocolate, mint, plum, dried oregano, black olive and cedar. Warming woody notes are particularly prominent on the palate and an earthy, herbal backbone is supported by ultrafine tannins. Drink now–2023.

title: The Archivist 2017 Rosé (Lodi)
description: This light-bodied wine has a vivid light ruby color, plenty of ripe and fresh strawberry and cherry candy flavors and a soft, almost sweet balance.

title: Treleaven 2016 Estate Bottled Semi-Dry Riesling (Cayuga Lake)
description: A straightforward nose of citrus and orchard fruit carries to the delicately semidry palate. It's light in feel, with quiet impressions of apple, lemon and stone.

title: Trus 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Band-Aid and latex aromas are big parts of a jumbled nose. In the mouth, this is basic, with sappy acidity and chewy thickness. Meaty plum and cherry flavors are oaky and a touch green, while this is generic on the finish.

title: Vallobera 2015 Familia San Pedro Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Oak-blanketed plum aromas are barely up to the heavy clove and rubber notes that are out front. A choppy, tannic palate qualifies as rough, while this tastes more of oak, clove and spice than vivid fruit.

title: Woop Woop 2016 Shiraz (South Australia)
description: This wine shows notes of sour red fruit and peppery spice. The palate is medium to full-bodied, with tart acidity and drying tannins.

title: Xavier Frissant 2017 Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: A grassy wine with green fruits and gooseberry flavors, this is light and bright. It has instant freshness and is ready to drink.

title: Yellow Tail NV Bubbles Sparkling (Australia)
description: A rather basic, fruity sparkler, this exhibits a ripe apple note, a creamy texture and some residual sugar.

title: Avancia 2016 Cuvée de O Mencía (Valdeorras)
description: Furry, fluffy aromas of cotton candy and berry jam announce a wiry wine with hard tannins. Grapy plum and sour berry flavors are gamy as a whole. This Mencía remains challenging, hard-edged and not fully satisfying through the finish.

title: Bodegas Lacort 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Cherry and hand-soap aromas barely make the grade. This feels raw and lean. Cranberry and plum-skin flavors finish herbal, spicy and not really ripe. This is a highly snappy Crianza without much flare.

title: Bougrier 2017 Pure Loire  (Rosé d'Anjou)
description: The candy-pink color is a precursor to the sweetness of this wine. Strawberries are cut with squeezed-lemon flavors. The wine is bright and ready to drink.

title: Burgo Viejo 2016  Rioja
description: Stewy tomato and raisin aromas open this Garnacha. A plump sappy palate is jammy as a whole, while this tastes of cooked plum and canned tomatoes. A finish without much depth or length closes out this marginal wine.

title: Buttonwood Grove 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: Quiet aromas of canned lychee, potpourri and pollen ride under a sheen of corn syrup on the nose. Medium in weight, with a slightly oily feel, this offers light fruit flavors pepped up by disjointed, tart acidity.

title: Dante Robere NV Two Cellar Rats V Red (California)
description: Charred oak and wood smoke aromas make this full-bodied wine a two-note song. It tastes as toasted and oaky as it smells, not letting much fruit flavor show through.

title: Luigi Bosca 2016 La Linda Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Berry and plum aromas are woolly and far from fresh. In the mouth, this passable Malbec is wiry and sharp, with tangy acidity. Savory, saucy plum flavors finish salty and leafy.

title: Pierre Chainier 2017 Les Parcelles Marc Dupas  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This light, gently peppery wine has crisp citrus fruits and a bright, floral character. It is fresh and ready to drink.

title: Sagelands 2017 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A darker medium peach/salmon color that doesn't draw the eye. Aromas of strawberry and herb lead to dry fruit flavors. It doesn't all sync up.

title: Sepal Estate 2017 Soft Red (California)
description: This is a light and lightly sweet wine that looks like a dark rosé, smells very fruity and tastes like cherry juice. It is simple and soft: something to please people who don't like dry wines.

title: Septima 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Heavy oak aromas are chemical at first, then more civil and familiar after airing. A jammy, pulpy palate holds plum and saucy berry flavors. On the finish, this Malbec is savory tasting and lacking in fruit.

title: Trivento 2015 Golden Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)
description: Spicy, minty, borderline herbaceous berry aromas are covered in oak, while this is pulling on the palate, with tomato-like acidity. Herbal, slightly salty and baked berry flavors are spicy in front of a soft, short finish.

title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Rosé Sparkling (Vinho Verde)
description: Soft, sweet and fruity, this is an appealing wine because it has enough crisp acidity as well. It is bright and fruity and, of course, ready to drink.

title: Besserat de Bellefon NV Cuvée des Moines Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Ripe and fruity, this wine also has a tight texture that adds pleasure as well as complexity. It is full of red berry flavors that contrast with the tangy, mineral character that makes this style of wine so good with food. Drink now.

title: Bougrier 2017 Alain de la Treille Cabernet Franc  (Chinon)
description: Ripe and packed with red-berry flavors, this lightly perfumed wine is made to drink young. The smoky, stalky character should soften over the next few months, but enjoy the wine now for its juicy fruit.
designation: Alain de la Treille Cabernet Franc

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)
description: Relatively light and easy-drinking for the varietal, this wine is not too dark in color, has friendly berry and plum flavors and medium body. Some tannin does come through in the texture but the wine stays smooth.

title: Cellers Unió 2016 Perlat Garnatxa (Montsant)
description: Ripe berry and plum aromas are thick and a bit strained. On the palate, this Grenache is tannic and rubbery in feel. Baked berry and raisin flavors show a chocolaty richness on the finish. Overall, this is mostly good but a little lacking in top-to-bottom balance.

title: Chanoine NV Cuvée Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This soft rosé is full of strawberry flavors and attractive acidity. It is fruity, with a ripe character that gives this Champagne a gentle aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Cinnabar 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Roasted pear, light banana and baked-earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Muddled flavors of pome fruit, lemon peel and melon arise on the palate, which is a touch flat in texture.

title: Claude Baron NV Cuvée Perle Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This attractive, crisp wine is full of perfumed, fresh fruits and tangy acidity. It is lively, with a dry character that keeps the fruitiness right up front. Drink now.

title: Cline 2017 Ancient Vines Mourvèdre Rosé (Contra Costa County)
description: Fresh herb and strawberry aromas are followed by vivid raspberry flavors in this medium-bodied smooth and rather soft-textured wine. Being made from the Rhône grape variety Mourvèdre, it's an interesting twist on rosé.

title: Coelho 2016 Atração Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A three vineyard blend, this is tightly wound and strongly herbal. Earthy beetroot and tart cranberry flavors dominate. The wine saw one-quarter new oak for 10 months, but the flavor impact was minimal.

title: Collina Serragrilli 2015 Starderi  (Barbaresco)
description: Subdued aromas of toasted oak, espresso and sage emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers hazelnut, clove and roasted coffee bean alongside assertive astringent tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Côte West 2016 La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoky oak and a meaty component give this wine an interesting complexity amidst high-toned, tangy elements of rhubarb and strawberry. The tannins are thick and present.

title: Crápula 2016 Gold 5 Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Blackberry, licorice and burnt-wood aromas comprise the nose on this blend of Monastrell and Syrah. A flush palate features rubbing tannins, while a charred oak flavor covers up berry and plum notes. On the finish, this remains oaky and chocolaty, but dry in feel.

title: Domaine du Loriot 2017  Menetou-Salon
description: The style of Sancerre's smaller neighbor is less intense when young and, like this wine, readily drinkable in the year after harvest. A crisp texture is nicely integrated into ripe apple and yellow-fruit flavors. Drink now.

title: Domaine Pierre Marchand & Fils 2017 Les Loges  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Les Loges is one of the focal points of fine Pouilly Fumé. This wine has some of the richness associated with the area while at the same time being easy and accessible. White fruits dominate and the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Encosta do Sobral 2015 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)
description: A powerfully rich, wood-aged wine, this exhibits a solid structure although the alcohol does show strongly. That gives an edge of burnt pepper that leaves a bitter taste. The fresher side of the wine with black-currant fruits and acidity goes some way to balance. Drink now.

title: Et Fille 2015 Heredity Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: An herbal nose, redolent with composted earth, leads into a thin wine with tart flavors of wild strawberry. It spent 10 months in barrel, but no indication of new oak is detectable.

title: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2017 Wilhelm Schiefer Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pronounced smoke and slate tones lend savoriness to crisp tones of pineapple and tangerine in this off-dry Riesling. A white grapefruit flavor lends sharp hits of tartness and bitterness to the finish, but it's a refreshing wine to enjoy now–2022.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2017 V Verdelho (Alentejano)
description: One of a range of varietal wines from this vast estate, this is ripe and properly perfumed as befits the Verdelho. It is smoothly textured, hinting at apricots and showing ripe spicy pear flavors. Drink the wine now.

title: Husch 2016 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: This wine has fresh fruit and baking-spice aromas that lead to a supple texture and tangy apple-skin flavors. This medium-bodied wine is a sure crowd-pleaser.

title: Hyland 2017 Old Vine Gewürztraminer (McMinnville)
description: The back label posits this as a “dry” style, but there's plenty of fruit sweetness nonetheless. Peach and citrus rind flavors come with a sprinkling of powdered sugar. It's a fairly significant change from the aromatic and detailed 2016 version.

title: Conveyance 2015 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The winery indicates this is a reserve, but that term is well hidden (if there at all) on the label. Firmly tannic, with tightly wound cherry and cola flavors, this finishes with some dark, charred notes.

title: Cortes de Cima 2017 Dois Terroirs Branco White (Alentejano)
description: One of a pair of similarly named red wines, this fruity blend, from two different vineyards areas, includes Viognier and Verdelho, Softly fruity, with a touch of earthy spice from the barrel aging, the wine is open and generous. Drink now.

title: Crossbarn by Paul Hobbs 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Rich and round, the tannins in this full-bodied wine are sweet and elongated, with a midpalate of cassis, crayon wax and mocha swirling around one another and smoky, toasted oak.

title: Cusumano 2017 Angimbè Tenuta Ficuzza White (Terre Siciliane)
description: A blend of 70% Insolia and 30% Chardonnay, this has aromas of ripe pear, acacia and a whiff of bread crust. The linear palate evokes yellow apple, citrus and bitter almond alongside fresh acidity. A salty note marks the close.

title: Delamotte NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine is full, with a rich mousse and a soft character. The red-currant flavor is cut by a mineral texture as well as light acidity. Nothing is in excess, and this wine is bright and ready to drink.

title: Domaine Anthony Girard 2017 La Clef du Récit Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This rich rosé is full of red fruits balanced by good acidity. Red-berry flavors dominate, giving the wine ripeness as well as structure. Drink now.

title: Domaine Armand Gaston 2017  Menetou-Salon
description: With a light touch, bright acidity and layers of mineral acidity, this wine is packed with fruitiness that contrasts with the tight texture. Drink this pure, crisp wine now.

title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2017 Origine Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This attractive red-fruit-flavored wine has a soft texture. The acidity and warm strawberry flavor are nicely balanced, crisp and ready to drink now.

title: Educated Guess 2016 Red (North Coast)
description: This full-bodied wine offers a ripe fruit aroma that is generously shaded by tones of vanilla, nutmeg, cedar and smoke. It has a touch of tannins that strengthen the texture.

title: Flower Garden 2017 Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Pink grapefruit flavors are mouthwatering and juicy in this fruity, uncomplicated Riesling. Hints of salt and grapefruit pith on the midpalate lend a Paloma-like refreshment. A light-bodied, approachable sip to enjoy now–2020.

title: Fowles Wine 2016 Ladies Who Shoot Their Lunch Wild Ferment Pinot Noir (Victoria)
description: An easygoing, plush style of Pinot, this wine displays notes of ripe red berries and oak spices. There's a rush of tart acidity on the palate, along with spicy, grainy tannins.
designation: Ladies Who Shoot Their Lunch Wild Ferment

title: Golser Wein NV Una Bubbly Rosé Sparkling (Burgenland)
description: A lively pink froth immediately signals ease and enjoyment. Floral overtones on the nose along with confected berry fruit continue with the same fruity ease on the off-dry palate, where strawberry notes take over. An easy, fun, pink party fizz. Drink soon.

title: Graham Beck 2013 Premium Cuvée Méthode Cap Classique Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Robertson)
description: This is delicate and reserved in aromatic profile, with hints of apple, melon rind and fresh straw that lightly dance in the bouquet. It's a bit more boastful in character on the palate, with a round texture that's balanced by medium carbonation and a brisk minerality that shines through and picks up the finish.
designation: Premium Cuvée Méthode Cap Classique Blanc de Blancs Brut

title: Guerra 2017 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Raspberry, plum and black currant aromas are bright and fruity. This everyday Bierzo feels fresh and lively, with flavors of cassis and raspberry buoyed by rubbery tannins.

title: Hermann J. Wiemer 2016 Semi-Dry Estate Bottled & Grown Riesling (Seneca Lake)
description: Aromas of lemon rind, green pear and ginger spice offer a moderately concentrated nose. The palate shows a light impression of juicy apple and lemon-lime, ending brisk and clean.

title: Jean Laurent NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This ripe wine is ripe has a soft character from its relatively high dosage. That makes for a wine that is rich and fruity, with a gentle aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Ken Forrester 2014 Sparklehorse Méthode Cap Classique Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: This wine has a pronounced yeasty, autolytic character that rides atop scents of dried apple skin, grilled challah, pie crust and orange peel. A lively mousse and mouthwatering acidity helps to keep the palate in check, lifting the rich and toasty flavors through the finish. Drink now.

title: Kramer 2015 Cardiac Hill Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: All of Kramer's new Pinots are surprisingly low in alcohol, but then again, much of the winery's fruit goes into sparkling wines, which are always picked earlier. This Pommard/Dijon 115 blend shows light blue fruits and some of the same chicken yard funkiness as the Rebecca's Reserve.

title: Kramer 2015 Rebecca's Reserve Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: A curious wine, which starts out aromatically intriguing with roses and raspberries. In the mouth some funky chicken yard flavors come in, closing down the finish. Hard to tell if further bottle aging will curtail or enhance that funky finish.

title: Lamadrid 2016 Single Vineyard Reserva Malbec (Agrelo)
description: Ripe, raisiny aromas include barrel-based notes of vanilla, cocoa and graphite. Hailing from a cool, rainy year like 2016, this is surprisingly full, extracted and traditional is style. Raisin and cassis notes carry the flavor profile to a slightly syrupy finish.

title: Krone 2015 Twee Jonge Gezellen Vintage Rosé Cuvée Brut Méthode Cap Classique Sparkling (Western Cape)
description: A pale coppery pink color, this opens with scents of strawberry hull, watermelon rind, pomegranate pith and a touch of toasted biscuit. There's a pleasant plushness to the mouthfeel, thanks to a creamy mousse and bright red-fruit flavors, but it's balanced by ample acidity and lime-like acidity that shines on the finish.
designation: Twee Jonge Gezellen Vintage Rosé Cuvée Brut Méthode Cap Classique

title: Langmeil 2015 The Freedom 1843 Shiraz (Barossa)
description: Made from vines planted in 1843, Langmeil turns out a full throttle, unmistakably Barossa red. Familiar notes of ripe red and black fruit, chocolate and peppery spice carry to a silken palate with a toasty line of oak.

title: Le Masciare 2012  Taurasi
description: This has enticing aromas of tobacco, spiced plum, exotic spice and balsamic notes. The brawny, concentrated palate offers steeped prune, black cherry extract and licorice alongside fine-grained, velvety tannins. You'll also notice the heat of alcohol that throws the finish off balance. Drink through 2024.

title: Left Coast 2015 Right Bank Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Made from 100% Pommard clone grapes, this flavorful wine comes front loaded with broad streaks of cherry cola, vanilla and Kahlua. Half was made in stainless, half in French oak. After that initial burst the wine seems to tail off rather quickly, leaving drying tannins.

title: McManis 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: Smooth, well balanced and lightly fruity, this light-bodied wine offers peach and cantaloupe flavors, with a supple texture and just enough acidity for freshness.

title: Novy 2015 Ramal Vineyard Syrah (Carneros)
description: Fantastically seductive in aromatics of brambly blackberry and chocolate, the flavors continue along the same theme, dotted in vanilla. Thick, dense and richly ripe, this wine packs a powerful punch and lingers in creamy texture on the finish.

title: Olelo 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This is a very solid Cab for the price, starting with aromas of roasted blackberries, black plums and oak. There is fairly prominent tannic structure on the palate, presenting flavors of roasted plums and berries and a hint of coffee.

title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Merlot (Mendocino County)
description: This is a sturdy, well-balanced wine, with supportive tannins and refreshing acidity that carries ripe flavors of blackberry and black cherry. It will be just the thing for a steak, roast or stew.

title: Pata Negra 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Chunky berry aromas are spicy and dense, but a touch flat. On the palate, this Crianza is smacking, with lively acidity. Plum and berry flavors are generic but good, while this toes the same flavor line on a solid finish. Drink through 2019.

title: Purple Hands 2016 Latchkey Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This pure Pommard clone offering has a lightly leathery scent, and a nice mix of marionberry fruit and baking spices. Though tasters vary as far as likes/dislikes regarding Brett, there's a trailing bitterness here and a sense that this would be best consumed while it's young.

title: Riofavara 2014 Sciavè Red (Eloro)
description: Aromas of dark berry, grilled herb and whiffs of toast come to the forefront. Made mostly with Nero d'Avola, the firm palate offers espresso, blackberry jam and black pepper alongside assertive tannins. It finishes on a star anise note.

title: Riofavara 2014 Spaccaforno Red (Eloro)
description: Made predominantly with Nero d'Avola, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, baking spice and Mediterranean brush. The easygoing, juicy palate doles out ripe Morello cherry, licorice and star anise alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Riverbench 2015 Cork Jumper Rosé Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Light aromas of pear cider and lemon rinds show on the nose of this bottling, which is one of the more popular bubblies from the Central Coast. The palate offers dried apples and apple-cider flavors, with a touch of earthy dust.
designation: Cork Jumper Rosé Blanc de Noirs

title: Rozes 2016 Quinta do Grifo Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a very floral wine, with tight fruit and a mineral edge that contrasts with the layer of spirit and black fruits. The wine is in a light style, fruity while also structured. Drink from 2026.

title: Sanguinhal 2016 Quinta de S. Francisco Red (Lisboa)
description: Made by the Sanguinhal team at another estate owned by the same family, this wine is spicy, firm with dry tannins, and with black-coffee and black-fruit flavors. Its richness will allow this wine to age well and it will be ready from 2020.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2017 Lester Family Vineyards Partners' Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
