description: This is a smooth round style of rosé that has rich red-berry fruits and a lightly zesty structure. It is perfumed, ripe and full of fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Cortes de Cima 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)
description: Vineyards close to the Atlantic Ocean are the source of this bright, herbal wine. It has hints of tropical fruit although the main fruitiness comes from lime and pink-grapefruit flavors. Drink now.

title: Domaine Philippe Raimbault 2017 Apud Sariacum Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This soft, round rosé offers flavors of toasted almonds and spice as well as red-berry fruits. Pale in color, the wine has restrained acidity, giving just enough lift at the end. Drink now.

title: Et Fille 2015 Kalita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Though many 2015s are evocative, balanced wines with good structure and tension, Et Fille has released wines with unusually low alcohol and concurrently green flavors. Acidity and chalk underscores light, wild berry flavors, with a burst of celery accenting the green character.

title: Exitus 2016 Red (California)
description: A touch of Bourbon-like sweetness softens this full-bodied wine that is very fruity, smooth and easy to sip. It doesn't go to the smoky extremes of others in this category, and has an eye-catching bottle design that evokes an old-fashioned whiskey bottle.

title: Josh Cellars 2015 Family Reserve Red (Lodi)
description: Vanilla and milk chocolate aromas lead to jammy plum and strawberry flavors and a touch of maple syrup in this medium-bodied, soft and slightly sweet wine.

title: Karl Josef 2017 Piesporter Michelsberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Tart, cutting white grapefruit and green plum flavors are accented by bramble in this easygoing, light-bodied Riesling. It's delicately sweet and finishes briskly. Drink now.

title: Kendric 2015 Reward Ranch Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This medium-bodied wine is well-balanced, moderately flavorful and has a good, gripping texture. Light red cherry and cranberry are the flavor focal points.

title: Knapp 2017 Dry Gewürztraminer (Cayuga Lake)
description: Ripe yellow apple, canned lychee and rose water aromas carry to the medium-bodied palate. Balanced by a mild vein of acidity, this is dry in style, with a slightly bitter floral finish.

title: Love That Red 2017 Love That Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A medium salmon color, with strawberry, herb and apple aromas that are followed by sleek fruit flavors, with pink grapefruit notes on the finish. The concentration doesn't hold together throughout.

title: Paris-Simoneau 2017 Antoine Simoneau Cuvée AS Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: This aromatic, fruity wine offers good acidity with a lightly herbal touch. Fresh apple and pear flavors are cut with tangy acidity. Drink this crisp, clean wine now.

title: Pelissero 2015 Vanotu  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with subdued aromas of toasted oak, roasted coffee beans and coconut. The dense palate offers dried sage, prune, clove and espresso alongside grainy, astringent tannins.

title: Quinta do Arrobe 2015 Oculto Red (Tejo)
description: This fruity wine has touches of wood as well as well-integrated tannins. Its ripe red fruits are balanced by the acidity that gives the wine a rich, succulent aftertaste. It is ready to drink.

title: Quirus 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Odd aromas of lemony oak and scented soap are dominant and block out this Crianza's fruit scents. A pinched high-acid palate holds soupy tomatoey flavors of savory red plum and currant. On the finish, this is tart, with rubbing tannins.

title: Ramón Bilbao 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A heavy nose is oaked to the point that this Crianza smells mostly of charred wood and shoe polish. Oak-dominant flavors of herbal berry fruits and plum mixed with baking spices conclude with a resiny aftertaste.

title: Roque Colás 2013 Viticultura Ecológica Red (Calatayud)
description: A dark, dense and spicy nose is saturated and oaky, but appropriate for this thick gummy style of Garnacha-Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon. Blackened berry and chocolate flavors taste of fudge on a sticky finish. Overall, this has its good and bad points.

title: Sanguinhal 2016 Peninsula de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)
description: This wine comes from the northern part of the Lisbon peninsula, the land bounded by the Tagus river on the east and the Atlantic Ocean to the west. It is a richly fruity blend of Aragonez and Castelão bringing out fine acidity as well as broad blackberry fruits. Drink the wine now.

title: Serafino 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: There are pleasant ripe plum and cinnamon aromas in this wine, but there's also a synthetic dish soap and dusting polish character that's distracting. The palate is on the hot side, with herbal, woody notes and tightly wound, leathery tannins.

title: St. Christopher 2017 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: While the nose is a bit earthy and brambly, there's plenty of zesty lemon and lime flavor on the palate of this off-dry wine. It's light bodied and juicy with a lacy sugariness that lingers on the finish. Drink now.

title: Steenberg NV Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc (Constantia)
description: This has all the classic Sauvignon Blanc characteristics—fresh-cut grass, green gooseberry, lime leaf and peppery fynbos—in an effervescent, lean and bright package, with high acidity and lively carbonation. Drink now.

title: Lynmar 2016 Block 10 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Slightly reductive, oaky and robust in tannin, this is a powerful expression of its particular site, planted to a mix of clones. Red cherry is pronounced along with a floral component of rose and earthy thread of crushed stone.

title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: A perfumed wine, this has structure, fine tannins and a rich texture. It is full of black-currant and berry fruits as well as concentration and juicy acidity. This wine will develop gently and be ready to drink from 2027.

title: Quinta do Vallado 2016 Adelaide Vintage  (Port)
description: The wine is dominated by big bold tannins that give a sense of great power. That produces a wine with a strong structure, and a dry edge that will need to soften. Drink this dark firm wine from 2028.

title: Siduri 2016 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is a heady, powerful and delicious wine from a famous vineyard by veteran winemaker Adam Lee. Plump red cherries, star anise and vanilla shine on the nose, leading into a beautifully full palate loaded with red currant, dark cherry and baking spice. The acid sings into the finish.

title: Trisaetum 2015 Family Reserve MMXV Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A step beyond the Estates Reserve, this is even richer. Full-bodied flavors of plum, fig, cherry and chocolate come with a highlight of sea salt. It's supple and well knit, showing especially good concentration in this outstanding vintage. The structure for long-term aging is all in place. Drink now–2028.

title: V. Testulat NV Cuvée Prestige Brut  (Champagne)
description: Half and half Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, the top cuvée from this producer is well balanced and ripe, with a great contrast between the white fruits and the mineral texture. Flavors of stewed fruits and hints of apricots give character to this ripe, elegant wine. It is ready to drink.

title: Animo 2016 Heritage Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is an exotic, 100% varietal wine given impressive time to mature before release. It's worth the wait. Flinty, it offers plenty of body around a wealth of well-developed pineapple, grapefruit and lemon-squeeze flavors, finishing in balance and with lingering complexity.

title: Antico Castello 2012  Taurasi
description: This opens with aromas of underbrush, scorched earth, spiced plum and balsamic. The juicy, delicious palate doles out fleshy black cherry, black raspberry, star anise and baking spice alongside polished tannins. It closes on a salty mineral note. It's structured and already enjoyable but will also offer fine sipping over the next few years. Drink through 2022.

title: Archery Summit 2015 Arcus Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: A captivating bouquet weaves together scents of breakfast tea, citrus and barrel. The flavors offer a glorious mix of lemon, yellow plum, pie cherry, chocolate, coffee grounds and black licorice. It's complex and detailed all the way through a lingering finish, with all these diverse components beautifully integrated. Drink now–2025.

title: Archery Summit 2015 Red Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Forward and fruit-driven, this offers lush aromas and a full-throttle dive into the depths of what has proven to be a truly outstanding vintage. Berries, pie cherries, ground coffee and cocoa combine in a lovely effort. It rolls along smooth and detailed into a lush and lingering finish.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Mendocino)
description: Made from organic grapes, this wine has an impressively deep color that stays concentrated right to the dark-red rim. The nose brings violets, blueberries and black pepper, and the flavors gush dark fruit and dark chocolate, with hardly any oak influence. A surprisingly gentle layer of fine-grained tannins smooths the texture and soothes the palate. Best after 2023.

title: Bergström 2016 Winery Block Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Bottled only in magnum in 2016, this was aged in a single French oak foudre. It was mostly whole clusters, hence stem-driven savory notes are abundant. There's a delicious mix of sassafras, sandalwood and cola threaded around strong black cherry fruit. Just a light whiff of compost adds further detail.

title: Bründlmayer NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Both fresh and baked red apple appear on the nose, alongside a very subtle, floral dimension. The palate is creamy and adds a rich, autolytic roundness to the fresh and lemony fruit. Subtle dosage lets these flavors shine and presents a wine that is slender, rich, subtle and elegant at the same time. The finish is lasting and lemony.

title: Colombo NV Silvì Metodo Classico Riserva Rosé (Alta Langa)
description: Strawberry, cherry, baking spice, bread crust, citrus and ginger aromas follow through to the fresh, creamy palate. A soft, silky mousse lends elegance.

title: Cristom 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This very limited production wine is barrel fermented and bottled unfiltered. Succulent flavors seamlessly blend sweet/tart Meyer lemon, peach pie and butterscotch. The wine is rich, ripe, creamy and long. Enjoy it now–2023.

title: Davies 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This well-modulated, well-balanced and delicious wine has everything in place from the light baking-spice and red-cherry aromas to the black-cherry, raspberry and rhubarb flavors to the tangy and palate-cleansing mouthfeel. It's especially good for the “regular” Anderson Valley bottling.

title: De Ponte Cellars 2015 Baldwin Family Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The top wine from De Ponte, this spent 14 months in 50% new French oak. The fruit is concentrated and delicious, a mix of ripe strawberries and cherries, and the satiny finish adds highlights of chocolate-covered orange peel. With ample aeration you may dive right in, or cellar a bit longer and drink from 2020 to 2030.

title: Domaine Serene 2015 Grace Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Aromatic and complex, this nicely detailed release has benefited from a bit of extra bottle aging. Berry, cherry and plum flavors are well integrated, buoyed by supporting acidity and a mocha barrel tone. Drink now–2025.

title: Domaine Vacheron 2016 Les Romains  (Sancerre)
description: Opulent and rich, this wine offers intense, ripe yellow-fruit flavors and crisp citrus acidity that are enhanced by the concentrated texture. It is just now ready to drink but will age further, at least until 2022. Its name refers to the Romans who came to Sancerre.

title: Germano Ettore 2014 Prapò  (Barolo)
description: Forest floor, rose petal, wild herb and a balsamic whiff of eucalyptus lead the nose. The palate is elegant and structured, offering strawberry compote, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and star anise alongside polished tannins. A hint of crushed mint lingers on the finish while bright acidity lends balance. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Domaine Roger & Christophe Moreux 2017 Les Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)
description: This wine comes from possibly the most famous vineyard in Sancerre with an impossibly steep slope. Tight, textured and rich, it is still young and firm, with a strong mineral character. It needs to age, so wait for this rich, spicy wine until 2020.

title: Domaine Serene 2016 Coeur Blanc White Heart Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A white wine produced from Pinot Noir grapes, this opens with a burst of citrus fruits—orange, grapefruit and lemon pith. The core flavors call ripe apples to mind rather than berries, and barrel fermentation brings up crème brulée in the lingering finish.

title: Fontanabianca 2015 Bordini  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of rose petal, leather, red berry and a balsamic note lead the nose. The savory vibrant palate doles out crushed raspberry, clove and white pepper alongside close-grained, refined tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2030.

title: Forget-Brimont NV Blanc de Blancs Premier Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: The north-facing slopes of the Montagne de Reims provide the fruit for this wine. As much as 50% of reserve wine in the blend has given it both richness and a sense of poised maturity. It also fills out the mineral texture, emphasizing ripe white fruits and a full aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Premier Cru Brut

title: Giacomo Fenocchio 2012 90 Dì  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of carob, leather, dark spice, forest floor and balsamic notes slowly take shape in the glass. On the firmly structured palate, firm, noble tannins carry dried morello cherry, star anise, aromatic herb and tobacco. Drink 2022–2030.

title: Jean-Max Roger 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)
description: Densely textured, this ripe wine still has plenty of freshness. Although it rich and packed with citrus and white fruits, it also has a strong mineral character that needs to soften. Age this wine until 2019.

title: Kessler-Haak 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Saucy aromas of black cherry, red plum and spicy ginger snaps show on the nose of this reserve bottling. The spice quality overtakes the sip at first before the tart cranberry fruit and wild-herb flavors return to round out the experience.

title: La Prevostura 2014  Lessona
description: Rose, wild berry, a whiff of dried aromatic herb and dark-spice aromas delicately float from the glass. Elegantly structured, the tense, focused palate offers crushed raspberry, strawberry, white pepper and an almost salty note. Polished tannins and bright acidity give linear support. Drink 2022–2032.

title: Lelarge-Pugeot 2011 Les Meuniers de Clémence Extra Brut Pinot Meunier (Champagne)
description: This wine shows the wonderful Pinot Meunier grown in this village close to Reims. Rich and very approachable at seven years, the wine also has a great texture and taut character that keeps it lively and complex. Drink now.
designation: Les Meuniers de Clémence Extra Brut

title: Lynmar 2016 Quail Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine exudes notes of cherry, blueberry and pine forest on the nose. The palate offers plenty of savory notes within its full-bodied folds of grippy tannin and toasted oak. Complex and compact, it will hold well in the cellar. Enjoy 2021–2026.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Georganne Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an oaky and powerfully structured wine, with a fleshy opening of orange, red cherry and tea-laced forest floor. The tannins are strongly etched in grippy ripeness and structure.

title: Mitolo 2014 Marsican Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: Mitolo's top wine, made only in the best vintages, is a deep well of blackberries, blueberries, chocolate, coffee and white pepper. It's rich and velvety in texture, with soft edges and ultrafine tannins. Despite its richness, it is balanced and finessed. Drink now–2038.

title: Neely 2016 Bee Block Spring Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: From 38-year-old vines on the northern limits of the appellation near Portola Valley, his bottling offers sunshine-loaded aromas of cooked lemons, yellow peach and damp wood. The palate is broad and strong with flavors of sandalwood, roasted apples and toast with preserved lemon spread.

title: Panther Creek 2016 Lazy River Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This lushly fruity wine opens with tangy berry fruit and juicy, mouthwatering acidity. Blueberry and blackberry flavors come forward in a fresh, youthful wine that already demonstrates excellent balance and lingering precision. It's taut, tasty and age-worthy. Drink now through the late 2020s.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Hudson Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Full, fleshy and complex, this is a beautifully layered and nuanced wine, well integrated with a bite of acidity and grip. Peach, pear and anise all play a part in bringing it to life, allowing room for further development in the glass.

title: Paul O'Brien 2014 La Dame Red (Southern Oregon)
description: This Right Bank-styled Bordeaux blend is principally Merlot, with 20% Cabernet Franc and 10% Malbec. Supple and complex, it features dark fruits and muscular, polished tannins. There are suggestions of dried straw, coffee grounds and smoke, and the tannins carry a sort of black tea astringency. Drink this with a choice cut of beef or lamb.

title: Quinta de São José 2016 S.J. Vintage  (Port)
description: While the wine has plenty of acidity to keep the fruit fresh, it also has a core of fine tannins to give structure. It is a dry style of Port, firmly anchored in both black-currant fruits and a concentrated texture. Drink this fine wine from 2028.

title: Riverbench 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There's an intriguing gamy kick to the nose of this appellation blend, giving depth to the red-cherry, Earl Grey tea, sagebrush and sarsaparilla aromas. The mouthfeel is full and loaded with acidity, offering flavors of dried sage, more tea leaves, hibiscus and floral potpourri.

title: Robert Biale 2016 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)
description: From the cooler reaches of the Napa Valley, this historic vineyard site provides an earthy, spice-filled entry of cocoa powder and black pepper, rubbed in dried herb. Rounded and rich in red fruit, it has grip and concentration, a heady ripeness that's balanced by ample acidity.

title: Schloss Johannisberger 2015 Gelblack Feinherb Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Light in body yet deeply penetrating, this off-dry wine offers loads of fresh tangerine and lemon flavors accented by saffron, spice and caramelized honey. It's an irresistibly drinkable wine balanced by pert acidity and a delicate hint of sweetness on the finish.

title: McPherson Wine Company 2016 MWC Pinot Noir (Victoria)
description: This Victorian Pinot walks a tightrope between fruit and spice, offering up ripe cherries and currants alongside black pepper and a touch of baking spice warmth. Firmly in the medium-bodied spectrum, the sinewy yet silky tannins and earthy core balance out the juicy red fruit.

title: Michael David 2016 Petite Petit Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: This admittedly huge wine offers tamed tannins, with a generous dose of spicy oak and a hint of sweetness that seem to absorb some of the astringency. It comes off as very concentrated and flavorful, showing an almost velvety texture.

title: Miles 1997 Tinta Negra Tinta Negra Mole (Madeira)
description: This wine comes from the workhorse grape of Madeira which has the ability to produce both dry and sweet wines. This wine, in the style of a rich Bual, has both treacly richness and the intense acidity associated with a Madeira. It has been aged in wood since 1997 and is ready to drink.

title: Navarro 2016 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: This barrel-fermented wine from an Anderson Valley institution has very nice balance, lots of juicy, fresh and ripe apple and peach flavors and a lightly tangy texture due to good acidity. It's medium bodied, easy to sip and will please a lot of different palates.

title: Occhipinti 2015 Il Frappato (Terre Siciliane)
description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, blue flower, wild berry and game fill the glass. The gamy note carries over to the succulent palate along with raspberry compote, crushed strawberry and dark baking spice. Polished tannins and fresh acidity provide supple support. Open at least a few hours ahead of serving to let this breathe.

title: Omen 2017 Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)
description: This California producer jumps into Southern Oregon with a bright, spicy bottle of Pinot Noir, blending grapes from the Wooldridge Creek Vineyard and the Rock'N R Ranch. Big, broad flavors of cranberry, pineapple, vanilla and toast deliver plenty of pleasure. Drink while it retains its freshness, now–2020.

title: Oregon Territory 2015 Tempranillo (Oregon)
description: An outstanding value, this is the second label from Tempranillo specialist Paul O'Brien. It offers a boatload of mixed flavors and accents, with citrus, fig, cherry tobacco and bourbon tea all well represented and supported with lively acidity.

title: Paraduxx 2014 X2 Estate Red (Napa Valley)
description: Generous tannins present as chalky and grippy in this wine, which offers an herbal wrapping of cedar, graphite and red currant. Boldly flavored and built, it's substantial on the palate.

title: Pietradolce 2017 Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Delicately colored, this salmon-hued rosato offers enticing scents of white spring flower, wild berry and a whiff of Mediterranean herb. On the structured palate, you'll find white cherry, strawberry and a hint of baking spice set against tangy acidity.

title: Prinz Salm 2017 Two Princes Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Intense lemon and lime flavors are accented by hints of mineral in this off-dry Riesling. Racy acidity is balanced elegantly by a lavish, silky mouthfeel and long, clinging finish. Enjoy now–2021.

title: Quinta da Alorna NV Abafado 5 Years Fernão Pires (Tejo)
description: Aged in wood for five years, this lightly fortified wine is full of apricot and orange-zest flavors. Its rich toffee edge is balanced by the fresher aftertaste. Drink this attractive dessert wine now.

title: Raiza 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This wine is carried by aromas of earth, spice, cherry and plum. For a crianza, this is a serious medium-bodied wine. Spicy dark-berry flavors come with a touch of cocoa prior to the lasting finish, with leftover spice notes and slow-fading fruit. Drink through 2019.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2015 Cellar Select Meritage (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas of pencil shavings, black peppercorn, oregano and elderberry frame the nose of this blend of 32% Merlot, 28% Cabernet Sauvignon, 18% Petit Verdot, 12% Cabernet Franc and 10% Malbec. It's tightly wound on the palate, where a dried cherry flavor meets with dried herbs and cracked pepper, lifted by a dash of acidity.

title: Résonance 2015 Résonance Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This is the estate vineyard bottling from Maison Jadot's Oregon project. As 2018 will mark the first vintage made in the new Résonance winery, it's not surprising that some variation will be found in previous vintages, which were made in a borrowed facility. The 2015 is sharp and peppery, with dark fruits, supple acids and hints of char and smoke. The tannins, at first a bit gritty, smooth out with some hours of breathing time. Best drinking window here may be 2020–2025.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Falleri Vineyard Zinfandel (Calistoga)
description: This is a tiny production wine for the producer. It's also among the producer's lightest and most delicate. High-toned cherry and strawberry fruit support a floral, herbal entry of beautiful perfume, the texture soft and in balance.

title: Round Pond 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Soft and supple in milk chocolate and cherry, this wine contains 2% Petit Verdot. Dried herb, sage and pencil shavings contribute a savory complement to the richness of the ripe fruit.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Grapeful Red (California)
description: Good fruit concentration meets firm structure in this very full-bodied well-extracted wine for a winning, bold personality. Blackberry, boysenberry and wood smoke meld with ample, soft tannins for a mouthful of flavor and a generous texture to boot.

title: Sean W. McBride 2016 Kim Giles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: Minty and herbal on the nose, this delicately layered wine is light in body. Lemon peel, cranberry and pomegranate highlight the palate, giving an exotic edge to the wine.

title: Simonsig 2016 Kaapse Vonkel Méthode Cap Classique Brut Rosé Sparkling (Western Cape)
description: Made from 64% Pinot Noir, 34% Pinotage and 2% Pinot Meunier, this opens with medium-intense aromas of strawberry hull, white cherry and apple core, with a hint of decadent white chocolate in the background. It's medium in weight, with a moderate mousse and ample acidity that complements the just-ripe fruit flavors.
designation: Kaapse Vonkel Méthode Cap Classique Brut Rosé

title: St Hallett 2014 Gamekeeper's Shiraz-Grenache-Touriga Red (Barossa)
description: A blend of Shiraz, Grenache and Touriga, all three varieties shine through without any influence from oak. Ripe strawberry, rose water and game tones carry to the palate that is round and luscious but not overblown. Drink slightly chilled with charcuterie or duck rillette.

title: Château de Bligny NV Clos du Château de Bligny Cuvée 6 Cépages  (Champagne)
description: This wine provides a reminder that Champagne is not just Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier. In addition, this blend incorporates Arbane, Pinot Blanc and Petit Meslier. The resulting wine is ripe, perfumed and full of concentrated creamed-apple flavors allied to tight acidity. It is ready to drink.
designation: Clos du Château de Bligny Cuvée 6 Cépages

title: Alphonse Mellot 2017 La Moussière  (Sancerre)
description: This wine comes from Mellot's home domaine of La Moussière, It is young and intense, with a mix of spice, concentrated citrus and crisp acidity. The depth of flavor in this wine is extraordinary and merits aging. Drink from 2020.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Les Herses  (Sancerre)
description: Like all Alphonse Mellot wines, this is produced from biodynamically grown grapes. That enhances the pure and dense fruit texture, the minerality and extreme richness. It needs to age, and will be best from 2020.

title: Bergström 2016 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Possibly the most sought-after vineyard in the Willamette Valley. Shea fruit shines everywhere. This example is delineated with lively aromas of roses and raspberries. A taut, earthy flavor of beetroot runs through the palate, with a kiss of cinnamon coming up in the finish. This wine should continue to improve over many years. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Bernardus 2016 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Black cherry, black plum and violet aromas make for a deep, intense yet elegantly balanced nose on this bottling from the legendary vineyard. Candied cherry and boysenberry flavors show on the sip alongside black and purple sage, all wrapped in compelling tannic tension.

title: Bruno Paillard NV Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Extra Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: All this producer's wines are labeled Extra Brut, and therefore drier than Brut. This bottling has intense minerality bursting from the tight texture and crisp white fruits. Still young and fresh, the wine should age a little further. Drink from 2019.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Extra Brut

title: Cayuse 2015 God Only Knows Red (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The aromas aren't quite ready to reveal their charms on first pour, with notes of strawberry, smoked meat, ground rock and crushed flower emerging over time. The flavors are light but sumptuous, showing a lovely sense of texture.

title: CVNE 2014 Imperial Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Imperial Reserva is a personal favorite, and from a vintage plagued by rain this is a swinging success. Rich aromas of maple are prominent, with solid berry fruit as the canvas. Punchy acidity seems raw at first, but it's the proper carrying vessel for tangy, spicy dried-fruit flavors that settle on cranberry and plum. Drink through 2032.

title: Domaine Brochard 2016 Côte des Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)
description: Set on one of the majestic, steep slopes in Sancerre, this vineyard produces strongly mineral wines. This bottling is maturing well, softening the intense texture while leaving a tangy character. Rich white fruits are fully integrated with the acidity to give an ample wine that is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Divio 2016 Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Again in 2016 this is the ripest of the winery's Pinots, and it spent almost a year in one-third new French oak. The color is a plummy purple/red, and the well-integrated flavors mix red and blue fruits, with a light dusting of cocoa. The lingering finish adds streaks of mocha and caramel.

title: Domaine Laporte 2017 Le Rochoy Terre de Silex  (Sancerre)
description: This wine, produced like all Laporte wines from organically grown grapes, is impressive in its ripe fruit and minerality from the flinty soil. Still young, it has a tight texture but its style and balance already shine. With powerful citrus, orange zest and lime juice flavors, the wine needs to age and fully integrate. Drink from 2020.

title: Elk Cove 2016 Clay Court Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Made from Pommard and Dijon clones of Pinot Noir, this is a snappy, lip-smacking wine, loaded with tangy raspberry and blueberry flavors. Highlights of cola, tea and subtle streaks of savory notes contribute to the overall length and complexity.

title: Elk Cove 2016 Mount Richmond Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Supple purple fruits show perfect ripeness while rounding off in a lovely and satisfying midpalate. Barrel aging contributes a streak of espresso. Accents of black olive and clean earth are carefully moderated by smooth, polished tannins.

title: Guastaferro 2012 Primum  (Taurasi)
description: Pipe tobacco, mature black plum, exotic spice, violet and new leather are just some of the aromas you'll find on this structured red. The taut, full-bodied palate is still young and austere, offering dried red cherry, black raspberry, star anise and chopped herb set against a backbone of bright acidity and assertive, fine-grained tannins that grip the finish. Give this time to fully come together. Drink 2024–2037.

title: Johannishof 2017 Rüdesheimer Ramstein Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)
description: This dry, full-bodied wine has a density and weight that's seductive, but it feels a bit tight and closed now. Still, it offers nervy lime zest, lemon and earth characters that should open and yield with time. Hold till 2020, at least—it should reward with great texture and flavor complexity.

title: Lingua Franca 2016 Bunker Hill Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a thick, even meaty Chardonnay with plenty of power. It rolls through well-integrated scents and flavors of lemon verbena, chervil and both green and yellow apples. The balance is impeccable, and the length and detail promise another eight to 10 years of drinking pleasure. It finishes with a soft hint of butter.

title: Loimer NV Extra Brut Reserve Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Notes of fresh and baked green and yellow apple stream from the nose. They also pervade the palate, where finest fizz bursts its myriad bubbles with purest pleasure. Creamy notes of short crust are finely woven and merge with a bright, lively lemon freshness. The low dosage grants that extra thrill of purity. Classy, delicious, moreish fizz with a superlong finish.

title: Mailly Grand Cru 2007 Exception Blanche Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This producer is located in Mailly on the north slopes of the Montagne de Reims. The wine is everything this style should be: crisp, tight and mineral driven. Apple and the fresh citrus come through strongly even after 11 years. The wine is just ready to drink.
designation: Exception Blanche Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs

title: Matsu 2015 El Viejo  (Toro)
description: Blackberry and cola aromas are infused with game and a touch of oak-based vanilla. A flush palate is packed to the brim, while this tastes of ripe black fruit and chocolate. The warm finish is loaded with fudge and cassis flavors, and overall this checks all the boxes for an excellent, modern red wine. Drink through 2025.

title: Prinz Salm 2016 Wallhäuser Felseneck GG Grosse Lage Trocken Riesling (Nahe)
description: Delicate lemon and crushed mineral notes on the nose build in concentration on the palate of this full-bodied, dry wine. It's refreshingly juicy, offering bracing squirts of pristine lemon and grapefruit flavor, but framed elegantly by bitter lime zest and spine-tingling acidity. Drinks beautifully already but will improve through 2030.
designation: Wallhäuser Felseneck GG Grosse Lage Trocken

title: Jax 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Sonoma Coast)
description: This stainless-steel fermented wine is monumentally light in profile and easy to love. Refreshing waves of watermelon, strawberry and dried rose petal will conjure happy memories of footloose and fancy free days at the beach.

title: Jean Duclert 2012 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)
description: Partially fermented in wood, this wine dominated by Chardonnay is crisp, taut, tense and very mineral in texture. It is obviously young, emphasizing freshness and tart citrus flavors. However, it will soften to give a rounder and richer wine. Drink from 2020.

title: Johannishof 2017 Johannisberg S Kabinett Feinherb Riesling (Rheingau)
description: A touch of honey lends delicate sweetness to crisp white grapefruit in this easy-drinking off-dry wine. It's juicy and fruity but accented by savory notes of earth, dried thyme and lemongrass, too. The finish is moderately long, marked by bitter orange zest and a touch of green herbs.

title: Klinker Brick 2015 1850° Red (Lodi)
description: This big, robust wine blends spicy oak aromas and flavors with saturated blackberry and blueberry for a concentrated and layered effect. Made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah and old-vine Zinfandel, it is full bodied, moderately tannic and quite mouthfilling in texture.

title: Kreck 2016 Teldeschi Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From a site first planted in 1915, this is a tiny production of wine that's well worth seeking out. It speaks to old-vine dusty spice and dried sage, its texture softly beguiling and boldly full-bodied. It offers plenty of vigor and power.

title: Longevity 2017 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Get ready for a different take on Chardonnay in this earthy, layered wine. It has an unusually deep golden color, mature aromas like baked apples and a nutty, honeyed flavor akin to that of a late-harvest dessert wine. The flavors develop nicely with each sip and reveal subtleties of fruit and mineral that linger on the finish.

title: Lundeen 2014 La Cantera Vineyard Blanc de Noirs Brut Sparkling (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Made in the traditional method, this 100% Pinot Noir is a bright straw color, dry and tangy, with excellent length and precision. The flavors and color don't suggest Pinot Noir but might actually be mistaken for a blanc de blancs, except for a light lick of dark chocolate that trails the finish.
designation: La Cantera Vineyard Blanc de Noirs Brut

title: Lundeen NV Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)
description: Almost all Pinot Noir, with just 5% Chardonnay, this méthode Champenoise wine was barrel fermented and spent 20 months en tirage. It's a tawny gold and opens with a slightly earthy aroma that evolves into a complex mash-up of toast, butter, coffee grounds and tart fruits. The color and flavors suggest it's in a prime drinking window.

title: Macari 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Aromas of fresh stone fruit and sea breeze waft from the glass in this Chardonnay that see time in 85% second- and third-use French barrels, with the reminder new. It's silken and luscious on the palate, with ripe fruit tones held in check by a current of tangy crushed minerals and delicate vanilla.

title: Marrone 2015  Barbaresco
description: Underbrush, red berry and leather aromas unfold in the glass. The taut palate shows cranberry, clove, star anise and a crushed sage note alongside firm tannins that grip the finish. Drink 2021–2028.

title: Mastroberardino 2017 Lacrimarosa Aglianico (Irpinia)
description: Made entirely with Aglianico, this savory rosato delivers aromas and flavors of wild raspberry, creamy white peach, Mediterranean brush and a stony mineral note. Tangy acidity gives it a clean, fresh finish.

title: Midnight 2015 Solstice Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Rich aromas of blackberry jam, roasted meats and gravel are very well integrated on the nose of this bottling. The palate deftly balances pepper and charred meats with a strong black-currant core, adding touches of gravel and tobacco leaf toward the finish.

title: Navarro 2017 Rose of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Delicate and light, this wine has floral and red-cherry aromas, subtle berry and cherry flavors and good acidity. It tastes absolutely clean and fresh—just what most people want in a rosé.

title: Nicosia 2015 Sosta Tre Santi Metodo Classico Carricante (Sicilia)
description: Mature yellow apple and bread crust aromas carry over to the lively palate along with bitter walnut and a vanilla note. Fresh acidity and an elegant mousse provide the framework.

title: Olelo 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Broad, clean aromas of melon, mango and guava are cut by a chalky minerality on the nose of this bottling. Bright, tropical flavors on the palate glide along a river of fresh acidity.

title: Oso Libre 2013 Quixotic Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: A rich and ripe style of Cab, this bottling starts with almost sweet-smelling aromas of black cherry, blackberry and toasted oak. Framed by a chalky mouthfeel, the palate offers tangy flavors of blackberry alongside savory touches of pepper and dried flowers.

title: Paraduxx 2015 Rector Creek Block 5 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 52% Cabernet Franc and 48% Zinfandel from an estate site, this is a burly, pleasingly round and rich wine, layered in dark chocolate, blackberry and leather. The finishing touches include swathes of lingering cinnamon and toasted oak.

title: Patrice Moreux 2017 Corty Artisan Caillottes  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This wine comes from a four-acre parcel of stony soil. Closed and tight as is typical of young Pouilly Fumé, it promises rich white fruits for the future. Ripe and well structured, it will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Paul O'Brien 2015 Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)
description: Fermented in concrete, this also spent a year in one-quarter new French oak. Some vanilla scents emerge on first sniff, leading into fruit flavors of berry and plum. As the wine breathes open, it adds some refreshing citrus to the base, and with ample time fleshes out into a full-bodied, fine-tuned Pinot.

title: Pietro Rinaldi 2014 San Cristoforo  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of iris, leather, dark spice and a balsamic note lead the nose. The juicy slender palate offers cherry, pomegranate and white pepper alongside polished tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Grace + Vine 2015 CounterPoint Lot 1 Red (Paso Robles)
description: It's not entirely clear what this wine is a counterpoint too, although it certainly offsets the bigger richer wines that dominate Paso Robles. Bright aromas of grenadine, spicy hibiscus and cinnamon lead into a palate of juicy red cherry, pomegranate and rosewater. It's bright and refreshing.

title: Hager Matthias 2014 Sekt Traube Pur Blanc de Noir Zweigelt (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Delightfully creamy notes of both ripe and baked apples create a very appetizing nose, giving equal weight to autolysis and fruit. Beautiful, refreshing tartness marks the palate and frames the creamy richness perfectly. The palate is wonderfully light, despite its creaminess. The fact that this is brut nature gives a dry, taut finish where Zweigelt can display its peppery charms.
designation: Sekt Traube Pur Blanc de Noir

title: Hans Wirsching 2015 Iphöfer Kronsberg Alte Reben Scheurebe (Franken)
description: Lusciously fruity yet substantial and complex, this dry, full-bodied wine is plump in pineapple, grapefruit and yellow plum flavors. It's tropical in tone yet stately, nuanced by fresh, leafy undertones and savory hints of cashew and smoke. Rich yet briskly balanced, it should evolve well through 2023.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Vinha da Talha Vinhas Velhas Red (Alentejo)
description: The latest in the wave of amphora fermented wines, this blend of Trincadeira, Castelão and Aragonez is rich and smoothly textured. Its ripe tannins and open texture are reminiscent of wines fermented in open top tanks, giving ripe opulent black fruits. The wine is generous and full, ready to drink from 2020.

title: John Duval Wines 2015 Entity Shiraz (Barossa)
description: From one of Barossa's Shiraz masters, this is an earthy, herbaceous and almost delicate rendition of the grape that is known for richness and power. This wine's focus is on red forrest berries, plums, black pepper and dried leaves. The herbaceousness really shines on the palate, which, thanks to lifted acidity and fine, savory, structured tannins, makes this more than drinkable now, though it's capable of aging nicely over the next decade, too. Drink now–2028.

title: Joseph Perrier 2005 Esprit de Victoria Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Wonderfully mature, this complex wine has a pale color that is just showing some age. The richness has changed into a tighter character hinting at toast, with a mineral edge. It is ready to drink.

title: Joseph Perrier 2010 Blanc de Noirs Brut Nature Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: Pinot Noir from Cumières at the entry to the Marne Valley forms the basis of this rich, structured wine. Still young although with mature richness in sight, this dry wine relies on its ripe fruit to counterbalance the low dosage. In a year, maybe two, it will be splendid. Drink from 2019.

title: Kay Brothers 2015 Amery Vineyard Block 6 Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: The 2015 vintage of this historic winery's top wine still feels relatively young and primary. It's on the verge of revealing those characteristic complex and exotic savory spices but still keep them hidden away. Right now it shows pleasing aromas of cedar, plum, raspberry and licorice. The palate is where this wine hints at its ability to stand the test of time, as baking spices and plums fold neatly into stony, earthy tannins, creating a wine of power and grace. Drink 2019–2029.

title: Lingua Franca 2016 Avni Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Both the white and the red Avni bottlings provide fine and accessible introductions to the Lingua Franca lineup. This has a creamy mouthfeel and strongly oaky/toasty aromas, yet remains poised and nicely detailed. Bright acidity supports fresh fruit flavors of crisp apple and white melon. It's drinking well currently and should continue to provide pleasure into 2025.

title: Mac Forbes 2016 Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
description: There are subtle notes of Morello cherries, raspberries, meat, flowers and white pepper in this wine, which lead into a beautifully structured and complex palate. Herbal, savory, earthy and tangy all at once, the flavors are intertwined with superfine tannins and a long, mineral finish.

title: Mastroberardino 2014 Radici  (Taurasi)
description: Blackberry, truffle, fragrant blue flower and plum aromas follow through to the juicy palate along with baking spice and blackberry compote. Polished tannins lend finesse and structure. It's already delicious but will also offer good mid-term aging. Drink through 2024.

title: Melville NV Blanc de Noir Non-Dosé Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A faded shade of pink in the glass, this nonvintage bubbly offers rose petals, lemon, raspberry and chalk aromas. The palate starts with a sour strawberry and watermelon flavors, combining a strong tartness with recognizable and welcome fruit flavors.

title: Montaudon NV Classe M  (Champagne)
description: Made from Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this classy wine offers rich fruits, intense acidity and concentrated structure, which all point to a great future. Drink from 2019.

title: Nägelsförst 2016 Engelsfelsen Pinot Noir (Baden)
description: Slightly lifted aromas of black cherry and blackberry are nuanced by bramble and forest floor here. The medium-bodied palate offers succulent black fruit flavors offset by savory earth tones and revitalizing streaks of cranberry acidity. Very fine, ripe tannins and hints of soil and cocktail bitters linger on the finish.

title: Nicosia 2013 Sosta Tre Santi Metodo Classico Brut  (Etna)
description: Made entirely with Nerello Mascalese, this vibrant sparkler offers delicate, alluring scents of Spanish broom, Mediterranean scrub and a whiff of sea breeze. It's savory and elegant, offering lemon zest, ripe orchard fruit and bread crust aromas alongside a soft perlage and bright acidity. A saline note fills in the finish.
designation: Sosta Tre Santi Metodo Classico Brut

title: Paul O'Brien 2014 Il Rinnegati Red (Southern Oregon)
description: This stunning effort pays tribute to the Super Tuscan style, and it carries the weight of genuine experience. Co-owner/winemaker Scott Kelley worked several vintages in Montalcino on the Mondavi/Frescobaldi Luce/Lucente project. The blend here is 62% Sangiovese, 31% Merlot and 7% Syrah. The wine is both floral and fruity, still young and spicy. At first the barrel flavors seem a bit raw, but with decanting they smooth out and a pleasing black cherry and mocha flavor takes hold.

title: Philippe Fontaine NV Prestige Brut  (Champagne)
description: Dominated by Pinot Blanc, this blend emphasizes the richness of Champagnes from the Aube region. It has a ripe character of generous fruit and a broad texture that is balanced by a bright mineral note and tight acidity. Drink now.

title: Planeta 2017 Cometa Fiano (Sicilia)
description: White flower, apple, tropical fruit and wild herb aromas dance around in the glass. Reflecting the nose, the round, juicy palate doles out white peach, honeydew melon, citrus and a savory mineral note alongside soft but still fresh acidity that gives it a juicy finish.

title: Prima Materia 2014 Aglianico
description: Winemaker Pietro Buttita loves to tackle unusual grape varieties and he did a great job with this one. The wine is beautifully concentrated and focused, practically bursting at the seams with black-cherry and blackberry flavors that are extremely ripe and potent. It's so intense that the fruit notes cling to the tongue and sides of the mouth, echoing on the finish.

title: Quinta do Noval 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Very ripe fruit give this wine a surprisingly soft texture. It has generous tannins to go with this opulent fruitiness. The wine is going to age relatively quickly, so drink from 2026.

title: Winery by the Creek 2015 Estate Grand Reserve Red (Fair Play)
description: Excellent depth of fruit flavor makes this Cabernet Sauvignon-based blend a standout. There is little obvious oak flavor to detract from the very ripe, opulent black-cherry and blackberry flavors that soak through moderate tannins and fill the mouth with generous, layered richness. It has a fine structure for aging, too. Best through 2023.

title: Bründlmayer NV Brut Reserve Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Baked apple and the mellow ripeness of Golden Pearmain apple perfume the nose. The palate adds the creaminess of very fine fizz and the vivid freshness of lemon to this slender, elegant and very expressive Sekt. The finish is totally clean, brisk and utterly moreish. Just made for a classy apero.

title: Pyros 2014 Single Vineyard Block No. 4 Malbec (Pedernal Valley)
description: Salentein's new San Juan project is one to watch. This sunbaked Malbec is a touch desiccated on the nose, with ultraripe aromas of blackberry, prune, raisin and marzipan. A pure and layered palate is structured and not baked out. Toasty, blackened cassis and berry flavors reign, while this is chocolaty and tastes of wild berry fruits on the finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2015 Golpe Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Even the dark color of the wine suggests power and enormous richness. And there is no mistaking the dense texture, the licorice and dark-chocolate flavors that go with the black plum and tannins. It is not a shy wine and it needs some time. Drink from 2021.

title: Domaine Divio 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Pinpoint flavors compel your attention, with a mix of rhubarb, pomegranate and red berry. There's a sprinkle of oregano and well-managed highlights of coffee and toast from 10 months in one-quarter new French oak. This continues to be one of the finest values in a Willamette Valley Pinot Noir.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2014 La Moussière  (Sancerre)
description: This wine comes from the core estate in the Mellot vineyard. Rich black-cherry flavors are enhanced by the layers of wood and tannins. An intense wine, it shows the finest potential of Pinot Noir in Sancerre. Drink from 2019.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Les Romains  (Sancerre)
description: Even after two years, this wine is still young, serving as a reminder that great Sancerre needs time. For now, the tight apple and citrus fruits are intense and need to soften. Drink this wine from 2019 and the richness and beautiful fruit will be shining.

title: Attilio Ghisolfi 2014 Bricco Visette  (Barolo)
description: This fragrant red opens with aromas of wild berry, blue flower, menthol, and a whiff of exotic spice. The structured elegant palate offers raw strawberry, pomegranate, star anise and crushed mint alongside tense polished tannins and nervous acidity. Drink 2022–2028.

title: Bergström 2016 Le Pré du Col Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: The name means meadow on the hill. This is a compelling mix of black raspberry fruit, savory meat stock and a touch of sour plum. Details of fresh herbs come up through the residual flavors, and the overall balance extends the enjoyment.

title: Black Kite 2016 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Spicy, earthy and dark in fruit, this vineyard-designate offers integrated oak and a broad fleshy midpalate. Full-bodied richness and ripeness go hand in hand to make for a voluptuous expression of the grape from a tremendous site.

title: Brecon Estate 2016 Glenrose Vineyard Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Rich aromas of black currant, gingerbread, fresh lilac and jasmine slide into a meatier backbone on the nose of this bottling. It's soft on the palate at first and then spreads out to reveal blackberry, violet and roasted pork flavors, framed by solid acidity and fine tannins.

title: Château Guipière 2016 Goulaine  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: One of the newly created crus of Muscadet, Goulaine's vines are planted on schist soil. Aged for 18 months on its lees, this wine has extra richness, giving the ripe white and citrus fruits a chance to open out and show the link between terroir and textured fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Churchill's 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: The wine is richly balanced, with sweet prune flavors as well as a core of dense tannins. A touch of perfume, nothing excessive, gives the wine extra complexity and is already attractive. Drink this wine from 2027.

title: CL. de la Chapelle NV La Chapelle Ecrin Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This blend dominated by Pinot Noir with four years of aging conveys an attractive maturity while preserving the bright white fruits and acidity. These two elements add up to a rich wine that has a fine texture and delicious finishing acidity. Drink now.
designation: La Chapelle Ecrin Premier Cru Brut

title: Colombera & Garella 2014 Pizzaguerra  (Lessona)
description: Aromas of pressed rose, smoky flint, wild red berry and crushed aromatic herb slowly take shape on this polished, fragrant Nebbiolo. It's all about finesse, offering pomegranate, crunchy strawberry, white pepper and Lessona's hallmark salty finish. It's almost ethereal, with lithe tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2019–2029.

title: Cristom 2016 Louise Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This is the original block at the estate vineyard, and the wine remains tight and a bit astringent at the moment. Wild berries, orange peel and a touch of meat stock all combine, with stiff, chewy tannins. It has all the hallmarks of a wine that needs another couple of years to pull itself together. It should drink well through the 2020s.

title: Deutz 2013 Brut  (Champagne)
description: Typically Deutz, this stylish is wine full of fruit, with a crisp texture. A dry style and tautness go with the citrus flavors that are shot through with acidity. This well-structured wine is still young and will be best from 2020.

title: Domaine Divio 2016 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This puts a bit of emphasis on the herbal side of Oregon Pinot, without intruding on fresh, ripe raspberry fruit. There's a whiff of chicken stock, and notes of parsley and light baking spices. The wine spent 11 months in 40% new French oak.

title: Donnafugata 2014 Mille e una Notte Red (Terre Siciliane)
description: Underbrush, Mediterranean scrub, toast and exotic spice aromas leap from the glass. The concentrated, velvety palate doles out blackberry jam, ripe raspberry, vanilla and licorice, while tightly knit, fine-grained tannins provide structure.

title: Eguren Ugarte 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Blackberry, vanilla, sandalwood and oud wood aromas are a touch cheesy and warm but mostly alluring and of high quality. Intense and pulling on the palate, this warm-year Reserva tastes of blackberry, coffee and vanilla. Coconut, vanilla and unresolved oak flavors dominate a ripe finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Single Post 2016 Riesling (Mosel)
description: Crisp yellow pear and zesty tangerine aromas are marked by a hint of grain here. Medium-dry in style, the palate offers plump, sweet white grapefruit and tangerine flavors. An easy-drinking, refreshing wine to enjoy now.

title: Stemmari 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sicilia)
description: This 100% Cabernet Sauvignon opens with cassis, underbrush and star anise aromas. The easygoing palate offers black currant, vanilla and black pepper alongside round tannins.

title: Stemmari 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Nero (Sicilia)
description: Made entirely from Pinot Nero, this opens with red berry and baking spice aromas. The juicy, straightforward palate delivers strawberry and cinnamon alongside round tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: The Four Graces 2015 Foley Family Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Dark fruits are at the core, wrapped in more dark flavors of chocolate, graphite and charcoal. There's plenty of oak influence, and a strong vanilla streak. It's a big, chewy wine but lacks any Pinot Noir finesse.

title: Trabucco 2016 Erre Aglianico (Falerno del Massico)
description: Tobacco, coconut and balsamic aromas emerge from the glass. The linear palate delivers prune, clove and mocha alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.

title: Trullo 2017 Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Lemon, lime and salty mineral notes are prominent in this sheer, off-dry Riesling. It's medium bodied with an invigorating, brisk finish. Enjoy now –2021.

title: Viña Otano 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy aromas of wet clay share space on the nose with strawberry and cotton-candy sweetness. A lively palate is high in tartaric acidity, while this tastes of roasted plum, savory red-berry fruits and spice. On the finish, this shows a mild note of prune.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2007 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A fresh berry aroma is overpowered by an earthy overtone in this wine. This is holding up on the palate, while flavors of roasted berry fruits are just not that ripe, a lasting reflection of a cold vintage.

title: Pascal Lorieux 2017 Expression  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)
description: A classic smoky wine with cigar aromas and stalky spice, this is also full of red fruits. It is young, with a burst of activity that needs to calm down. Drink from late 2019.

title: Philippe Fontaine NV Tradition Brut  (Champagne)
description: This rich blend of Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier is balanced and instantly drinkable. Its ripe fruit and soft texture all come together in a generous, fruit-driven wine. Drink now.

title: Alpha Crucis 2016 Titan Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: This is a rich and powerful wine, dominated by plush, plummy fruit, aniseed and earth. Dense, almost impenetrable on the palate, its woody flavors and muscular tannins are saved by a good lick of juicy, plump fruit.

title: Avancia 2017 Cuvée de O Mencía (Valdeorras)
description: Heavy aromas of wood spice, schisty berry and seashell are loud but short on harmony. This Mencía feels plump and round, but low on acidity. Oaky, herbal berry flavors are roasted and minty, while this feels tannic and sticky on the finish.

title: Barfontarc NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This is a rich style of rosé, with a salmon-pink color and concentrated red fruits. Plenty of acidity balances this full, ripe wine with a soft aftertaste. It is ready to drink.

title: Batasiolo 2014  Barolo
description: Racy and linear, this has aromas suggesting underbrush, tobacco leaf, moist soil, camphor and a whisper of rose. On the vibrant, ethereal palate, firm acidity and dusty tannins provide the backbone for tart cranberry, sour cherry and clove before a drying finish.

title: Bianchi 2015 Garey Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Cooked aromas of cherry, baking spice, vanilla and stewed plums show on the rather ripe and extracted nose of this bottling. Spice-cake and fruitcake flavors show on the sip, where the texture and acidity are decent but the flavors a bit heavy-handed.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2013 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Gritty earthy aromas of raisiny fruit and asphalt are indicative of a drawing and gritty palate. Leafy notes of tomato vie with baked-fruit flavors, while this is clampy and lacks smoothness on the finish. Seems like 2013's cold conditions affected this wine.

title: Bodegas Veganzones 2015 912 de Altitud Limestone Soil Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Oak-based spice, chocolate and vanilla aromas fit the bill for Ribera del Duero. In the mouth, this is hard as rocks, with fierce tannins that bump and grind. Jammy berry flavors collapse on a heavy, tannic finish.

title: Boizel NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This soft wine is full of red fruits and light acidity. It has a fine texture with red berries and crisp acidity. A rounded wine, it is ready to drink now.

title: Borgogno F.lli Serio e Battista 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)
description: Rose petal, camphor and moist soil aromas meld together with a whiff of star anise on this racy red. It's austere and lean, offering tart sour cherry, cranberry and clove alongside taut tannins and firm acidity.

title: Burnside Road 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Crisp, clear and moderate in structure, this wine offers a medium-bodied take on ripeness and body structure, allowing for fleshy flavors of guava and fig to present themselves with ease.

title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2016 Capela Vintage  (Port)
description: The wine is dense, packed with great fruits and tannins, dark and concentrated, and full of perfumed black fruits. It is a wine that makes a great statement of ripe fruits and tannins for long-term aging. Drink from 2028.

title: W. & J. Graham's 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This finely structured wine is powered by fine tannins and rich fruits. A touch of acidity comes through the rich berry flavors and the concentration of the dark tannins. This wine will certainly age, don't drink before 2028.

title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2015 Beerenauslese Exquisit White (Burgenland)
description: Caramelized lemon takes turns with candied lemon to entice the nose. The concentrations of both sweetness and acidity seem to potentiate each other, creating an increasing sense of joy, drama and thrill. The citrus and passion fruit flavors are of immense precision, and one drop on the tongue makes all the taste buds tingle with excitement. This is compact and impactful in all its sweet and tart glory.

title: J Wrigley 2017 Estate Riesling (McMinnville)
description: This is a deft, detailed wine, offering a mix of tangy citrus, sweet tea, honeysuckle and lemonade. The sweet-tart mix is terrific, making for a lively palate that keeps inviting the next sip. Drink now–2030.

title: Melville 2016 Sandy's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aromas of snappy pomegranate, smashed pine, dewy chaparral and dried carnation show on the epic nose of this bottling by Chad Melville, who took over winemaking duties on this vintage. It's crisp and bright in feel, where sour cherry, thyme, sage and blistered tomato flavors engage all parts of the palate.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Jackson Estate Outland Ridge Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Concentrated, exotic and almost earthy, this wine from a single vineyard in Anderson Valley has a wild edge of smoked fruit, singed rosemary and black pepper, with a core of deep black-cherry and clove flavors. It is full-bodied, mouthfilling and layered, with nuances that continue to unfold on the evolving finish. Best through 2024.

title: Brittan Vineyards 2015 Cygnus Block Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Sourced from a 2008 planting of the Swan clone, rare in Oregon, the new vintage is significantly riper than the 2014. Fermented and aged in 30% new French oak, it shows more of the sweet barrel spices than its stablemates, along with cured meats and muted notes of rock. Tart blackberry and cherry fruit carry the precisely defined core. The wine is stylish, powerful and supremely detailed. This quality at this price is a bargain.

title: Henriot 2005 Cuvée Hemera Brut  (Champagne)
description: Only produced in the top years, this wine, named apparently after the Greek goddess of daylight, has just achieved maturity. It is rich in notes of almonds and toast that meld together with the ripe white fruits. It's a great wine that is impressive and ready to drink, although it will also easily age further.

title: Horsepower 2015 Sur Echalas Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The aromas provide brooding notes of brown stem, soot, freshly ground black pepper, wet rock, tar, grilled asparagus and smoked ham. The flavors are intense and wound up, showing layer upon layer of fruit and savory flavors. A supremely long, savory and floral finish caps it off. It's a complete “wow” wine. Best from 2026 to 2032.

title: Krug NV 21ème Edition Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine has richness, maturity and intensity. It offers so many complexities and layers of flavor that come together in a red-fruit-flavored, lightly toasty wine that has freshness as well as some age. Drink now.

title: Louis Roederer 2002 Cristal Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: Showing its age well, this wine offers a mature toastiness balanced by rich red fruit. The acidity is well integrated, making this impressive wine ready to drink now.

title: Lynmar 2016 Adam's Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a new vineyard site named for the producers' son, this is immensely rich, rounded and spicy in nutmeg, clove and ginger, completely inviting and immersive on the nose and palate. Made in a balanced, brightly complex style, it offers plenty of depth and nuance between the scenes, in full exploration of crisp to baked apple and pear.

title: Nigl 2016 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: There is something brisk, lifted and lemony on the nose, framed with a herbal savoriness that recalls lemon balm and the ethereal headiness of freshly crushed wild thyme. The palate opens with supremely tart and lusciously sweet flavors at the same time, filling the tongue and mind with lemon freshness. The endless and rather tingling finish still echoes with peppery verve. This is concentrated, pure, precise and precious. Thrilling is the word. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Quinta do Crasto 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Big tannins coupled with dark fruits have produced a powerful wine with a long-term future. The wine has a dense structure, while also having richness. This is a wine that should age very well, richly textured with minerality as well as bold black fruits. Drink from 2028.

title: Zilliken 2016 Rausch Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Breathtaking aromas of luscious yellow peach, saffron and honey introduce this laser-light Auslese. Bold lemon acidity and delicate sweetness lend a finely filigreed feel to the palate, balanced out by luscious layers of sweet peach, apricot and apple. The finish is endless. Gorgeous already, but a wine to treasure for decades to come.

title: Billecart-Salmon 2006 Cuvée Louis Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: With grapes coming from the Chardonnay heartland of the Côte des Blancs, this wine is the epitome of structured, textured fruit but with the essential addition of age. Still hinting at freshness and still textured, the wine is also rich with white-fruit flavors cut with limes. Drink from 2020.
designation: Cuvée Louis Brut Blanc de Blancs

title: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2016 Contrada S Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)
description: Subtle aromas of black-skinned berry, rose, sea breeze and wet rock shape the nose. On the elegant, full-bodied palate, velvety tannins and vibrant acidity provide structure and finesse for juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and a salty mineral note. It's full bodied but also irresistibly weightless. Drink 2021–2031.

title: Kopke 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a luscious wine. Its tannins are cushioned by the ripe plum and prune fruits. That doesn't mean it is likely to develop too quickly, but is ready to take its time, bringing out the opulent character of the wine as well as its structure. Drink from 2028.

title: Rosenhof 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Chardonnay (Burgenland)
description: A smokiness lies thickly above the apple fruit notes of this heady TBA, glossing everything with a darker, brooding presence. That same smoky darkness hovers on the palate, but here the spiky, bright spur of lemon freshness breaks through triumphantly, lending drive and precision to the apricot and Mirabelle plum fruit that spreads its lusciousness across the tongue. This is rich, concentrated, intense and beautifully unusual. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Cossart Gordon 1989 Bual Bual (Madeira)
description: This is a rich, intense and dense wine. Aging in wood has concentrated the ripe fruit, bringing an old-gold character to the wine. It is supremely rich with flavors of molasses and also tight with great acidity. Drink this superb wine now.

title: Brandborg 2014 Ferris Wheel Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Elkton Oregon)
description: Brambly raspberry fruit is wrapped in a thicket of peppery herb. The tannins lead into an astringent finish with suggestions of green tea. This should benefit from aggressive aeration and/or further bottle aging. Optimal drinking window is 2020–2026.

title: Carl Ehrhard 2017 Weingut Rüdesheim Trocken Rosé (Rheingau)
description: Tasted in the late summer of 2017, there was still a touch of spritz lending life to this floral, fruity rosé. Moderately concentrated in sour cherry and raspberry flavors, it's a charming, easy-drinking wine to enjoy now.

title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Blackened berries, tar, turned earth and caramel aromas show on the nose of this reliable and fairly priced bottling. Blackberry and black plum meet with wild mint and tobacco leaf on the palate, which finishes on a squeaky tannins.

title: Château de Bligny NV Grande Réserve Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This crisp, fruity wine has a balanced texture that moves easily between bright acidity and ripe red fruits. The freshness shows strongly along with a soft aftertaste that keeps the wine rich. Drink now.

title: Chehalem 2016 Stoller Vineyards Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This single vineyard selection spends time in half new, 40% once-used barrels. The oak influence is muted, just as well since the low alcohol translates into light fruit flavors of strawberry and raspberry. The tannins have a green tea character, and the acids seem a bit chalky, but as it's done in a lighter style, if paired with a simple salmon preparation, it suits the bill.

title: Cherrier Frères 2017 Les 7 Hommes  (Sancerre)
description: This young wine is already attractive with its fruitiness and ripe acidity. A touch of tangy acidity as well as the taut texture suggests it will age for another few months. The name of the wine refers to the number of people needed each day to work the parcel of vines. Drink from 2019.

title: CL. de la Chapelle NV La Chapelle Instinct Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Ripe, soft Pinot Meunier defines this smoothly textured wine. With apples, citrus and a touch of toast, it is a fruity wine, lightly spicy and fresh right through to the end. Drink now.
designation: La Chapelle Instinct Premier Cru Brut

title: Coyote Canyon 2017 Life is Rosé (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine is 100% Barbera. A pretty pale salmon color, with aromas of watermelon and sour cherry that lead to quite tart, full-feeling flavors with a kiss of sweetness but more than enough acidity to keep it in check.

title: D'Antiche Terre 2011  Taurasi
description: Earthy aromas of forest floor, scorched earth, leather, game and black plum shape the nose. The aromas carry over to the solid palate, along with black cherry extract and star anise set against velvety tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Di Meo 2009 Selezione Hamilton  (Taurasi)
description: This needed some time to open up but eventually revealed aromas of white pepper, pipe tobacco, blue flower and baked plum along with earthy whiffs of underbrush and leather. It's already evolved, evoking prune, licorice and a gamy note alongside velvety tannins. Drink sooner rather than later.

title: Domaine du Petit Coteau 2017 Sec  (Vouvray)
description: This young wine is light, bright and packed with crisp green fruits, citrus and a touch of honey. It is zesty with freshness and good acidity at the end. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Gueneau 2016 Terres de Fossiles  (Sancerre)
description: This intensely fruity wine is ripe and structured. Black cherry and acidity go with toast flavors, rich tannins and a smoky aftertaste. It is a balanced, juicy wine that is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Philippe Raimbault 2017 Les Godons  (Sancerre)
description: Some oak aging has brought perfumed richness to this red-cherry-flavored wine. Still very young and dominated by the tannins and spice, the wine will develop well, emphasizing the fruity aspect. Drink from 2020.

title: Domaine Tinel-Blondelet 2017 Arrêt Buffate  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This fruity wine is packed with tangy orange and grapefruit. Its acidity is emphasized by the youth of the wine, which will soften over the next few months. Drink from 2019.

title: Dunning Vineyards 2014 4 Hearts Vineyard Reserve Petite Sirah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Opaque in the glass, this bottling shows extremely dense and extracted aromas of kirsch, chocolate syrup, caramel and a hint of mint on the nose. It is suave and creamy on the palate, yet rather thick with unctuous flavors of roasted black plum and coffee liqueur. Acid arises on the finish.

title: Easton 2014 Three of a Kind Ridgewood Vineyard Old Vine Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: An attractive oak element in the aroma leads to good, satisfying fruit flavors on the palate and some oak spice accents like vanilla and nutmeg. The wine is a Bordeaux-style blend with noticeable acidity and tannins and is full bodied.
designation: Three of a Kind Ridgewood Vineyard Old Vine

title: Ermisch 2016 Erendira's Rise Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Light and forward, this fills the mouth with texture more than rich flavor. Gentle highlights of raspberries and cherries come with a wash of chocolate malt and a streak of cola. Drink now and over the next three years.

title: Franklin Tate 2017 Tate Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)
description: This is an upfront, easy-going style of this classic Margaret River blend. Grass and stone fruit flavors mingle with waxy lemon, oregano and pressed yellow flower tones. The palate offers crisp, mouthwatering acidity tempered by a slightly waxy texture and a long grassy finish.

title: G. H. Mumm NV Grand Cordon Brut  (Champagne)
description: This popular brand of Champagne is ripe, soft and very drinkable. Its fruitiness, with apple flavors lifted by lemon, is well judged, giving richness and plenty of freshness at the end. Drink now.

title: Girasole 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This wine is very smooth and flavorful, on the oaky, buttery side of the spectrum but doing it well. Aromas like untoasted oak and butterscotch are vivid but not too strong and the flavors add in ample pear and baking spices.

title: Pflüger 2016 Bunstandstein Trocken Pinot Noir (Pfalz)
description: Wild raspberry and blackberry aromas perfume this intensely primary red wine. Flavors of black cherry candy, licorice and spice are a touch confectionary compared with the producer's other excellent Pinot Noir, but it's an approachable, easy-drinking wine. Soft, barely there tannins accentuate its roundness.

title: Planeta 2016 La Segreta Il Rosso Red (Sicilia)
description: Made with 50% Nero d'Avola, 25% Merlot, 20% Syrah and 5% Cabernet Franc, this opens with aromas of red berry and Mediterranean brush. The savory, easygoing palate offers black currant, Marasca cherry and white pepper alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Pommery NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Softer in texture than many pure Chardonnay Champagnes, this still offers plenty of acidity and minerality. Delicate apple and citrus fruits balance with the acidity and warm aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Resign 2016 Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoky oak and generous tannins coat the palate of this big-boned, concentrated wine. It is brimming in flavors of blackberry, licorice and lavender.

title: Rocca Felice 2015 Famiglia Lanzavecchia  (Barbaresco)
description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, dark-skinned berry and cooking spice lead the nose. The solid straightforward palate offers black cherry and white pepper alongside rounded tannins. It's already accessible so drink through 2021.

title: Seekseekqua 2016 Whitewater Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Winemaker Daniel Kraft, whose primary work is at Washington's Kevin White winery, has named his solo project after the Native American name for Mount Jefferson. This Pinot, from a vineyard owned by Mimi Casteel, opens with ripe flavors of strawberry preserves. It's lively, lightly herbal, medium bodied and finished with a smooth streak of café crême.

title: Soléna 2016 Grande Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Pretty cherry fruit opens this wine and shows instant appeal. There's also a streak of rubber, suggesting that it remains a bit reductive and should be aggressively aerated. Hints of black olive and tar come up through the finish.

title: Soléna 2016 Hyland Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Quite a few wineries purchase and feature Hyland Vineyard grapes, but here they lack a bit of presence. This is done in a light, easy-drinking style that might have come from anywhere. Strawberry fruit and suggestions of dried straw are the principal flavors, with a light dusting of cocoa powder from aging in 40% new French oak.

title: Timothy Malone 2016 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This is a medium-bodied mix of red berry fruit and skin flavors that add some phenolic bite to the finish. The tannins are firm and bring suggestions of leaf and stem.

title: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin NV Yellow Label Brut  (Champagne)
description: The ubiquitous Yellow Label follows the house style of the producer with richness and a soft texture. These are balanced by plenty of acidity that gives the wine an immediately attractive character, ripe and fruity while also crisp. Drink now.

title: Viña Vilano 2016 Roble Black Edition  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Borderline raisiny aromas are ripe but a touch cooked and soft. This feels flush and full, but also soupy. Blackberry, spice and oaky flavors finish woody and with notes of mint and herbs.

title: Westerly 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Toasty aromas of lemon rind, white flowers and a hint of smoke show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite broad, ranging from nectarine to citrus, which will please a wide variety of tastes.

title: Ca'Romè 2015 Chiaramanti  (Barbaresco)
description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of pressed rose petal, tilled soil and cedar. The firm palate offers dried cherry, clove and a rather green note of powdered sage. Grippy tannins leave a firm, astringent finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Alara 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Stewed red-fruit flavors of strawberry-balsamic sauce and red and black licorice show on the nose of this bottling. Intense gingerbread flavors meet with ripe red cherry and mulberry on the palate, which is very ripe.

title: Ancient Peaks 2016 Zinfandel (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: Muddled black plums, dark cocoa, loamy soil and Chinese five-spice show on the nose of this always reliable bottling from the southern end of Paso Robles. Rounded and nearly sweet flavors of fig cake and plum show on the broad palate, where acid persists lightly into the finish.

title: Angove 2017 Grenache-Shiraz-Mourvèdre Red (McLaren Vale)
description: This is a flashy, full-bodied blend, showing notes of cherry cola, vanilla, soy sauce and charred oak. The raspy oak is somewhat overpowering, not quite integrated with the plump berry flavors.
