title: Bernardus 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rose petals, candied raspberry, watermelon Jolly Rancher and a touch of crushed slate show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate offers fairly ripe cranberry-sauce flavors that are cut by orange rinds and framed with decent acidity and tense tannins.

title: Blackbilly 2013 Old Vine Single Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)
description: From 80-year-old vines in the Blewitt Springs subregion of McLaren Vale, this Grenache ambles along unassumingly on the nose. Likable notes of blueberry, rhubarb, cherry cola and vanilla are in the driver's seat. But the palate shifts things into high gear, with full throttle tannins that lasso your tongue into submission. A juicy, umami tang sneaks back in on the finish, making it easier to take another sip.

title: Bodega Classica 2014 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy earthy cherry and berry aromas are calm like a serene lake. A more crisp and drawing palate is bolstered by fresh acidity, while this tastes of earthy plum and tomato, with spice notes. A fleshy but limited finish is the conclusion; drink now.

title: Boizel NV Brut Réserve  (Champagne)
description: This producer's nonvintage cuvée is soft and rounded. It has a generous texture, plenty of ripe apple flavors and crisp acidity to balance. The wine is attractive and delicious now.

title: Brittan Vineyards 2015 Gestalt Block Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Though more black-fruited than the Basalt Block bottling, this expresses to an even greater degree the minerality that typifies all Brittan Pinots. Dense, concentrated blueberry compote and black cherry come with residual flavors of astringent, dry stones. The mouthfeel is wonderfully textured and complex, yet detailed. It should provide pleasure for at least a decade; drink now through 2030.

title: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2012 Vigne d'Alto  (Taurasi)
description: Perfumed and loaded with finesse, this single-vineyard wine opens with enticing scents of violet, ripe black-skinned fruit, new leather and baking spice. Made with 60- to 100-year-old plants, the smooth, delicious palate delivers succulent Marasca cherry, plum, licorice and nutmeg framed in velvety tannins, making it one of the more elegant expressions of Taurasi out there. A mineral note energizes the lingering finish. Drink through 2032.

title: Cossart Gordon 1985 Sercial Sercial (Madeira)
description: This driest style of Madeira intensified all the characters of this remarkable wine. It is bone dry, with wood flavors, enormous acidity and total concentration. It is a real sipping wine, demanding attention with its intensity, lemon peel and smoky flavors. Drink now.

title: Croft 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Juicy, luscious and with excellent ripe fruit, this is a balanced wine with a fine future. Its tannins are almost sweet to match the sweetness of the berry fruits. As it ages, this will be a lovely wine. Drink from 2027.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This brilliantly balanced wine opens with tones of orange and nutmeg, slowly evolving in the glass to reveal rose petal, lavender and crunchy black cherry. This will continue to mature nicely in bottle; enjoy 2020–2025.
designation: Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard

title: Kracher 2016 Beerenauslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)
description: Dark fir honey, golden cane syrup, barley sugar and boiled lemon sweets are rolled into one enticing nose. That interplay of lemon sharpness and caramel is played out on the nose already and continues with its bright, lemony zestiness on the luscious palate, creating tension and tingling freshness at the very core of the sweetest richness.

title: La Spinona 2013 Bergera  (Barolo)
description: Rose, iris, baking spice, menthol, new leather and a whiff of truffle are just some of the enticing scents you'll find in this fragrant red. The palate is all about finesse and tension, offering wild strawberry, crushed raspberry, star anise and chopped mint framed by taut, refined tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2021–2033.

title: Melville 2016 Donna's Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Extreme amounts of freshness arise on the nose of this radical cool-climate Syrah, from smashed plums and boysenberries to amazingly intense peppercorn, forest-floor, tobacco, pine-oil and asphalt aromas. Peppercorns, tar, dark herbs and strong anise flavors show on the intriguing palate.

title: Pommery 2004 Cuvée Louise Brut Nature  (Champagne)
description: Sourced entierly from grand cru vineyards and aged for 10 years before disgorgement, this wine is beautifully mature. Richness comes from the ripe fruit rather than the dosage, balanced by tangy acidity and a toasty note. It is a finely poised and impressive wine that is ready to drink.

title: Quinta de la Rosa 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a finely perfumed wine with swathes of ripe berry fruits and a generous texture. A dry style of vintage, it emphasizes spice, the bite of the spirit as well as the opulent black-plum and raisin fruit flavors. There is great potential in this fine wine. Drink from 2027.

title: Agri-Ronção 2016 DR Vintage  (Port)
description: The wine is serious, balanced and with great complexity. Its structure and dark fruits promise aging, while there is a sweet edge that will eventually give the wine softness. This is a wine that sums up the fruit and the structure of the vintage. Drink from 2027.

title: Alpha Omega 2014 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: A 100% varietal wine from a sacred site in the heart of the appellation, this shows broad, savory flavors of black plum, black currant, leather saddle and tobacco. A lingering thread of black and white pepper dots the landscape of full-bodied richness and complexity. The structure promises further aging; enjoy best from 2024–2034.

title: Alpha Omega 2014 ERA Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon with 6% Cabernet Franc and smaller amounts of Petit Verdot and Merlot, fermenting the entirety in barrel. Black pepper, leather and rough-hewn, grippy tannin dominate elusive black fruit, pencil shavings and cedar, all within a context of sizzling intensity. This is one to age; enjoy best 2024–2034.

title: Boizel 2007 Joyau de France Brut Chardonnay Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Beautifully mature, this rich wine shines with the minerality and texture of Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs. Its intensity and concentration make for a ripe while toasty wine, crisp and deliciously in balance. Drink now.

title: Burmester 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Ripe black fruits shine through the rich tannins of this perfumed wine. It has a fine juicy character, balanced with the generous tannins and acidity. This is a full-bore wine, likely to be ready to drink from 2028.

title: Caballus 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Co-winemakers Véronique Drouhin-Boss and Isabelle Dutartre call this “the story of our friendship in a bottle,” and what a fine bottle it is. It's a full throttle wine, thoroughly expressing the richness and power of the best Oregon Pinot Noirs. Dense and detailed around potent black cherry fruit, it extends itself with lovely threads of toast and coffee, from fermentation with native yeasts, and aging in roughly one-third new French oak.

title: Cavallotto 2012 Vignolo Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Pressed rose, sunbaked earth, aromatic herb, new leather, balsamic notes and a whiff of game are just some of the aromas you'll find on this multifaceted red. The full-bodied palate boasts structure and personality, delivering dried Marasca cherry, blood orange, star anise and tobacco set against a backbone of firm noble tannins. Drink 2022–2032.

title: Cockburn's 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: The wine has structure, swathes of juicy fruit and acidity along with fine tannins. It is certainly balanced with deliciously luscious fruit, and a rich texture that is suggesting good aging potential. Drink from 2028.

title: Deutz 2007 William Deutz Brut  (Champagne)
description: One of two flagship wines from this producer, this is named after the founder of the company. It shows all the elegance and style for which the house is known. Mature fruit, a touch of brioche and toast, and a dry aftertaste all make for an impressive wine that is ready to drink.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram West Slope Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This site-specific wine justifies its singularity in a robustly perfumed, floral aroma and a spicy, savory embrace of black tea and cardamom. The fruit profile is defined by rhubarb and orange zest.
designation: Year of the Ram West Slope Single Vineyard

title: French Bar 2016 Gold Dust Red (California)
description: A strong aroma of cedar wood and fresh-cut oak lead to smoky cranberry, blackberry and wood-ash flavors and a flood of tannins. The wine is deep in color and aggressive in flavor.

title: Kaiken 2016 Terroir Series Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec-Petit Verdot Red (Vista Flores)
description: Forced oak projects a burning sensation and a chemical note to the nose. A clamping palate is tolerably tough, while this tastes of oak, murky berry and green notes.

title: Carramimbre 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Oaky, resiny aromas of wood grain and spice render fruit a secondary item. This is tight, raw and tough on the palate. Gamy black-fruit flavors are heavily oaked and spicy, with a strong accent of clove.

title: Bedell 2016 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Faint aromas of citrus are covered by a bit of a soapy floral tone. Light in body and concentration, apple skin and citrus flavors are met with a mild vein of acidity.

title: Bougrier 2017 Gamay-Grolleau  (Rosé d'Anjou)
description: This medium-sweet wine is soft, fruity and clean. Red-berry flavors dominate along with a candy-shop sweetness. Drink now.

title: Bougrier 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)
description: Simple citrus fruits and a strong herbal character are the main elements of this wine that is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc from across the Loire Valley. Light and crisp, it is ready to drink.

title: Caves Velhas 2017 Cabeça de Toiro Edicão Limitada Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)
description: This soft wine is rather indistinct. Its fruit is lightly crisp but out of focus, giving a gentle wine that is ready to drink.

title: Finca la Celia 2016 Pioneer Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)
description: Gamy, foresty berry aromas lack purity but are not bad. A full, soupy mouthfeel is missing definition, while this tastes of roasted, herbal plum. Saucy, minty, green flavors control the finish.

title: Hilanda 2016 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Top-heavy oak creates aromas of campfire, clove and maple. That same thick, oaky character is noted on a creamy palate. Flavors of clove and barrel spice dominate. In general, this oak bomb just repeats itself over and over again.

title: Las Colinas Del Ebro 2016 Red (Terra Alta)
description: Murky aromas of compost, raspberry and pineapple are less than clean. A chunky palate is more flat than lively, while this tastes largely of raisin and stewed dark-berry fruits. A flat finish with low acidity is adequate but dull.

title: Lieb 2017 Bridge Lane Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: A mild nose of citrus and creamed corn carries to the medium-bodied palate. The flavors are fresher in nature, with broad citrus and melon carried by a soft vein of acidity.

title: Maryhill 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas don't seem entirely settled at present, showing some reductive notes. The palate is light, tart and tangy. It doesn't stand up on its own but might have a place at the dinner table, though the listed alcohol seems a bit high for that as well.

title: Millésimé 2012 Bleu Saphir Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Cabernet Franc and 12% Merlot is very extracted on the nose with strong blackberry, pepper, roasted beef and balsamic aromas. It's tart and tangy on the palate, with a hint of black plum and mint chocolate chip.

title: Pata Negra 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: An outright woody nose smells of sawdust and mint. On the palate, this young Tempranillo shows holes in the middle. Oak-heavy flavors of clove smother what fruit this has.

title: Pedroncelli 2016 Barrel Select Classico Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Merlot, Zinfandel, Petite Sirah and Syrah all make it into this moderately ripe blend, which is aged under a year in American oak. Herbal with a taste of black and red currant, it finishes with a mouthful of tannin.

title: Piattelli 2016 Premium Reserve Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Wiry black fruit aromas are woody and tough. On the palate, this is chunky, plump and rubbing. Dark berry and minty green flavors are on the herbal side, while this tastes burnt and oaky on the finish.

title: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2016 Trouble Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: You'll have to look closely to spot the Trouble designation on the front label, which differentiates this from the estate's Gemini cuvée. There are mousy scents and flavors, some blackberry fruit, and a funky finish with sour tannins.

title: Alagna 2016 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals aromas that recall dark berry and baking spice. The aromas make their way over to the lean palate along with brisk acidity.

title: Kunde 2014 Dunfillan Cuvée Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: An estate-grown blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon and 45% Syrah, this wine is soft, supple and offers lasting structure. Blackberry and black currant combine for a jammy entry that's both sanguine and mineral in tone.

title: La Conreria d'Scala Dei 2010 Iugiter Red (Priorat)
description: Well into its run, this still smells of oak, but also dried, earthy berry fruits and schisty dust. A dense, flush palate remains on the wild side and probably will stay there forever. Ripe mature berry and oak flavors finish with warmth and toughness. Drink through 2024.

title: Lingua Franca 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Juicy and tart with flavors of fresh-squeezed pomegranate and raspberries, this tangy effort carries an impression of lemon rind also. It may remind you, at least at this stage, of a particularly ripe cru Beaujolais. Drink now for its youthful zip, or cellar for another year or two to ameliorate those tongue-tickling acids.

title: Louis Roederer NV Brut Premier  (Champagne)
description: Roederer's nonvintage cuvée is ripe and bright. The acidity and clean white-fruit flavors show strongly, allied to a tangy texture. It is a little drier than previous bottlings, a product of the ripe fruit that needed less dosage. Drink now.

title: Mas 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: While some might find this over the top and overdone, it has its strong points, namely mossy aromas of cassis and mocha. Don't expect much tension from this Malbec; the flavors are ultraripe and jammy. While the label says 14%, this seems riper and heavier than that.

title: Mastroberardino 2017 Neroametà Aglianico (Campania)
description: Made entirely with black grape Aglianico, this refreshing, savory white wine opens with aromas of perfumed blue flower, wild berry and orchard fruit. The bright, rounded palate doles out juicy strawberry, white peach and a hint of crushed stone alongside fresh acidity.

title: Meiomi 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft, supple and earthy, with robust tannin structure and ripeness, this wine impresses in its interwoven layers of baked rhubarb, strawberry and cranberry. It lives up to its reserve-level billing and finishes dry.

title: Migration 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tannic and full bodied, this wine holds its weight and grip well. On the palate, it offers a dense expression of cherry cola, warm baking spices and toasted oak.

title: Planeta 2014 Menfi Sito dell'Ulmo Merlot (Sicilia)
description: Made entirely with Merlot, this has inviting aromas of black plum, cedar and bay leaf. The concentrated, savory palate doles out black currant jam, clove, vanilla and mocha alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Planeta 2016 Nocera Red (Sicilia)
description: This vibrant, silky red offers aromas and flavors of strawberry, wild raspberry, blood orange and mineral. It's medium bodied and lithe, with a salty, sea breeze finish.

title: Planeta 2016 Noto Controdanza Red (Sicilia)
description: Made predominantly with Nero d'Avola with a touch of Merlot, this offers aromas of dark berry, baking spice and underbrush. The savory plate offers black currant jam, vanilla and a hint of green peppercorn accompanied by fine-grained tannins.

title: Prospect 772 2016 Black Tie Charlie Red (California)
description: This is a rich, tempting and full-bodied wine with enticing oak spices in the aroma, and tongue-drenching blackberry and boysenberry in the flavor. An extra dark color, moderate tannins and extreme ripeness all combine to amp up the experience.

title: Quinta da Plansel 2015 Plansel Selecta Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: Aged in new wood, the wine has a smooth texture and rich tannins that give this warm wine its structure and concentration. Black fruits are given a freshening by the ripe acidity. It's a fine wine, ready to drink from 2019.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Stewed red plum, pepper, dried herbs and baked earth show on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts quite zesty in a snappy raspberry-jam flavor, lifted by a hint of white pepper and solid acidity.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Thick dense layers of mocha and baked cherry pie accent a rounded, richly ripe and well-made varietal wine that's full bodied and memorably expressive.

title: Rutini 2015 Encuentro Malbec (Mendoza)
description: A concentrated nose includes aromas of blackberry, black plum, coconut and charred wood. A thick, almost syrupy palate is on the heavy and round side, while this tastes of ripe blackberry and cassis. A rich finish with peppery spice and fudge-like flavors is warming.

title: Sanguinhal 2014 Quinta do Sanguinhal Reserva Red (Obidos)
description: Powerfully dense, this is a firm, structured wine even after four years. It has the weight of wood-aged Castelão, Touriga Nacional and Aragonez behind the black-plum and licorice flavors. It could still age further, so drink this stylish wine from 2019.

title: Serge Dagueneau et Filles 2017 Le Centenaire  (Pouilly-sur-Loire)
description: This rare wine is made from old-vine Chasselas grapes that were in Pouilly before Sauvignon Blanc arrived. It has a refreshing, light character with white stone fruits, creamed apple and lively acidity. Drink now.

title: Sidecar 2016 Off the Wagon Red (Rogue Valley)
description: Produced and bottled by Aberrant Cellars, this Southern Oregon Bordeaux-style blend is made from 35% Carmenère, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Cabernet Franc and 15% Malbec. Blackberry fruit, cola and light details of earth and wood are set in a well-structured, polished frame.

title: Soléna 2016 Zena Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Black cherry fruit and barrel notes of dark chocolate come together in this medium-bodied vineyard selection. There's a thin streak of cola, and the tannins are annotated with a suggestion of Mediterranean herbs, often found in wines from this AVA. It spent 10 months in 63% new French oak.

title: Belden Barns 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Made from grapes grown at 1,000-foot elevation, this wine is velvety thick and concentrated, with a decadence and grip to it that intrigues. Black licorice, black cherry and blackberry dance around each other with intent, providing a warm, full-bodied explosion of flavorful beauty.

title: Bird in Hand 2013 Nest Egg Shiraz (Mount Lofty Ranges)
description: This Adelaide Hills Shiraz shows its cooler climate roots with its restrained nature and medium-body. A bouquet of plum pudding, mint jelly and dried green herbs is knit together by dusty, savory tannins.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 Scharzhofberger Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Fresh tangerine and apricot aromas juxtapose slate and mineral tones on the nose of this easy-drinking but elegant Kabinett. Semidry in style, it's loaded with sweet-tart tangerine and grapefruit flavors. Zippy lemon-lime acidity and a pleasantly salty tang mark the finish. Enjoy now–2023.

title: Blakeslee 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Taut flavors of fresh strawberries, along with a gentle squeeze of grapefruit, introduce this young, snappy wine. Firm tannins support the overall structure, and the balance suggests that this should continue to improve over the next three to five years, and keep for another five after that.

title: Blakeslee 2015 Estate Reserve Select Cluster Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Muscular and ripe, this cuvée mixes cranberry and cherry fruit over a lightly earthy foundation. Barrel aging adds textural flavors of halvah (tahini-based candy). It's not at all sweet, but lovely and detailed.

title: Bouchaine 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: With a slight edge of reduction on the nose, and a leathery, earthy entry, this wine opens nicely into waves of soft, round and rich black-cherry, strawberry and blueberry. It maintains its exuberance through the succulent midpalate and quiet finish.

title: Bouchié-Chatellier 2017 Le Renardière  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This wine may still be young, but it already offers rich fruits, creamed pear and hints of peach. These are cut by acidity and the a flinty texture typical of Pouilly Fumé. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Casa do Valle 2015 Homenagem Red (Minho)
description: A field blend from old vines goes into this impressively rich wine. It has acidity of course, but it also has weight and density. Bright red fruits shine through the tannins that are enhanced by the wood aging. Drink this fine wine now.

title: Castell 2017 Schloss Castell Trocken Silvaner (Franken)
description: Fragrant pineapple, peach and even fresh strawberry notes perfume this dry but intensely fruity Silvaner. It's a thirst-quenching wine balanced by refreshing grapefruit acidity. The finish is moderately long. Drink now–2022.

title: Chanoine NV Cuvée Premium Brut  (Champagne)
description: Crisp and perfumed, this wine is bright with apple and citrus flavors that are tense, cut with acidity and a mineral aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Coeur de Terre 2015 Sarah Jane's Block Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: While labeled Willamette Valley, this block selection is entirely estate-grown McMinnville AVA fruit. Spicy blackberry jam, cinnamon and chocolate flavors carry this wine, along with a pretty streak of candied violets. It shows medium concentration and high-toned brightness.

title: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2015 Aglianico (Irpinia)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting blackberry, blue flower and an earthy whiff of tilled soil. On the soft, juicy palate, notes of mint and star anise accent a core of ripe black raspberry.

title: Corley 2014 Proprietory Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blend is nearly a third each of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot, with a deep, dark oak profile and plenty of firm, chalky tannins. The flavors lean toward licorice and cherry, with a bit of coffee and toffee richness.

title: Covenant 2016 Zahav Late Harvest Botrytis Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Made in a Sauternes-like method, this dessert wine is balanced and smooth, its interwoven layers a celebration of salted caramel, green apple and dried apricot. Not too sweet nor rich, it will classically reward with blue cheeses, spiced nuts or on its own.

title: Daniel Reverdy & Fils 2016 Le Clos de Chaudenay  (Sancerre)
description: From a small parcel of vines next to the producer's cellar, this ripe wine is full of rich white fruits that are cut with acidity. It is well balanced and really crisp. Drink now.

title: Delinquente 2017 Tuff Nutt Bianco D'Alessano Sparkling (Riverland)
description: This cloudy, unfiltered pét-nat is made from the Puglian variety Bianco d'Alessano. It changes rapidly in glass, morphing from tropical fruit and floral aromas to apple skins and green herbs. It's pithy and slightly creamy on the palate, balanced by a refreshing zing of acidity and a fruity, herbal punch right to the end. A porch pounder through and through, especially considering it comes in at just 10% abv.

title: Domaine de Bel Air 2017 Cuvée Riquette  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This wine with an attractive bite is still young, with a tight texture and plenty of ripe fruit. Lemon and spice flavors are shot through with acidity and a strongly zesty character. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2016 Origine  (Sancerre)
description: This stylish Pinot Noir is full of red-cherry flavors that are freshened by crisp acidity. It also has tannins and touches of wood aging, giving the wine both shape and ageability. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Tinel-Blondelet 2017 Génétin  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This 37-acre estate managed by Annick Tinel-Blondelet has produced a juicy wine with open white fruits and good acidity. Called after the original name for the Sauvignon Blanc grape, it has great fruitiness, a taut texture and is ready to drink.

title: Famille Duveau 2017  Saumur
description: This full, dry Chenin conveys notes of flowers, zesty citrus and crunchy ripe apple. Its acidity is bright and crisp while keeping richness and an open texture up front. Drink this wine now, or wait until 2020 for a more mature character.

title: Jean-Michel Sorbe 2017 Pinot Gris Rosé (Reuilly)
description: This spicy, peppery wine with its rich Pinot Gris is smooth, ripe and fruity. The Reuilly appellation is one of the few where the faintly pink-skinned grape is vinified as a rosé and the combination of the cool climate and the fragrant fruitiness is delicious. Drink now.

title: Josh Cellars 2016 Oregon Reserve Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Blended and bottled by Joseph Carr, this is made in the style of inexpensive California Pinots, but benefits from a bit more grip and weight with its Oregon-sourced fruit. It hasn't been overmanipulated, and it offers cherry fruit, lightly earthy tannins and medium length.

title: Kramer 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Here's a palate-friendly mix of blueberry and cherry fruit, set in a sweetly toasty frame. The vines are 20–30 years old, and the wine was aged for 10 months in one-quarter new French oak barrels. There's a hint of volatility despite the rather low listed alcohol.

title: Les Celliers de Pauline 2017 Cuvée Eric Louis  (Sancerre)
description: Crisp, fruity and with a strongly herbal character, this wine has a rich texture from the lees aging before bottling. Hints of riper white fruits will develop as it ages for another few months. Drink from 2019.

title: Marilena Barbera 2017 Tivitti Inzolia (Menfi)
description: This opens with aromas evoking Spanish broom and yellow stone fruit. Juicy and enjoyable, the savory, light-bodied palate doles out baked yellow apple, dried apricot and orange rind. A saline-like mineral note enlivens the finish.

title: Moët & Chandon NV Rosé Impérial Brut  (Champagne)
description: The sibling of Brut Impérial, this rosé has the same easy appeal. With touches of red fruits, acidity and a crisp texture it is immediately drinkable, with an attractive fresh aftertaste.

title: Monmousseau NV Vigneau Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: A blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay, this soft and creamy wine is full of delicious apple and creamed-pear flavors. It has a nutty edge, the palate filled out by the warm Chardonnay. Drink this wine now.

title: Naggiar 2016 Black Beast Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Intense color, flavor and texture make this wine big and bold. It was made from 65% Petite Sirah along with Syrah and Zinfandel and has an inky appearance, plenty of grapey and plummy aromas, rich jammy flavors accented by chocolate and very firm tannins that grip the sides of the mouth.

title: :Nota Bene 2015 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: Brooding aromas of blackberry, orange peel and spice lead to quite ripe, full-bodied fruit flavors with a slightly tacky feel. There are good things going on if the feel evens out.

title: Paraduxx 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: A Cabernet Sauvignon-dominant red blended with Merlot, Zinfandel and Petit Verdot, this presents as burly, brawny and smoky, with soft supple tannin and oak that are well integrated into the whole. Easy to enjoy, its fruit is black and meaty.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is tightly wound in its youth and shows great potential for further development. A reduced entry shows generous oak, burnt sugar and pineapple aromas and flavors, a rich, decadent expression of the vineyard that still needs time to come around.

title: Paumanok 2017 Festival Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Fresh aromas of citrus, peach and white blossom carry this invigorating Chardonnay. Crisp citrus and crunchy stone-fruit flavors meld with a soft lemon meringue tone on the medium-bodied palate, giving this an immensely likable personality.

title: Pelissero 2015 Nubiola  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of cedar, mocha and a whiff of dark fruit emerge from the glass. The tight palate offers sour cherry, vanilla and toast alongside raspy, rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Pride Mountain 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: This contains 6% Merlot and 7% Petit Verdot, the fruit from both Napa and Sonoma. Tight-grained tannins contribute a thick grippy midpalate of weight and texture before chocolate waves of dark cherry are complemented by dried herb and sage.

title: Régine Baron NV Cuvée Saphir Brut  (Champagne)
description: This ripe, full wine is rich with green plums, red apples and a dash of lemon. Fruity while also structured and hinting at almonds, it is balanced and full in the mouth. Drink now.

title: Riverbench 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Apple syrup, lime rind and orange Creamsicle aromas show on the nose of this wine. It's rather ripe on the sip at first, with heavy oak-soaked apple flavors, but then a sharp lemon-juice acidity slices through, giving balance.

title: Roland Tissier et Fils 2017 Tradition  (Sancerre)
description: This ripe and fruity wine is softly textured, with only a hint of minerality. Broad white fruits are freshly cut by citrus to give a lifted character to the fullness of the wine. Drink now.

title: Simi 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Entirely barrel-fermented, then aged in French oak, this is a fully fleshy, robust white, plentiful in oak and power. The fruit-forward components are a mix of fig, mango and cinnamon toast.

title: Simonsig 2016 Kaapse Vonkel Méthode Cap Classique Brut Sparkling (Western Cape)
description: Simonsig's Kaapse Vonkel, or Cape Sparkle, is a classic MCC. Delicate scents of dried grass, melon rind, citrus pith and peach pit dance in the bouquet and through to the clean, refreshing palate, where they're partnered with fine carbonation and medium acidity for a clean, cohesive package.
designation: Kaapse Vonkel Méthode Cap Classique Brut

title: Sokol Blosser 2017 Evolution Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Produced entirely from Willamette Valley grapes, this has pretty red fruit flavors, lightly tasting of lollipop candy. It finishes with a touch of cola and leaves an impression of wintergreen mint. Enjoy this over the next year or two.

title: Baker Lane 2015 Sonoma Coast Cuvée Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a great value for 100% varietal, cool-climate Syrah, a super earthy funky experience of confounding dried herb, lavender and grilled meat. Thick shocks of white pepper hedonistically dot the landscape.

title: Baron Albert 2010 Jean de la Fontaine La Majestueuse Brut Millésimé  (Champagne)
description: A small part of the Chardonnay in this blend was vinified in wood. Along with the aging, the wine offers richness, toastiness and layers of perfumed, ripe fruit. The aftertaste is crisp. Drink now.
designation: Jean de la Fontaine La Majestueuse Brut Millésimé

title: Batasiolo 2014 Bussia Vigneto Bofani  (Barolo)
description: Underbrush, camphor, dried rose petal and a whiff of wild herb slowly take shape in the glass. On the elegantly structured, slender palate, lithe tannins and vibrant acidity offset strawberry compote, cranberry, clove and cinnamon. Drink 2019–2026.

title: Bernardus 2016 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lighter aromas of pomegranate-based fruit punch and raspberry jam met with wild herbs on the nose of this bottling by the Carmel Valley-based producer. The punchy, fruit-forward flavors are easy to enjoy on the sip, although remain a tad simple and juicy.

title: Billecart-Salmon NV Brut Réserve  (Champagne)
description: This producer's nonvintage cuvée showcases a blend of grapes from all the regions of Champagne. Rich with white stone fruit, it balances ripe acidity and a taut texture. This complex wine is ready to drink.

title: Bruno Paillard NV Rosé Première Cuvée Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Hinting at pale salmon pink, this wine is crisp, showing the producer's predilection for low dosage. The wine is all about red-currant fruits and a mineral texture. Although the bottling is just ready to drink, it will be better from 2019.

title: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2015  Barbaresco
description: Aromas of tobacco, cedar and red berry emerge from the glass. The structured palate delivers red cherry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside youthfully vibrant, elegant tannins. Drink 2022–2028.

title: Charles Heintz 2015 Rachael Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Named for estate owner Charlie's mother, this is an intense and powerful white, fiercely strong in acidity and lingering layers of Gravenstein apple and a squeeze of lemon. The lasting finish of integrated oak takes on a characteristic of hazelnut that's hugely pleasing.

title: Claude Baron 2010 Cuvée Topaz Millésime Brut  (Champagne)
description: Claude Baron and daughters Lisa, Aline and Clare are at the heart of this structured blend of 60% Chardonnay and 40% Pinot Noir. Just now mature, it retains plenty of freshness and acidity, but the tautness has softened and opened to reveal a tangy, fruity wine. Drink now.

title: Coeur de Terre 2015 Abby's Block Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: As with the winery's other block selections, this is labeled Willamette Valley, but is composed entirely of estate-grown McMinnville AVA fruit. Brambly blackberries and well-delineated baking spices are amplified with floral aromas. Lilacs and cherries are here in abundance and are quite delightful.

title: Cusumano 2016 Rosso Alta Mora  (Etna)
description: Strawberry, wild rose, citrus and Mediterranean herb aromas take center stage on this fragrant red. Reflecting the nose, the focused, vibrant palate offers pomegranate, blood orange, star anise and hint of espresso alongside firm acidity and fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Delamotte NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Beautifully balanced, this rich wine has elegance and great poise. Ripe white fruit comes through the mineral texture and hints of toastiness to fill the palate. It is ready to drink.

title: Demarie 2006 Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Subtle aromas of violet, baking spice and red berry form the nose while the polished palate delivers dried black cherry, star anise and white pepper. Smooth tannins provide support. Drink through 2024.

title: Domaine de la Gaverie 2017 Sec  (Vouvray)
description: Aged for a short period in wood, this well-made wine has gained an extra richness while remaining almost bone dry. Honey, acidity and spiced-apple flavors combine easily. Drink now or wait until 2021.

title: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2017 Thauvenay  (Sancerre)
description: A rounded wine, this offers a good balance between acidity and ripe white fruits. A nervy edge adds a youthful texture that gives shape to the wine. Drink now.

title: Domaine Paul Thomas 2016 Les Comtesses  (Sancerre)
description: This wine is a selection from vines grown on limestone. After a year in bottle, it has developed stature and richness, offering ripe white fruit as well as delicious final acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Vacheron 2017  Sancerre
description: Packed with ripe white and yellow fruits, this entry-level wine in the Vacheron range is impressive in its own right. Its richness comes from the intense fruit that contrasts with the final mineral texture. Drink from 2019.

title: Elio Filippino 2008 San Cristoforo 10 Anni Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of leather, dark berry, baking spice and a balsamic note lead the nose. The full-bodied palate doles out ripe black cherry, clove and sage alongside firm, ripe tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Entrepreneur 2015 Widdoes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a thick red wine, spicy in acidity and lengthy in waves of dark cherry, blackberry and cola. Full bodied and lush on the palate, it shows the strength of the appellation, site and vintage with ease.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Feudi Studi Rosamila  (Taurasi)
description: Exotic spice, French oak, menthol and black-skinned fruit aromas merge together on this full-bodied red. The austere palate offers prune, dried cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside a backbone of close-grained tannins that grip the finish. It's still primary and needs several years to come around. Drink after 2025.

title: Entrepreneur 2014 Widdoes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Clove and forest pine open this immensely perfumed and expressive vintage-designate, its backbone built in plush, polished tannin and lengthy power. Black cherry, brambly berry and cola complement each other in dense, concentrated waves.

title: Hager Matthias 2017 Pét-Nat Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Perlwein)
description: Gentle hints of ripe yellow apple and yellow stone fruit play amid hints of pastry. The palate is rounded with more hints of apple, cream and short crust, united by a central seam of lemony, bright and integrated freshness. There is something totally honest, disarming and fresh-faced about this yeasty, leesy and fruity pét-nat.

title: Inman Family 2015 OGV Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the family's 10-acre estate vineyard, this wine is defined by its balance: a sweet embrace of delicate red fruit complemented by earthy, savory dried herb and pine. Light, carbonic and exotic, it shows a grip of tannin that softens over time in the glass, reflective of a concentrated vintage.

title: Jonathan Didier Pabiot 2016 Aubaine  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Based in Les Loges, one of the small settlements around Pouilly-sur-Loire, this father-and-son team has made a rich, intense wine that shows the aging potential of Pouilly Fumé. It has power, ripe white fruits and concentrated acidity. Drink from 2019.

title: Joseph Mellot 2015 Cuvée Pierre Etienne  (Sancerre)
description: Named after the Pierre Etienne Mellot, founder of the dynasty in 1513, this wine comes from flinty soil. Its strongly mineral character has been tamed by wood aging. The result is a rich, peppery, balanced wine that is intense, generous and ready to drink now and until 2022.

title: Kevin White 2016 En Hommage Syrah (Yakima Valley)
description: Boushey fruit makes up three-quarters of this wine with the balance being Elephant Mountain. Seeing just a kiss of new oak (12.5%), aromas of smoked meat, dried herb, earth, iron and dark blue fruit lead to bright, pure, fleshy fruit and savory flavors that bring a sense of seriousness. There's a compelling sense of freshness that heightens the appeal. A long finish caps it off.

title: Marqués de Murrieta 2013 Finca Ygay Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Baked plum and cherry aromas are spicy and classic for Rioja, while lively acidity lends spirit to the palate. Berry and currant flavors show a raisiny character on the back end and run steady through the finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Nägelsförst 2016 Klosterbergfelsen Pinot Noir (Baden)
description: Alpine notes of wet earth and pine needles lend complexity to luscious black plum and cherry in this silky, medium-bodied wine. Equal parts savory and fruity, it offers sun-kissed cherry flavor calibrated against piquant hits of anise and black pepper spices. Fresh acidity and fine, feathery tannins linger on the finish.

title: No Girls 2015 Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: This is an up-and-coming variety in the Rocks District subregion of the valley. The aromas are generous, with notes of moist earth, tobacco, cherry and dried herb. The flavors are elegant in style, showing a sense of texture and grace. The finish kicks it up a notch.

title: Patrice Moreux 2017 La Loge aux Moines  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This soft, smooth wine offers ripe fruit and an attractive edge of spice as well as freshness. White stone fruits are cut with tight minerality, leaving a beautiful wine that needs to age. Drink from 2020.

title: Pietro Rinaldi 2014 Monvigliero  (Barolo)
description: This opens with delicate aromas of underbrush, red berry and new leather. The savory palate delivers red cherry, licorice and baking spice alongside firm tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2021–2028.

title: Planeta 2017 Bianco  (Etna)
description: This elegant white grown on the slopes of Mount Etna opens with aromas of pressed wildflower, lemon, wet stone and wild herb. The aromas follow over to the bright, linear palate along with Indian fig and a saline note.

title: Prinz Salm 2016 Wallhäuser Johannisberg GG Grosse Lage Trocken Riesling (Nahe)
description: Hints of crushed mineral and fresh herb persist from nose to finish in this intriguingly earthy yet elegant dry wine. The palate is vibrantly citrusy, offering shards of lemon and lime accented by dried-orange peel and spice. Medium bodied but silky in texture, it's freshened by pert lime acidity.
designation: Wallhäuser Johannisberg GG Grosse Lage Trocken

title: Ribafreixo 2014 Herdade do Moinho Branco Alicante Bouschet (Alentejo)
description: Powerful, rich and with immense tannins, this wine shows the huge potential of fine Alicante Bouschet. Its richness and dark-black fruits are suffused with layers of wood and concentrated acidity. Drink this impressive wine from 2020.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Stagecoach Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Cedar, pencil shavings and toasted oak accent a rich full-bodied core of red-cherry cola and berry in this mountain-grown wine that offers plenty of grip and acid-supported structure. The aromatics are perfumed and the length of the finish impressive in strong tannin.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Beyra Vinhos de Altitude Grande Reserva Red (Beira Interior)
description: The heavy bottle denotes an important wine. Certainly this does have a strong character. However the dominance of Tinta Roriz in the blend has smoothed out the rich tannins and added spice and a generous texture. Stylish while also powerful, the wine is now ready to drink.
designation: Beyra Vinhos de Altitude Grande Reserva

title: Schloss Schönborn 2016 Graf von Schönborn Rüdesheimer Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)
description: The nose is quiet here, but hints of lime and a salty mineral tang build in concentration in this silky, expansive wine. It's dry in style and a bit youthfully closed at the moment but should develop more texture and complexity from 2022.

title: Stolpman 2016 Hair of the Bear Red (Ballard Canyon)
description: Illogical alchemy happens when Roussanne (25% in this case) is thrown in with dark grapes like Petite Sirah: the purple wine actually gets darker thanks to the white grape's oily grip. This well-named bottling shows black currant, Concord grape, blackberry juice and crushed lilacs on the deep and hearty nose, while the palate is driven by ripe and roasted black plums, finishing with hints of maple syrup, brown sugar and gingerbread spice.

title: Two Angels 2016 Petite Sirah (Red Hills)
description: Complex, compelling aromas of fig, mint and cocoa start this full-bodied wine off with a bang before rich, jammy blackberry and blueberry flavors flood the palate. The texture is quite tannic, but is balanced out by the richness and concentration of the fruit tones. It's a big, boisterous wine that needs some equally big proteins to pair with. Best after 2020.

title: Villa Raiano 2013  Taurasi
description: Aromas of black-skinned fruit, violet, dark cooking spice, crushed herb and a whiff of underbrush make for an enticing bouquet. On the firm, elegantly structured palate, taut, fined-grained tannins and fresh acidity balance dried black cherry, raspberry jam, black pepper and a hint of bitter cocoa. Drink 2021 through 2028.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2014 Génération Dix-Neuf  (Sancerre)
description: In celebration of the 19 generations of the Mellot family, this wine is a blend from different parcels of the estate. It is spicy, smoky and full of black cherries and powerful tannins. Because it is still young and vibrant in its fruits, drink from 2020.

title: Anton Bauer 2014 Vintage Brut Reserve Rosé Sparkling (Wagram)
description: A subtle nose gives glimpses of melon and ripe stone fruit. On the palate this is tempered both by fizzing lemon freshness and a creamy, yeasty, rich backdrop of autolysis. This is the palest rosé fizz ever, but the richness of the fruit shines through and lends lots of substance and depth, so much so that this demands food. Astonishing length. Lovely now but will develop. Drink now–2025.

title: Argyle 2016 Nuthouse Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: The outstanding examples of Oregon Rieslings keep coming, this being the latest. Sappy lemon, tangerine and melon flavors are swathed in juicy acidity. Though it's fermented dry, the wine retains plenty of sweet fruit deliciousness. It's the sort of wine that is too good to keep your hands off, so enjoy it while it remains young and fresh.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2014 Judge's Verdict Judge Vineyard Red (Bennett Valley)
description: Blending 80% Syrah with 20% Grenache, this fine wine is earthy and velvety in violet, black plum and a bright thread of integrated acidity. Soft, supple tannins provide power and quiet grip, while the finish is textured in a lasting tease of leather and white pepper.

title: Calluna 2015 Estate Red (Chalk Hill)
description: This is another stellar blend from the estate. At 47%, the Cabernet Sauvignon dominates, but the wine also has 20% Merlot, 19% Cabernet Franc, 10% Petit Verdot and 4% Malbec. Balanced and moderate in ripeness, it doesn't hold back in concentrated black fruit, earthy spice, robust oak and tannin, the varieties finding harmony and structure.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade de São Miguel Private Collection Red (Alentejano)
description: At the top of the range from this quality producer, this wine is a showcase for Alicante Bouschet. Well proportioned with tannins and rich black fruits both in their right place, the wine is still young, still packed with fruits that will soften over the next few years. This impressive wine should be drunk from 2020.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Private Collection

title: Castello d'Alba 2015 Limited Edition Red (Douro)
description: Serious wood aging has created a ripe dense wine. Powered by tannins and with licorice and dark-berry flavors, the wine has concentration as well as richness. A blend of five Douro grape varieties, it is set for more aging. Drink this impressive wine from 2021.

title: Diamond Creek 2015 Volcanic Hill Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Sanguine and earthy, this is a thick, concentrated wine marked by its ash-laden soils—the texture and taste influenced mightily by this fact. Leathery on the palate, it offers a mix of mountain-grown berry and plum, with a twist of cassis and violet. This shows aging potential; enjoy best from 2025–2035.

title: Domaine Serene 2016 Clos de Lune Vineyard Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)
description: Among the winery's numerous Chardonnays, this may be the tangiest of all. It offers up delicious, tongue-tickling flavors of pineapple, Meyer lemon and grapefruit that penetrate deeply. The French oak influence remains in the background, allowing the acid-driven fruit flavors to hold center stage.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a layered, concentrated wine, richly woven with flavors of blueberry, strawberry, rose and lavender. Medium in weight, the palate feels compressed and thick but lifted by a lingering floral element.
designation: Year of the Ram Single Vineyard

title: Henri Bourgeois 2017 La Côte des Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)
description: This steep slope of vines dominates the village of Chavignol, home to the Bourgeois family. An aromatic wine, it is crisp, textured and full of citrus and gooseberry flavors. This beautiful wine is still young, so wait to drink until 2019.

title: La Conreria d'Scala Dei 2011 Iugiter Red (Priorat)
description: Despite showing some heat and raisiny character up front, this compact Priorat smells schisty and Port-like in the best way. A full-bodied, wall-to-wall palate manages to stay smooth, while this tastes not only of ripe blackberry and dark plum, but also of Priorat's minerally soils. A silky feel cuddles complex flavors of dark fruits and hot stones on a fine finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Ledge 2016 Adams Ranch Vineyard Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Hometown musician and vintner Mark Adams delivers an impressively elegant yet forceful estate blend of 86% Syrah, 11% Grenache and 3% Roussanne, starting with aromas of Luxardo cherry, roasted black plum, charred beef, pepper dust and wet rocks. Elderberry and elderflower flavors arise on the well-balanced sip as do lilacs and violets, so much that the experience is like drinking the color purple.

title: Ledge 2016 James Berry Vineyard Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Violets, lilacs, ripe alpine strawberries and intense purple fruits are packed in wet clay aromas on the nose of this blend of 64% Grenache, 21% Syrah, 11% Mourvèdre and 4% Roussanne. Strong acid and chalky tannins hold flavors of roasted boysenberry and violet on the palate, which will last for years. Drink 2020–2031.

title: Maison Roy 2015 Incline Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Note that the winery, the project of second generation Beaux Frères founders Jared Etzel and Marc-André Roy, makes a Petite Incline as well as two Incline Pinots from different AVAs. This dark, dense wine, packed with deep black fruit flavors, perfectly captures the classic signature of the Dundee Hills AVA. Subtle notes of iron ore, coffee grounds, tar and tobacco add complexity and length.

title: Matias Wines 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There is a tightly wound dairy quality to the nose of this appellation blend, which combines yogurt-like aromas with lime pith and ash. It's zippy, fresh and bright with acidity on the palate, where tightly woven tannins carry hints of sandalwood, oak and citrus flavors.

title: Matias Wines 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lemon balm, pink grapefruit pith and a touch of sour cream show on the nose of this bottling, which quickly freshens up into more citrus elements as it sits open. There is strong tightness to the palate, where fresh lemon, nectarine and warmer pineapple tones are dusted with acidity and sea salt.

title: Montaudon 2011 Millesimé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This young wine needs plenty of bottle age. At the same time its rich potential is all there with ripe fruits, apple and peach flavors, and tight acidity. A lower dosage than for the nonvintage wines from this producer allows the fruit to sing. Drink from 2020.

title: Neely 2016 Amphitheater Block Spring Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Focused aromas of lemon, daffodil, sea salt, golden hazelnuts and tangerine cream show on the wondrous nose of this bottling from above the San Francisco Bay in Portola Valley. The palate's nutty flavors are framed by a tannic tension, chalky texture and solid acidity, leading into a sea-salt finish. Drink 2019–2026.

title: Pali 2016 Pali Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From the 50-acre vineyard the winery planted in 2012, this bottling shows a purity of aroma and flavors, starting with sea salt, russet apples and light marshmallow on the nose. The palate shows pan-seared apples with a touch of sea salt, white peach and a hint of hazelnut, with a flash of crème brûlée on the finish.

title: Fäsi 2013 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: Cola and slightly overripe aromas of raisin and fig are blanketed with oaky mocha and cocoa. This is syrupy in feel, with not much structural or acidic support. Thus you get a rich, creamy set of chocolaty berry flavors all the way through the finish.

title: Jean Laurent NV Blanc de Noirs Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: With this producer's emphasis on Pinot Noir, this wine is like the brand's signature. Crispness balances with the soft, creamy mousse and light acidity. A blend of five different vintages, it moves easily from freshness to hints of toast. Drink now.

title: Mount Veeder 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This adds 12% Malbec and 4% Petit Verdot to the mix, a burly, full-bodied expression of mountain mint, cinnamon and tenacious tannin. Juicy plum and dark cherry compete for attention amidst the strong herbal components and concentration.

title: Paris Valley Road 2015 Merlot (California)
description: Ripe, rich and full bodied, this opulent wine from a San Luis Obispo producer has plenty of fruit aromas and flavors shaded by chocolate and baking-spice nuances. It's all at a reasonable price for the level of quality.

title: Perrier Jouët NV Grand Brut  (Champagne)
description: Smooth and soft, this wine has richness and a good balance between ripe white fruits and a zesty, mineral texture. Like all good nonvintage cuvées, it is ready to drink.

title: Pietradolce 2016 Rosso Contrada Rampante  (Etna)
description: Truffle, ripe berry, rose, cocoa and Mediterranean brush aromas shape the nose. The firmly structured palate is a bit on the lean side, offering French oak, sour cherry, powdered sage and star anise set against bright acidity and firm, fine-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.

title: Planeta 2017 La Segreta Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
description: Made entirely with Nero d'Avola, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry and Mediterranean brush. The juicy, easygoing palate delivers crushed blackberry, black cherry and a hint of carob alongside round tannins. Enjoy soon to catch the fruit richness.

title: Richard Böcking 2015 Böcking Riesling (Mosel)
description: This is a deeply mineral yet refreshingly easy-drinking wine balancing savory notes of crushed slate and honeycomb against pristine pineapple and lemon flavors. It's a zesty sip with just a hint of tangerine sweetness. The finish is brisk, ending on a pleasantly bitter touch of lemon zest.

title: Salomon-Undhof 2016 Brut Nature Rosé Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: A most subtle glimpse of creamy cherry is all that appears on the shy nose. The frothy, fresh palate is equally light but adds some phenolic grip. This is very fresh, easy and beautifully dry. Drink soon.

title: San Simeon 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of candied pomegranate, sweet sage, bay leaf and crushed hibiscus, with a touch of graphite minerality. It's fresh and bright on the palate, where cherry is dashed with dried herbs and white pepper.

title: Shaw 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Creamy aromas of butterscotch and candied corn are shot through with a vitalizing kick of lemon zest on the nose. The smooth, textured palate is bright and citrus-forward, with creamy, savory elements that broaden the feel and linger on the finish.

title: The Archivist 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Fruity aromas of cherry, hibiscus and pomegranate grow more complex with wood spice, slate and clay on the nose of this widely available bottling. Full flavors of dried cherry and pomegranate juice meet with sagebrush and bay leaf on the palate.

title: Two Hands 2015 Sexy Beast Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Raspberry, chocolate, ripe plum, black pepper and a briny, black olive tang lead this wine into a palate that's equally savory and tangy. A little on the hot and rich side, the acidity just about keeps things afloat.

title: Vignobles Berthier 2016 Les Chasseignes  (Sancerre)
description: One of a series of wines that the producers calls Les Parcellaires, single-vineyard wines, this is an impressively perfumed wine, exotic in character. It is rich with just the lightest hints of purer acidity. Drink the wine now.

title: Vincent Grall 2016 Le Manoir  (Sancerre)
description: A ripe wine, full of delicious fruit flavors and acidity, this has a chalky texture as well as rich white fruits tightly cut with acidity. It is ready to drink.

title: Wagner 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: An intensely stony nose of wet slate and lime zest carries to the equally expressive palate. This is light in feel but electric with acidity, ending dry on tones of citrus zest and chalk.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2017  Pouilly-Fumé
description: This wine is rich and full of apple flavors along with warm acidity. Like many wines from this appellation, it is still young after a year and needs to open up its ripe fruits. Drink from 2019.

title: Antichi Vinai 1877 2017 Petralava Rosato (Etna)
description: Aromas of woodland berry, sea breeze and Mediterranean brush lift out of the glass. The succulent palate doles out wild strawberry, crushed raspberry and white pepper before a fresh, saline close.

title: Antonio Caggiano 2014 Vigna Machia dei Goti  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of game, wild herb, mature black-skinned fruit and a whiff of barnyard follow over to the dense, extracted palate along with prune and licorice. It's on the funky, overripe side, with a velvety texture that gives way to a dusty, drying finish. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit flavors and freshness.

title: Argyle 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This hits the nose with some sharply spicy aromas, then opens up broadly with ripe cherry fruit. There's a wash of chocolate to help smooth out a touch of bitter herb. Drink now through the early 2020s.

title: August Kesseler 2017 The Daily August Rosé (Rheingau)
description: Fresh cherry blossom and raspberry perfume is accented by bramble and crushed mineral on the nose of this pretty pale pink rosé. Made from Pinot Noir grapes. Its fresh red cherry and raspberry flavors are cutting and spry. Zesty acidity and firm, stony minerality lend structure to the finish.

title: Black Stallion 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a well-integrated white wine, made in an unabashedly full-bodied manner that displays ample fruit. Fig, vanilla and a thread of lemon zest give it plenty of flavor and crowd-pleasing personality.

title: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2015 Carodorum Issos Crianza  (Toro)
description: Leathery berry aromas include exotic notes that stir interest. This feels choppy but also lively and balanced. Cassis, blackberry and plum flavors finish steady. With plenty of ripeness and depth, this manages to show complexity along with elegance. Drink through 2020.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Chêne d'Argent Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This white is rich and creamy, with a slight note of reduction. Decadent in caramel toffee and crème brûlée, it is well made and succulent, allowing the fruit to shine over the well-integrated oak.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2014 Herman Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine offers a deep inviting nose of blackberry cobbler, lavender and violet, the fruit dense and concentrated. There's a lift of freshness on the finish that keeps it alive and balanced in the glass.

title: C. da Silva 2016 Dalva Vintage  (Port)
description: This is an intensely floral wine with bright fruit and fully integrated tannins. It is in a style that brings out acidity and ripe black fruits. With all this fruitiness it will develop quickly. Drink from 2025.

title: Chapel Hill 2017 The Parson G-S-M (McLaren Vale)
description: This is an easygoing, plush, Grenache-led wine, full of juicy strawberry, white pepper, cherry cola and a hint of smoked meat. The region's characteristically sandy tannins shine bright on the palate, which finishes long and savory.

title: Château Guipière 2015 La Tour Vieilles Vignes  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: With age, the concentrated acidity of this wine has softened to reveal the white fruits, generous texture and ripe acidity. The texture is still there, keeping a tight grip on the structure of this well-balanced wine. Drink now.

title: Cristom 2016 Jessie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This is an excellent year for this east-facing block, with bright blackberry and cherry fruit anchored in firm tannins. There's a scent and flavor of chicken stock. Half was whole cluster fermented, and the wine spent 18 months in three-fifths new French oak.

title: Davies 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From fruit grown at both Cuvaison and Hyde vineyards, this is a celebration of the appellation, with pleasing, earthy cardamom and a touch of mint. Dark cherry, vanilla and orange flavors layer around moderate oak and acidity, forming a fruit-friendly complex whole.

title: Domaine Laporte 2017 La Terre des Anges  (Sancerre)
description: This rich, tropical-fruit-flavored wine is generous and full of delicious apricot, mango and pineapple flavors. As a contrast, a strong mineral edge comes from the limestone soil. This is still a young, deliciously fruity wine, but it will be better from 2019.

title: Elio Filippino 2012 San Cristoforo Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with aromas of underbrush, tilled soil, game and eucalyptus. The concentrated palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and black pepper alongside austere tannins and solid acidity. Drink 2022–2028.

title: Elizabeth Chambers 2015 Menefee Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Amid big changes at this winery (Drew Voit was recently named as the winemaker), this new release is closest to the style for which it has become known. It's an elegant, delightful wine, detailed with fine streaks of cola, cherry, sassafras and baking spices. There's the slightest whiff of chili pepper also. And the finish, integrated with supple tannins, carries another light hint, this one of leather. Drink now–2025.

title: Forget-Brimont 2007 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)
description: Half-and half Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this just-mature wine still has plenty of fruitiness. It's balanced, with hints of toast contrasting with red apples and light spice. Drink this wine now.

title: Fullerton 2016 Lichtenwalter Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: This vineyard designate is all 777 clone, fermented in rotator barrels and aged in neutral French oak. It follows a consistent style with the winery's other releases, a palate-pleasing mix of Bing cherry, cola, brown spices and a touch of cut tobacco.

title: Kevin White 2016 La Fraternite Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is a blend of 64% Upland and Boushey Grenache along with 27% Sugarloaf Mourvèdre and 9% Boushey Syrah, all aged in neutral oak. The aromas are knee buckling, with notes of huckleberry, black raspberry, leather, black pepper, stargazer lily, kirsch and orange peel, showing an outrageous sense of purity. The palate bursts with soft black pepper, smoked meat and red and blue fruit flavors that persist on the finish. It's all about purity, but there's a sense of freshness as well that is thoroughly captivating.

title: Lange 2017 Classique Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Here is an outstanding everyday Chardonnay, both affordable and flavorful. Rich fruit flavors combine melon and peach with a touch of grapefruit. Primarily fermented in stainless steel, but a light hint of oak from a small portion that has been barrel-fermented adds a toasty note to the finish.

title: Lelarge-Pugeot NV Tradition Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: The low dosage that gives the wine its designation as Extra Brut fits well with the rich white fruit of this wine. It has a ripe while very dry character that will be even better as the wine matures for a few more months. Drink this bottling from 2019.

title: McKahn 2016 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Aromas of black pepper and wood smoke meld with rich, concentrated and jammy fruit flavors in this full-bodied, firmly tannic and impressive wine. Aged in 50% new barrels from France and Hungary, It shows plenty of spicy, almost sweet oak character to offset the dense flavors and big structure. Best after 2023.

title: Midnight 2014 Mare Nectaris Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: Candied violets, black currant candy, lilac and even a hint of jasmine show on the floral nose of this blend of 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Merlot, 17% Petit Verdot, 8% Malbec and 5% Cabernet Franc. Bright flavors of dark-purple fruit are leveled by a chalky mouthfeel, solid structure and ample acid.

title: Killibinbin 2015 Secrets Red (Langhorne Creek)
description: Lovers of Cabernet's greener side will enjoy the plentiful notes of green bell pepper and chili flakes on prominent display in this wine. There's also a slightly charred wood character amidst supple black cherries. The palate comes with peppery spice, leathery, taut tannins and an earthy spine. There's an oaky touch at the end, but overall this is a solid wine.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2017 Piesporter Michelsberg Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pristine grapefruit, yellow peach and fresh apricot flavors abound in this honeyed, intensely fruity Riesling. It's sweet on the palate but balanced by spine tingling acidity and a touch of saffron on the finish. An excellent value Auslese to enjoy now–2025.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2017 Piesporter Michelsberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: The nose on this medium-sweet Riesling is initially smoky and earthy with hints of lemon and lime peel. The palate, by contrast, is buoyantly fruity, offering loads of sweet yellow peach and apricot nectar. A juicy, easy-drinking wine but elevated by a touch of minerality on the finish. Drink now–2023.

title: Love That Red 2015 Seattle Slew Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Char, toast and dark chocolate barrel aromas are out front, with herb and cherry lurking underneath. Full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors. The wood influence is heavy, but there's enough fruit to largely stand up to it.

title: Maxville 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: There is a considerable amount of Petite Sirah (11%) blended within this wine, which helps emphasize its big power and concentration. Earth, soy, currant, cedar and graphite accent a core of juicy blackberry and chocolate-covered cherry.

title: Moët & Chandon NV Brut Impérial  (Champagne)
description: Well balanced, this Champagne, even with its enormous production, remains a benchmark and is always enjoyable. In this bottling, ripe white fruit is cut with citrus, with an edge of toastiness that gives complexity. Drink now.

title: Oregon Territory 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Once again this budget label from Paul O'Brien offers exceptional value. Barrel aged for a year in 25% new French oak, it includes 20% Willamette Valley grapes, with the rest from the Umpqua Valley. A portion of whole clusters were included, and the fermentation was done in both concrete and French oak foudres. Some flavors of earth and stem come through, and a certain astringency from the concrete, along with brambly black cherry fruit and chewy tannins.

title: Osmote 2017 Chardonnay (Cayuga Lake)
description: Bright, zesty aromas of lemon zest, crushed stone and melon meld with a delicate white blossom undertone is this unoaked Chardonnay. Juicy and succulent yet pillowy in feel, the palate offers a broad impression of fruit balanced by honed acidity.

title: Pambrun 2015 Chrysologue Red (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: This inaugural release is a blend of 59% Cabernet Sauvignon, 24% Cabernet Franc and 17% Merlot, with the fruit coming from Seven Hills, Summit View and Waliser vineyards. Seeing just 35% new French oak, the emphasis is squarely on the fruit. Aromas of raspberry jam, blueberry compote, black currant and spice give way to fruit flavors that show elegance, delicacy and length. It's a pretty take on these varieties and the valley.

title: Panther Creek 2016 Kalita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This is a solid wine, with a chunky mouthfeel. Firm flavors are anchored in cherries and chocolate (from 17 months spent in 40% new French oak). This is a full-bodied wine, which incorporates some herbal notes and finishes with tannins that leave a taste of green tea.

title: Pasquale Pelissero 2015 Cascina Crosa  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of violet, leather and truffle lead the nose. On the chewy palate, firm tannins accompany ripe Marasca cherry, clove and licorice. Drink after 2021.

title: Patrice Moreux 2017 Corty Artisan Silex  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This young wine is still full of crisp fresh fruits. The texture is tight, mineral from the flint soil and nervy. Drink from 2020.

title: Pflüger 2017 Blanc de Noir Trocken Rosé (Pfalz)
description: Firm tannic structure and brisk acidity lend a bold structural character to this dusky, onion skin-hued rosé. Flavors of raspberry and dried strawberry are slightly savory and muted, making the wine an elegant companion to poultry or pork, even in the fall months.

title: Philippe Fontaine 2012 Millésime Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: This is a ripe, full-bodied wine, rich in white fruits, generous acidity and with a good balance. It has weight and intensity, the fruitiness partnered by acidity and touches of spice and minerality. Still young, the wine emphasizes fresh fruit, but is ready to drink.

title: Planeta 2014 Maroccoli Syrah (Sicilia)
description: Made entirely with Syrah, this opens with aromas of dark berry, sandalwood and espresso. The full-bodied, spicy palate offers blackberry jam, black pepper, cinnamon and clove alongside supple tannins.

title: Planeta 2016  Cerasuolo di Vittoria
description: This lively blend of 60% Nero d'Avola and 40% Frappato opens with aromas of red berry, tilled soil and dark spice. The bright, enjoyable palate offers ripe strawberry, crushed blackberry and white pepper alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Pommery NV Brut Rosé Royal  (Champagne)
description: This attractively fruity, dry rosé has red-currant flavors and a zesty, mineral texture. It is an attractive, crisp wine with plenty of fruitiness, a taut texture and immediate drinkability.

title: Prinsi 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)
description: Pressed violet, herb and camphor aromas shape the nose. The chewy palate delivers raspberry, black cherry and a hint of star anise alongside firm tannins. Drink 2021–2027.

title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Firmly tannic with its black fruits still shyly in the background, this wine is darkly structured and complex. Its dark, spicy character is given richness by the ripe berry flavors. Drink the wine from 2027.

title: Roland Tissier et Fils 2016 Etincelle  (Sancerre)
description: This wine comes from old vines planted on flinty soil. The terroir gives a strongly mineral edge to the crisp, ripe white fruits. It has a rich character, the creamed-apple flavors edged with a touch of apricot. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Tantara 2016 Tondre Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lemon syrup, toasty sandalwood, dried mango and nectarine show on the nose of this bottling from vines planted in 2007. The palate pairs squeezed lemon, guava and mango-cream flavors with a hint of oak and decent acid, finishing with a waxy texture.

title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2015 Outcrop Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Outcrop was planted in 1982, and these older vines make a wine with a distinctly Burgundian hue. This fits the classic Eyrie profile, tight and compact, with herbal aromas of peavine and rhubarb. Details of stem and leaf accompany tart raspberry fruit. This wine needs aggressive aeration if you plan to drink it soon; but it should age quite well. Drink 2025–2035.

title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2015 Roland Green Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Named to honor a family member, these grapes were planted in 1989. As with all the Eyrie single vineyard Pinots, the aromas are complex and compelling. Flavors are light and detailed, with suggestions of leaf and compost under wild berries. This young wine will benefit from another couple of years of bottle aging; drink after 2020.

title: Veuve Doussot 2013 Cuvée L by VD Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This smooth and ripe wine has a creamy mousse and hints of mature, rich fruit. It is well poised, hinting at minerality while also boasting great fruitiness. Drink from 2019.

title: Vivera 2014 Salisire Contrada Martinella Bianco  (Etna)
description: Beeswax, acacia, toasted hazelnut and grilled herb aromas follow over the savory, enveloping palate together with Golden Delicious apple and lime. Fresh acidity and a tangy salinity provide freshness and add depth. Made with organically farmed Carricante.

title: Waxwing 2015 Tondre Grapefield Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Savory aromas of pepper, roast beef and hearty dark fruit show on the nose of this bottling, a rare Syrah from the Santa Lucia Highlands. There are tangy flavors of underripe blackberry on the palate, but the crushed peppercorn and lamb roast with rosemary elements are most prominent.

title: Westerly 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Black plum, violet, lilac and a hint of chocolate are well integrated on the tangy yet rich nose of this balanced effort by a winery that recently changed hands. The wine hits the palate with hefty black-cherry, blackberry and elderberry-jam flavors, proving thick and impressive atop chalky tannins.

title: Willi Haag 2017 Juffer Brauneberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Wax, smoke, hibiscus flowers and tropical fruits perfume this luscious, mouthfilling wine. Sweet-tart tangerine and peach flavors are juxtaposed by racy lemon-lime acidity and savory notes of pine frond and pollen. A substantial wine that should improve now–2030.

title: Ben Haines 2016 B Minor Roussanne-Marsanne (Upper Goulburn)
description: Made in small quantities from winemaker Ben Haines, this blend is fermented with native yeasts and aged for 10 months on the lees. The aromas are heady in tones of lemon curd, honey, toasted nuts and spice. But it's the palate that steals show. Tingly acidity perfectly balances an oily texture and lingering, spicy flavors. Lovers of textural whites will be all over this.

title: Benanti 2014 Serra della Contessa Rosso  (Etna)
description: Balanced and vibrant, this elegant red opens with aromas evoking underbrush, dark culinary spice, wild berry and a whiff of new leather. The chiseled, understated palate is all about ethereal finesse, offering crushed strawberry, red cherry and star anise set against lithe, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink after 2020.

title: Bernardus 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There's an herbal kick on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, with dried seasonings and tea leaves lifting the boysenberry fruit core. More tea and marjoram meet with roasted plums on the palate, which is cut by crisp acidity.

title: Boffa 2015 Paiè  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of red berry, violet, leather and a whiff of cake spice emerge from the glass. The savory balanced palate offers cranberry, star anise and cinnamon alongside fine-grained, youthful tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Brandini 2014 del Comune di La Morra  (Barolo)
description: Captivatingly fragrant, this offers scents of rose petal, iris, menthol, star anise and an earthy whiff of forest floor. It's vibrant and ethereally elegant, delivering red cherry, licorice and a hint of white pepper set against refined tannins and firm acidity. A salty mineral note closes the finish. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Cascina Alberta 2015 Giacone  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of rose petal, red berry and underbrush lead the nose. The juicy balanced palate evokes raspberry jam, red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2020–2029.

title: Chiron Wines 2015 Pelkan Ranch Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)
description: A  herbal and perfumed nose opens this lovely, well-made and robust wine, which is both softly round and complex in nature. A billowy texture supports firm acidity, integrated oak and bursts of red and black fruit, plum and clove.

title: Croma Vera 2016 Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Bright aromas of pomegranate, raspberry sorbet, ripe cherry, rosewater candy and vanilla show on the fresh yet luxurious nose of this bottling. It's light in feel, with a tense in structure that carries flavors of strawberry, cinnamon and dried ginger.

title: Curto 2013 Fontanelle Nero d'Avola (Eloro)
description: Made with Nero d'Avola, this polished, savory red offers aromas of black-skinned berry, carob and Mediterranean scrub. The juicy, chewy palate doles out blackberry jam, clove, black pepper and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

title: De Ponte Cellars 2015 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Simply lovely from first sniff to last sip, this wine offers a supple mix of ripe fruits—berries, plums and cherries. Time in one-quarter new French oak adds a touch of chocolate and softens up the tannins, resulting in an almost buttery mouthfeel.

title: Domaine Serene 2015 Grand Cheval Oregon Red Wine Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: A rare blend of Dundee Hills Pinot Noir and Walla Walla Syrah, this belies the notion that Pinot is not a grape for such mash-ups. In this vintage the balance seems just right; neither grape dominates. Cassis and coffee flavors combine, with a touch of charred wood. There's a bit of heat in the finish, but a good steak will absorb the added oomph.
