description: Attractively perfumed, this wine has soft tannins and ripe red-cherry flavors. It is well balanced but rich, with delicious, open fruitiness and acidity to balance. Drink now.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2017 Buissonnier  (Mercurey)
description: Aged for a few months in wood before release, this wine has ripe tannins and red-cherry fruitiness. It is still shows youthful exuberance and will be better as it calms down. Drink from 2020.

title: Cascina Chicco NV Dosaggio Zero Rosé Sparkling (Vino Spumante)
description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of underbrush, bread crust and the barest hint of woodland berry. The racy palate offers strawberry, peach and a somewhat bitter note suggesting powdered sage and medicinal herb alongside a firm perlage.

title: Centovigne 2016 Rosso della Motta Red (Vino da Tavola)
description: This easygoing red has aromas and flavors of Marasca cherry, grilled herb, eucalyptus and a hint of star anise. It has lithe tannins and lively acidity.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2013 Chui Vineyard Reserve Malbec (Fair Play)
description: Slightly earthy aromas lead to good fruit, black-pepper and smoke flavors, solid structure and a firm moderately tannic texture.

title: Château Cateau Lagrange 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Full of blackberry flavors, this strong, firm wine is just setting out on its development. Big spice, plenty of smoky wood-aging flavors and a juicy aftertaste all point to a good future. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Gachon 2015 Cuvée Les Petites Ranga  (Montagne-Saint-Émilion)
description: This wine comes from an estate owned by the same family for four generations. Dark in color and rich with generous fruit and spicy tannins, the wine is open, smoothly textured and likely to develop quickly. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Grand Français 2016 Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This wine has fine tannins, rich berry flavors and a juicy aftertaste, an indication of the vintage. Structured and with some good potential, the wine will be ready from 2021.

title: Château La Rose Saint Germain 2016  Bordeaux
description: This ripe and fruity wine is lightly structured and offers appealing berry flavors. Acidity and juiciness come through the tannins strongly, giving a wine that will be delicious. Drink from 2020.

title: Château le Noble 2016 Cuvée Heritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Solid with tannins but also ripe with fruits, this fragrant wine is developing quickly. It is attractive, with acidity and berry flavors in balance. Drink from 2021.

title: Château les Granges 2016  Bordeaux
description: This is a ripe and spicy wine with attractive black fruits and soft tannins. It has good acidity and juicy blackberry fruits. Drink this wine from 2020.

title: Château Lescalle 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This is a juicy wine, with intense acidity that shows through the structure strongly. Richness comes from the bright fruits with the tannins playing a supporting role. Drink from 2021.

title: Cru de la Maqueline 2016  Bordeaux
description: Firm tannins are the hallmark of this wine. Although its solid structure and dry core still dominate, the wine's weight shows there is plenty of fruit to develop. Drink from 2021.

title: Domaine Coste Caumartin 2015 Les Vignots  (Pommard)
description: This is a dry wine, with firm tannins and a tough core. It is solid right through. The tiny vineyard sits at 1,000 feet near the top of the Pommard slope. There may not be enough ripe fruit to balance the wine.

title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2017  Mâcon-Davayé
description: Well integrated, this wine is bright, tight and fruity. A touch of minerality as well as citrus balances the riper yellow fruits. Drink this wine now.

title: Domaine Stéphane De Sousa 2016 Les Millerands  (Meursault)
description: This ripe wine is toasty, yeasty and ready to drink. Its fruitiness is there although the wine is more about texture and spiciness. Drink now.

title: Domaines Devillard 2016 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This ripe, green-plum-flavored wine is crisp with acidity and a lively texture. It comes from vines on the elevated plateau behind Nuits Saint-Georges, giving the wine a cool, collected and tangy character. Drink now.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paicines)
description: A strong herbal display shows on the nose of this bottling, including dried oregano as well as shaved chocolate, coffee and red-plum fruit. The palate adds marjoram and pencil shavings to the mix, which gives a strong cedar tone to the cooked blackberry flavor, finishing with sticky tannins.

title: Firestone 2016 Riesling (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Sweeter-leaning aromas of lime and lemon syrup meet with crushed white rocks and light orange blossom on the nose of this bottling. The palate proves more dry than expected, with flavors of lime rind, orange-blossom candies and fresh herbs.

title: Goldschmidt 2016 Yardstick Ruth's Reach Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Rustic and well priced, this has a char oak imprint with highlights of cedar and pencil, its overall intensity and blackberry richness tamed by an herbal underbelly and lifted acidity.

title: Gordon Estate 2015 Estate Grown Tempranillo (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light aromas of spice, tobacco and herb lead to lighter styled fruit flavors. It doesn't entirely stand up on its own but has a place at the dinner table.

title: Il Peraccio 2014  Chianti
description: A blend of 70% Sangiovese, 10% Colorino and 10% Canaiolo, 5% Trebbiano 5% Malvasia Bianca fermented in amphora, this has aromas of red-skinned berry, raspberry and underbrush. The firm, savory palate doles out red cherry, clove, white pepper and a mineral note alongside taut, refined tannins. Drink 2019–2024.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2015 San Salvador Gotin del Risc Godello (Bierzo)
description: Apple and stone fruit aromas are mature but holding form. A tight palate displays grip and bold acidity some three years after harvest, which is a good sign. Flavors of nectarine, salt and bitter stone fruit pits peter out on a minerally finish. Drink through 2019.

title: Altemasi NV Rosé Brut Sparkling (Trento)
description: This has a delicate nose that suggests orchard fruit and a whiff of bread crust. The bright palate offers white peach, grapefruit and hints of candied orange zest and ginger alongside a soft perlage.

title: Betz Family 2016 La Côte Patriarche Red Willow Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)
description: Brooding aromas of black pepper, herb, blackberry, flower and whiffs of smoked meat are followed by light, elegant blue and purple fruit flavors with green accents that trail toward the finish. What's there is pleasing, but the concentration seems a bit light at times.
designation: La Côte Patriarche Red Willow Vineyard

title: Betz Family 2016 La Côte Rousse Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: Pure blueberry, huckleberry, flower, herb and olive aromas are followed by light, ripe but still fresh dark fruit flavors surrounded by dense, slightly gritty tannins that need time to unwind. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery, seeming to need some time in the cellar to come together.

title: Camino de Cabras 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple and peach aromas along with stony minerality render the nose legitimate. This feels lemony and correct. Green apple, stone fruit and a dash of salt are the flavors, while this shows mild to medium acidity throughout.

title: Cantina di Negrar 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: This opens with aromas of mature black-skinned berry, leather and cooking spice. The forward palate offers prune, licorice and a hint of clove alongside firm tannins.

title: Celene NV Jade Ballarin Collection Précieuse Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)
description: This attractive, crisp blend of Sémillon, Muscadelle and Sauvignon Blanc is light, lively and packed with fruit. Aged for 18 months in bottle before release, the wine now has some maturity and a touch of toast as well as crisp fruit. Drink now.
designation: Jade Ballarin Collection Précieuse Blanc de Blancs Brut

title: Château de Parenchère 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This structured wine is firm with tannins, with fruit weight in the background. Solid and firm, it's dense and full of blackberry flavors. Richness and concentration are setting it on a path for aging. Drink from 2022.

title: Château du Bernat 2016 L'Exception  (Bordeaux)
description: A ripe, perfumed wine with fine tannins and a spicy structure, this is rich and offers good potential. Berry fruits go well with the tannic structure to create a balanced wine, ready to drink from 2021.

title: Château La Rame 2016  Bordeaux
description: Wood aromas feature strongly in this wine. On the palate, they give it a strong spicy character with plenty of new-barrel flavors. The wine also has plenty of fruit and acidity to sustain the structure. Drink from 2022.

title: Château les Arromans 2016  Bordeaux
description: This ripe, smooth wine offers delicious black fruits. Wood aging shows in the spice and dark- chocolate flavors although it does not interfere with the wine's fruitiness. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Pas de l'Ane 2011  Saint-Émilion
description: The spicy tannins in this wine are still firm and will probably not soften further. A dry core balanced by the rich blackberry fruit and acidity gives the wine freshness and a ripe aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château Sainte Barbe 2016 Merlot du Château Sainte Barbe  (Bordeaux)
description: This wine has dense fruit and structure. Tannins, black fruits and balanced acidity contrast with the smoky wood-aging flavors. The wine will develop well. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Sainte Marie 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Black fruits and rich tannins give this wine power and its structure. It has concentration, with blackberry flavors coming together with dark tannins to give richness. Drink from 2022.

title: Corte Rugolin 2012 Monte Crosara delle Strie  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Aromas of black cherry marinated in spirits, vanilla and mocha emerge from the glass. The big, chewy palate delivers prune, cocoa and espresso alongside velvety tannins.

title: Cottanera 2014 Zottorinotto Riserva  (Etna)
description: Aromas of French oak, espresso and underbrush lead the nose along with a whiff of eucalyptus. Mirroring the nose, the tight palate offers ripe black-skinned fruit, oak-driven spice and roasted coffee bean alongside close-grained tannins that leave a firm, drying finish.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Franc (Paicines)
description: Ripe black-plum and vanilla aromas are layered with rocky soils, chaparral scrub and thyme on the nose of this bottling. It's lighter bodied but lively and likable on the palate with ripe berry, cherry and dried oregano flavors.

title: Eberle 2017 Eberle Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Paso Robles is not known as a Chardonnay land, but the Eberle team manages to pull of fresh and worthy bottlings each vintage, even from the eastside of town. Broad poached pear and apple-blossom aromas lead into a palate of peach and pineapple, which is framed by decent tannic tension.

title: Gigondas la Cave 2015 Beaumirail Red (Vacqueyras)
description: Plump and juicy, this blend of 60% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 5% each of Cinsault and Mourvèdre offers primary plum and wild strawberry flavors. It's an easy, approachable wine with fresh acidity and velvet tannins. Hints of spice and caramel lift the midpalate. Enjoy now through 2024.

title: Lava Cap 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (El Dorado)
description: This wine is packed full of ripe apple and pear flavors that are accented by vanilla and butter. This is a full-bodied, barrel-fermented wine that's big in profile but smooth in feel.

title: MacRostie 2016 Fedrick Vineyard Sangiacomo Family Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light and bright in strawberry and spicy cardamom, this wine is also alight with coffee and tea flavors and an abiding element of earthy mint.

title: Navarro 2016 Zinfandel (Mendocino)
description: This wine goes for extreme ripeness in the dense jammy saturated blackberry and black-plum flavors, has a broad smooth texture and full body. It's on the verge of sweetness, showing mild tannins and soft acidity, and is seductive for the purity and generosity of the fruit character.

title: Now Presenting... 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This playfully labeled wine shows strong blackberry aromas with surrounding hints of turned earth and dust on the nose. Tangy and dark-red fruits are held up by firm tannins, strong acidity and dried herbs on the well-framed palate.

title: Omen 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This big dry wine, based on Paso Robles and Sierra Foothills grapes, is intense in flavor, well-structured to stand up to big proteins, and nicely full bodied. Black-cherry and black-plum notes stand out on the palate, while light baking-spice accents begin in the aromas and continue through the finish.

title: Opaque 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Slightly tart aromas of black fruit meet with turned earth, campfire and incense on the savory nose of this bottling from the Riboli family. Cooked black-currant and olive flavors combine with roasted beef and cocoa on the thick palate.

title: Pestoni Family 2016 Estate Sangiovese (Rutherford)
description: Juicy in cherry with a strong element of char and smoke, this is a soft, rounded and full-bodied wine made entirely from the variety. It has secondary characteristics of dried herb and sage.

title: Point & Line 2016 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Crisp apple, buttered nuts and a touch of honey show on the clean nose of this bottling. Tangy apple flavors meet with crushed nuts on the tense and tart palate, which finishes with a wash of vanilla spice.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2014 Fortitude Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Sweet oak lies beneath mouth-coating tannin in this full-bodied, 100% varietal wine, a rich, soft expression of cherry, vanilla and dried herb.

title: Raymond 2015 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: Smooth and succulent, with a soft core of richness and length, this is a full-bodied, highly ripe and bold red with dense flavors of cola, clove and cinnamon.

title: Rockpile 2016 Cemetery Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: Thick rounded richness is supported in pillowy tannin and brimming in brambly blueberry and blackberry. It broods and bristles in grippy texture and earthy elements of dried sage, lavender and crushed rock.

title: Rockpile 2016 Pritchett Peaks Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: Tight tannins underscore a rocky dusty texture in this big-boned savory wine that is 100% varietal. Spice, leather and red fruit come together seamlessly basked in violet. It has plenty of power and concentration but leaves an elegant lasting impression.

title: Rotari 2010 Flavio Riserva Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Made entirely from Chardonnay, this opens with aromas of ripe yellow apple, chamomile flower, bread crust and a whiff of toast. On the elegant palate, a continuous perlage underscores candied citrus zest, ripe white stone-fruit and toasted hazelnut. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.

title: Roux Père et Fils 2016  Chassagne-Montrachet
description: This mineral-textured wine is full of fruit while also being crisp and taut. Its lively character belies its weight and intensity. Drink this still-developing wine from 2020.

title: Tenuta di Fessina 2012 Musmeci Riserva  (Etna)
description: Blue flower, eucalyptus, oak-driven spice and dark-skinned berry aromas mingle with a whiff of pipe tobacco. The linear palate delivers Morello cherry, blood orange, licorice, espresso and a salty note. Close-grained tannins give it a firm, drying finish.

title: Usiglian del Vescovo NV Il Bruvè Metodo Classico Sangiovese (Vino Spumante)
description: Aromas of crushed stone, pressed rose and wild berry delicately lift out of the glass along with an earthy forest floor note and a whiff of bread crust. Reflecting the nose, the dry, vibrant palate offers strawberry, wild cherry, citrus and a mineral note of oyster shell alongside racy acidity and a refined perlage.

title: Vivera 2013 Martinella  (Etna)
description: This opens with aromas of blue flower, dark spice, toasted hazelnut and a whiff of flint. On the svelte palate, fine-grained tannins give lithe support to red cherry, strawberry and ground clove. It's fresh, with lively acidity. Drink through 2022.

title: Altemasi 2010 Riserva Graal Metodo Classico Brut Sparkling (Trento)
description: This offers delicate scents evoking orchard fruit, chamomile and bread crust. On the linear palate, a racy perlage and vibrant acidity frame yellow apple, lemon zest and a hint of Alpine herb.

title: Ancien 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Dark cherry and pomegranate take on a delicate nature in this mineral-laden red, tasting of crushed rock and orange zest. A gritty complex texture rides beneath and is lifted by firm buoyant acidity.

title: Angry Bunch 2015 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: This wine captures a wild brambly character without being tricked up with new oak. Bolstered by 6% Petite Sirah, 3% Syrah and 2% Alicante, it shows raspberry and tea aromas, while the palate brings ample cherry and raspberry flavors and balanced tannins.

title: Joseph Drouhin 2017 Les Crays  (Mâcon-Lugny)
description: This wine is textured and tight with a strong sense of minerality. The texture is backed by crisp apple and lemon-zest flavors to give a fruity wine ready to drink.

title: Junta 2017 Grand Reserve Carmenère (Curicó Valley)
description: Dry spice and woody aromas blend with plum and berry scents. This Carmenère feels chunky and solid. Woody, herbal plum and savory spice flavors end with varietally typical herbal green notes.

title: Koyle 2015 Gran Reserva Syrah (Colchagua Valley)
description: Barnyard and berry aromas are piercing but lack elegance. A thick, wide palate is a bit shapeless and lacking in framework. Burnt berry flavors are a bit herbal and green, while the finish is a bit chalky and tannic.

title: Koyle 2016 Gran Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Rubbery berry aromas have a whiff of compost. On the palate, this is fairly raw and biting; midpalate cushion is nonexistent. Blackened flavors of grilled meat and peppery oak dominate this hard Carmenère from a tough vintage for Chile.

title: Llano Estacado 2017 Signature Series Pinot Grigio (Texas)
description: Aromas of orange blossoms, lemon peels and yellow apples are pleasant on the nose. The palate offers ripe orange, lime juice and lime leaves, but the dry finish is astringent and sweeps away those juicy citrus flavors.

title: Llano Estacado 2017 Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Texas)
description: Aromas of lemon oil and citrus blossom are wrapped in an herbal haze on the nose of this Sauvignon Blanc that's blended with 23% Chenin Blanc and 1% each of Marsanne and Viognier. The palate is dry and astringent, with spry lemon-lime acidity and flavors of ripe apple, blossoms and a whisper of salinity.

title: Maryhill 2015 Vineyard Series McKinley Springs Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Light aromas of cherry, vanilla and spice lead to full-bodied fruit flavors backed by dry, grippy tannins that come off as quite aggressive out of the gate but calm down a bit with a day open.

title: Maxville 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Floral and herbal, this wine offers bright, persistent acidity around a full-bodied embrace of ripe peach and pineapple.

title: McPherson 2016 EVS Windblown Red (Texas High Plains)
description: Blueberry and black raspberry aromas are slightly overripe on the nose. The palate remains ripe in feel, with baked blueberry and tart cranberry. Oaky tones add weight and dusty tannins quickly sweep in, somewhat smothering the flavors. The finish is mild and slightly bitter.

title: Parducci 2017 Small Lot Pinot Gris (Mendocino)
description: The aromas of this medium-bodied wine overflow with apples and peaches, and the flavors are crisp, fruity and clean. The mouthfeel is rather rich for the varietal and backed by a nip of good acidity.

title: Pedernales 2015 Albariño (Texas)
description: This white offers aromas of white flowers, orange peels, apricots and peaches that mingle with notes of grass and white pepper. The palate has a creamy mouthfeel, rounding out flavors of lemonade, white peach juice, lemon balm and gooseberry. The orange oil finish has a faint bitter lime edge.

title: Rigid Elm 2016 Rosé (Danube River Plains)
description: Light pink in the glass, this Bulgarian Rosé is made from Cabernet Franc and Merlot. It has aromas of raspberries and red plums with flavors of strawberry and red raspberries.

title: The Seeker 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: An earthy, buttery aroma leads to warm peach and spice flavors. This wine has a nicely rich texture and is light on fruitiness and acidity.

title: Villa di Corlo NV Brut Rosato Rosanto  (Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro)
description: Vinous aromas of strawberry, Marasca cherry and blueberry follow over to the vibrant, light-bodied palate along with hints of baking spice. It's easy drinking, with medium-sized, lively bubbles and bright acidity.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Orange Muscat (California)
description: Strong lemon-peel, Pink Lady apple and orange-blossom aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts slightly sweet and grows much sweeter toward the finish, with ripe pear and apple flavors, but not much acidity.

title: WindVane 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A broadly defined, simply structured white, this has expansive richness on the palate and measured acidity on offer. Green apple, lime and lemon custard provide varietal character.

title: Château Bois de Favereau 2015 Cuvée Jean Jules  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: The vineyard for this wine lies in the far east of the Entre-Deux-Mers. It has produced a soft, fruity wine with gentle tannins and open fruitiness. The wine has attractive black-currant flavors and acidity along with a dry core that keeps everything together. Drink now.

title: Telios 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine has good fresh fruit flavors that verge on jammy, boosted by a sweet-seeming oak character that includes vanilla, maple and brown sugar accents. It's smooth in texture and light in tannin content for this varietal.

title: Carnivor 2016 Zinfandel (California)
description: A deep, dark color and deep, dark flavors steal the show in this extra-ripe and extremely spicy wine. Oak is the star, as cedar, clove, vanilla, cinnamon and smoke notes pervade the aromas, flavors and finish.

title: Maddalena 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Loads of fresh and tropical aromas of pineapple, orange, pear and a hint of guava show on the nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. The palate is also a very showy style of Chardonnay, with solid acid and structure delivering flavors of guava, tuberose, mango and more pineapple.

title: Maryhill 2015 Vineyard Series Les Collines Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Light aromas of barrel spice, pencil shavings, cherry and green pepper are followed by full-bodied, palate-coating fruit flavors that persist on the finish. The tannins come off as a bit dry and gruff.

title: Mietz 2015 Estate Sangiovese (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With 10% Merlot, this wine is brawny in baked and dried flavors of blueberry and cherry, its texture soft and rounded with a moderate amount of richness. There's both tension and balance in its acidity.

title: Montecappone 2015 Mirizzi Extra Brut Metodo Classico  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)
description: Delicately scented, this has aromas of spring flower, Bartlett pear and a whiff of pastry dough. The crisp, lively palate shows yellow apple, white peach and citrus drop alongside a vivacious perlage. It closes on a note of toasted almond.

title: Napa Cellars 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal and grippy, this medium-bodied wine offers tones of red plum, dried herb and a touch of graphite. It has a lasting streak of freshness that supports the fruit.

title: Oro Rosso NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Trento)
description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals toasted walnut, bread crust and a whiff of dried chamomile. On the soft, easygoing palate, a lively perlage provides the backdrop for juicy strawberry, toasted hazelnut and a hint of ripe apple.

title: Pagos de Araiz 2014 Crianza Red (Navarra)
description: Black cherry and black currant aromas are dense but not blatantly overripe. A flush palate is a bit nebulous in structure, while this four-grape blend tastes of baked berry fruit and chocolate in front of a soft, slightly cooked finish. This is Merlot, Syrah, Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Pedroncelli 2016 Bushnell Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an intensely jammy, rich, 100% varietal wine that's rich and thick with elements of barbecue, grilled meat and Italian deli. It finishes in vanilla oak and black pepper.

title: Rigid Elm 2016 Mavrud (Thracian Valley)
description: This Mavrud is cherry red in the glass with aromas of eucalyptus, red fruits, cotton candy and cinnamon. In the mouth, there are flavors of ripe sweet cherry and black raspberry. It is well balanced, with a pleasant, tannic finish.

title: Rigid Elm 2016 Muscat (Danube River Plains)
description: Brilliant straw colored in the glass, this wine has aromas of lemon rind and freshly mowed grass. There are flavors of vanilla bean, lime juice and lemon curd before the clean finish.

title: Tiki 2016 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine is bright and aromatic, with notes of guava, pineapple, grapefruit and a hint of grass. The palate is slippery in feel, with crunchy acidity and a long guava finish. Lovers of this style will find this a solid choice.

title: Tiki Sound 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Attractive, lifted notes of lemon, lime, nettle and green herbs follow from the nose to the palate. A touch of ripeness balances the zingy acidity, providing a slippery texture and feeling of ripe, juicy fruit. The finish is long and lemony.

title: Tohu 2017 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Aromas of snow pea, tomato leaf, passionfruit and lemon rind are followed by a crisp, citrusy palate of mouthwatering acidity and a slippery texture.

title: Toi Toi 2017 Sara Rosé (Marlborough)
description: Pale pink in color, this is a delicate, dry rosé. Wisps of fresh red berries, strawberry leaf and white pepper are balanced by bright acidity and just the touch of creaminess on the palate.

title: Villa di Corlo 2017  Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro
description: Delicate scents of field flower, warm bread crust and a whiff of orchard fruit come together on this elegant sparkler. The bright, silky palate offers sour cherry, pear and tangerine zest alongside tangy acidity and a vibrant, refined perlage.

title: Villa di Corlo 2017 Primevo  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)
description: Delicately scented, this has a fragrance reminiscent of violet and thyme. On the vibrant, foaming palate, bright acidity lifts crushed raspberry, strawberry compote, candied citrus zest and a hint of culinary spice before a crisp, dry finish.

title: Vins El Cep 2015 Gelida Pinot Noir Rosé Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: A tan color and aromas of peach and crushed vitamin tablets lead to a dry but foamy palate with bold acidity. Orange and cantaloupe flavors are lean and dry, while this is clean but short on the finish.
designation: Gelida Pinot Noir Rosé Brut Reserva

title: Vokel 2016 Starscape Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a crisp, lemony and green apple-laden white with moderate oak and a bright streak of acidity that keeps it balanced and refreshing.

title: Xavier Flouret 2016 Marly Domaine Hamelin  (Chablis)
description: A soft, rounded Chablis, this has a smooth texture that is gently cut by a steel edge of acidity. Well balanced, with a crisp aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Moss Roxx 2015 Ancient Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: An abundance of sweet-seeming, spicy oak fills the aroma and smothers the fruit flavors in this spice cabinet of a wine. It has lots of vanilla, ginger, nutmeg and maple flavors and full body.

title: Olelo 2016 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Light-red fruit, crushed gravel and a hint of gunmetal aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's lighter bodied on the palate with lots of turned soil flavors and just a touch of red fruit.

title: Palma Real 2017 MontePalma Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Piquant aromas of green fruits are feline in nature. This SB from Rueda feels chunky, with soft edges to the palate. Briny, lightly vegetal flavors of citrus fruit and bell pepper finish with just enough acid to make this worthwhile.

title: Pascal Berthier 2017 Roxanne  (Mâcon Chaintré)
description: A smooth and rounded wine that has a creamy texture, this is soft and ready to drink. Its yellow fruits are already fully integrated.

title: Stone Castle 2016 Chardonnay (Rahoveci Valley)
description: This wine offers aromas of lemon zest, white peach and gooseberry. In the mouth there are flavors of lemon zest and lemon curd.

title: Totara 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: There seems to a rubbery onion character here that's somewhat masking the guava, passionfruit and pineapple characters. The palate is rich but crisp at the same time, with tongue-tingling acidity.

title: Univitis 2016 Grand Théatre  (Bordeaux)
description: This soft, lightly woody blend dominated by Merlot is ready to drink. Easygoing red-berry fruits are lifted by some acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Aresti 2017 Bellavista Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)
description: Jammy berry aromas are cool, herbal and quiet. A fleshy palate comes with rubbing tannins, while this tastes of herbal plum and green herb. A minty, spicy finish is rough and tannic in feel.

title: Ballard Lane 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: A slightly darker shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling shows dried apple, wet hay and orange touches on the nose. The palate offers apple, pear and lime flavors, but without much texture or energy.

title: Barberani 2016 Grechetto (Umbria)
description: Made with organic grapes, this has delicate scents of spring blossom. Crisp, light-bodied and simple, the palate suggests dried apricot and a hint of bitter almond.

title: Château Carignan 2017 L'Orangerie de Carignan Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Blending half-and-half Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is fruity, with a caramel edge and plenty of crisp acidity. It is ready to drink.

title: Château Lauzanet 2016  Bordeaux
description: Jammy and juicy, this wine is full of fruit. Structure and tannins take a back seat. Blackberry flavors and acidity will give it an attractive, if lightweight, future. Drink from 2020.

title: Dirt Diva 2015 Red (Paso Robles)
description: There is beautiful packaging on this bottle, yet it contains less-than-beautiful wine. Aromas of vinegar-laced cranberry sauce leads into tangy cooked cranberry flavors on the sip.

title: Domaine du Mont Épin 2016  Mâcon-Péronne
description: This soft wine with ripe yellow fruits is rounded and smoothly textured. It's fruity, with just enough acidity. Drink the wine now.

title: Domaine Gueugnon 2017  Mâcon-Charnay
description: This crisp, fresh wine has bright acidity and lively apple and citrus fruits. The focus is on the wine's light texture and the perfumed, ready-to-drink character.

title: Emina 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A briny smelling nose includes aromas of pickled fruit, pineapple and pine tree. A phenolic skins-driven palate tastes briny like this smells. A quick, salty finish fades out without much fruit.

title: Farmhouse 2017 White (California)
description: This wine has a pink tinge in the color and strong floral and fruity aromas. It is peachy in flavor, light in body and slightly sweet, making it an aromatic, picnic-style wine.

title: Graham Norton's Own 2017 Pink by Design Rosé (New Zealand)
description: Ultra pale in color, this feather light pink from UK television host Graham Norton shows delicate notes of grapefruit, raspberry and white pepper spice amidst a bone-dry palate that's crisp and refreshing. Nothing exciting here, but nothing objectionable either.

title: Grape Creek Vineyards 2016 Riesling (Texas)
description: Perfumed notes of rose and lily are joined by lime zest and candied orange on the nose of this refreshing, but simple Riesling. On the light footed and playful palate there is an orange flavored sweetness throughout, with notes of tart green apple, ripe lemon and pear. There are some chalky, mineral notes that quietly add depth to the palate, while ripe grapefruit and lime round out the finish.

title: Kenwood 2017 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)
description: Golden in color, this wine opens bright and fresh on the nose before providing a lush, creamy and fruit-forward experience of indelible ripeness on the palate.

title: J. Lohr 2016 Gesture Mourvèdre (Paso Robles)
description: Earthy on the nose, this bottling shows tobacco, cigar box, crusty brioche and purple-flower aromas. Rounded and tart berry fruits meet with pencil shavings and crushed graphite flavors on the palate.

title: Jermann 2015 Where Dreams Have No End White (Venezia Giulia)
description: Aromas of cedar, white flower and toasted hazelnut lead the nose. The savory, medium-bodied palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, grapefruit and a touch of papaya alongside bright acidity.

title: Kia Ora 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A salty character leads the nose and palate, followed closely by notes of peach, pineapple and orange. Creamy textured, with mouthwatering acidity, those tangy fruit flavors follow all the way through to the finish.

title: Las Niñas 2015 Reserva Syrah (Apalta)
description: A bright, fruity nose is just right for this type of Syrah, which is charged up and fairly stocky. Chocolaty richness is imparted onto wild berry flavors, while this is steady and tastes of coffee on the finish. This is a top value red from Apalta.

title: Lawrelin 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: As one might expect, this wine shows a fair amount of evolution aromatically, with notes of mushroom, leather, dried cherry, cedar and anise. The palate offers a seamless feel that continues through the finish. The balance is impressive. It has some life in front of it but is at peak or a little over. Drink now.

title: Le Bertarole 2013 Podere Le Maragnole  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Dark berry, scorched earth and leather lead the nose. The solid palate delivers blackberry jam, fig and mocha alongside firm tannins.

title: Luke 2016 Syrah (Wahluke Slope)
description: The aromas are light, with notes of toast, huckleberry and herb. The palate brings ripe, fleshy but still deft blue and black fruit flavors that taper toward the dark chocolate filled finish. One wants more aromatically, but it's still a lot of wine for the money.

title: Madame Veuve Point 2015  Pommard
description: Bright, ripe and juicy, this is already an attractive wine. Its tannins are powerful and give a dry edge to the red fruits. Already, though, there is a sense of balance to this rich, fruity wine. Drink from 2023.

title: Madame Veuve Point 2017  Viré-Clessé
description: Warm and ripe, this is a rich wine. Its soft texture and generous character gives a tropical character that contrasts with a touch of nuttiness and spice. Drink now.

title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2017 Closerie des Alisiers  (Saint-Véran)
description: This wine is rounded and ripe, with ripe fruits balanced by a touch of acidity. The texture is open and full, giving a rich aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Naggiar 2016 Estate Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine has pleasant red-cherry and sour-cherry aromas, a plush mouthfeel and mellow ripe fruit flavors. Moderate acidity and tannins give it some good heft in the texture.

title: NewRhône Millesimes 2016 Romain Duvernay Red (Beaumes-de-Venise)
description: Hints of tobacco leaf and forest floor lend savory nuances to ripe, plush black cherry and mulberry flavors here. It's a ruddy, full-bodied wine with plush texture and soft, rounded acidity. The finish is framed by ripe but persistent tannins. Enjoy now through 2023.

title: Oltrenero NV Cruasè Pinot Nero (Oltrepò Pavese)
description: Exhilarating aromas of wild red berry, peach and a warm whiff of bread crust take center stage on this fragrant sparkler. The aromas carry over to the racy palate along with tangerine zest and a note of bitter almond.

title: Peju 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a robust, ripe varietal wine blended with 24% Cabernet Sauvignon. Soft and lightly spiced, it imparts rich dense flavors of black cherry, blackberry and plum.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a soft, full-bodied wine made in reasonable quantities, its flavor profile marked by a wealth of caramelized cola flavor and blackberry jam. Dried herb, espresso bean and clove last on the finish.

title: Robert Mondavi 2015 Cabernet Franc (Oakville)
description: With a strong addition of 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this offers sizable tannin weight and herbal components of dusty earthy minerality. It is full bodied and tightly woven in black plum, violet and anise.

title: Roccafiore 2015 Fiorfiore Grechetto (Umbria)
description: Made entirely with Grechetto, this opens with scents of citrus blossom, Spanish broom and beeswax. The juicy palate delivers yellow peach, mature Bosc pear and a hint of almond alongside bright acidity. It closes on a saline note.

title: Santa Ema 2015 Catalina Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Gamy, herbal berry aromas are spicy and minty. A smacking palate is drawing and gives off a sense of tartaric acidity. Herbal, spicy plum and berry flavors finish with classic Chilean notes of tobacco, mint and eucalyptus. This is mostly Cabernet Sauvignon, with Carmenère and Cab Franc.

title: Schug 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Effusively floral, this is a soft, earthy wine sourced from several sites within the appellation. Baked cherry and raspberry elements are accented in mint and turned earth, with a grainy underbelly of texture and acidity.

title: Scotto Family Cellars 2017 Anthony & Dominic Dry Rosé (North Coast)
description: This low-alcohol wine has plenty of crisp fruit flavors, good balance between body and acidity, and a fresh, gripping texture. Light raspberry and red cherry tones lend plenty of substance on the palate.

title: Carpenè Malvolti 2013 Brut Metodo Classico Chardonnay (Vino Spumante)
description: White orchard fruit, yellow spring flower and crusty bread aromas lead the way on this soft sparkler that's made from Chardonnay. The bright palate offers Golden Delicious apple, candied lemon slice and toasted nut set against crisp acidity and a refined perlage.

title: Cebada 2014 Cuvée Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A touch sour on the nose, this bottling offers earthy yet fruit-punch-like aromas of pomegranate and sage. The body is light on the palate and framed in a chalky texture, offering tangy red fruit and a slightly sour finish.

title: Cecchi 2017  Vernaccia di San Gimignano
description: This opens with subtle aromas of citrus blossom and ripe orchard fruit. The juicy palate delivers lemon zest, ginger and a touch of raw almond alongside rather fresh acidity.

title: Cesarini Sforza NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Alpine herb and white stone fruit aromas mingle with a whiff of bread crust. The racy palate offers lemon, Golden Delicious apple and a hint of nut alongside a lively perlage.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2016  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: This wine, inevitably rich because of the vintage, is concentrated, full in the mouth and ripe. Just enough acidity gives it a fresh edge but the wine is more about opulence and generosity. Drink now.

title: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2016  Bordeaux
description: This rich wine that is smoothly structured with spice and smoky fruit shows excellent potential. Density, dusty tannins and bright acidity all point to readiness from 2021.

title: Château de la Borde 2015 En Cuillerie Hervé Kerlann  (Hautes Cotes de Beaune)
description: Bright and tight with an attractive smoky character, this wine is fresh. It also offers cherry and red-berry flavors that are only lightly touched by tannins. Drink from 2020.

title: Château de Parenchère 2016 Cuvée Raphaël  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: A balanced wine, this is full of black fruits as well as rich tannins. It is concentrated and dense, typical of the vintage. At this stage, it is a firm wine but one that will soften. Drink from 2022.

title: Château des Antonins 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Wood aging still shows in this wine, balanced by the red fruits and firm tannins. The acidity and potential richness mean it will be an attractive wine from 2021.

title: Château Grand Français 2016 Cuvée Heritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This vineyard, close to Saint-Émilion, has been cultivated since the 15th century. The wine, with succulent young fruit, attractive tannins and black-currant flavors, is still developing. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Graves de Pez 2014  Saint-Estèphe
description: This third-generation property of seven acres is close to the village of Saint-Estèphe on the Pez plateau. Fruity and juicy, the wine is beginning to approach maturity. Its tannins and wood aging are still showing although they are beginning to be well integrated. Wait a few years and drink this wine from 2023.

title: Château Grossombre de Saint-Joseph 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: A rich André Lurton wine, this offers tannins backed by black-currant flavors and acidity. The wine is developing relatively quickl, giving plenty of fruitiness as well as good acidity. Drink from 2022.

title: Château la Freynelle 2016 La Freynelle  (Bordeaux)
description: This concentrated wine with dense tannins is powerful. It has big black fruits, a ripe structure as well as great fruitiness. Drink this already balanced wine from 2020.

title: Château Lagrave Paran 2015 Coeur de Cuvée  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This wine comes from a small eight-acre estate at the heart of the Entre-Deux-Mers, It is ripe, juicy and full bodied, with dense fruit and sweet tannins that are typical of the vintage. It should age for a few years although it will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Château les Conseillans 2016  Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Attractive berry flavors and a generous texture give weight and a ripe character to this wine. Blackberries and currants show well among the spice, with dense tannins carrying through the finish. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Tour de Gilet 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This wine is all about fruit, with ripe tannins to complement the blackberry flavors and good acidity. It is a wine with potential, fruity and structured at the same time. Drink from 2022.

title: Concha y Toro 2016 Gravas del Maipo Syrah (Buin)
description: Not on par with prior vintages, this high-end Syrah smells soupy and savory. No shock then that this feels thick and compacted, almost syrupy. Chocolaty berry flavors are oaky and pound with heat on the finish. Maybe this was affected by 2016's El Niño rains.

title: Corte Rugolin 2012 Monte Danieli Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: This opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, resin and roasted coffee bean. The warm, dense palate delivers espresso, dried black cherry, clove and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins.

title: Cuatro Rayas 2017 Cuarenta Vendimias Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: A lightly vegetal nose with fruitier bolts of mango and melon leads to a juicy palate with bright, banging acidity. This outdoes many Rueda Sauvignon Blancs via spicy green fruit and melon flavors and clean and proper balance. Drink now.

title: Debts and Lessons 2017 Zabala Vineyard Riesling (Monterey County)
description: Quite light in color, nearly water in appearance, this off-dry Riesling is a very pleasant, delicately sweet experience. Aromas of honeysuckle, lychee, canned pears and white rocks leads into a palate that blends sweet apple with chalky minerality and pithy tension.

title: Domaine Michel et Joanna Ecard 2015 Aux Gravains Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Richly structured, this wine is dense and complex. With rich fruits as well as some firm tannins, it is a balanced wine that will age well. Drink this full wine from 2022.

title: Domaine Saint Pierre 2015 Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: Sultry black cherry and cassis flavors are accented by hints of crushed granite and wild mint in this supple Grenache-Syrah blend. It's full bodied and generous in character, but hints of coffee and olive lend savory complexity. The finish is marked by firm, fine-grained tannins. Enjoy now–2026.

title: Dubl 2015 + Brut Metodo Classico Greco (Vino Spumante)
description: Delicate scents evoking field flower, orchard fruit, toasted bread, and just a whiff of Mediterranean brush lift out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the silky palate doles out white peach, yellow apple, juicy citrus and a hint of hazelnut alongside a creamy perlage.

title: Entrepreneur 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Bright, tangy acidity helps lift a soft midpalate of polished tannin in this appellation wine. It has enviable structure to offer around a layered flavor array of cassis, red currant and black cherry, its secondary characteristics playfully savory in black pepper and clove.

title: Francis Coppola 2016 Diamond Collection Black Label Claret Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Superripe flavors of black cherry juice and blackberry jam give this full-bodied wine richness and depth. It is concentrated and deep, showing dark chocolate and blueberry flavors, with light spicy, oaky accents of vanilla, cedar and mocha.

title: Giesen 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Aromatic but not bombastic, this shows grapefruit, apple and lemon aromas on the nose that are followed by herbal notes of tomato leaf, mint and grass. There's a focused line of acidity on the palate that cuts through the fruit and rounded texture but doesn't jut out. Drink now–2023.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2016 Jose S Ferrer Selection Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Thirst quenching in Meyer lemon, wet stone and salty oak, this wine evolves in the glass to become something more robust in body and ripeness, delving into concentrated apple and pear laced in ginger.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Blanc (Carneros)
description: This is a lovely white, vibrant and citrus-driven in acidity and freshness and focus. Nicely melded flavors of melon, lime and grapefruit accent a light-bodied, elegant style that will do well as an apéritif or meal accompaniment.

title: Goldschmidt 2013 Plus Yoeman Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Aged in new oak, this wine is rich and syrupy thick. The oak takes on smoky overtones that mesh well with the ripe cherry fruit, with flavors of sage and clove as well. The tannins are polished yet burly, adding sizable structure into the mix.

title: Jaffelin 2015  Aloxe-Corton
description: Smoky and fruity, this rich wine has fine tannins and a sumptuous texture. Fresh red fruits balance the generosity. It is just starting out and will not be ready to drink before 2023.

title: Koyle 2015 Royale Los Lingues Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Cola, mint and eucalyptus aromas are attached to a spicy berry tone. The full-bodied palate is saturated yet balanced, while pepper and blackberry flavors come with an herbal undertone. Drink through 2025.

title: Le Mas des Flauzieres 2016 Four Danuga  (Gigondas)
description: Blackberry and cherry flavors are fleshy and forward in this intensely juicy, fruity wine. Made from 70% Grenache, its silken and supple but builds in density and tannic structure. The finish has a slightly puckering note of Asian salt-cured plums. Approachable now but should improve through 2028.

title: Lynmar 2016 Susanna's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tight and tannic, this is a bold coastal-influenced red. It's thick and richly layered in dense flavors of pomegranate, dark cherry and blood orange. The oak and spice elements are well integrated and add complexity.

title: Nobilo 2017 Icon Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine offers the classic Marlborough combo of ripe tropical fruit flavors and subtle touches of snow pea and nettle leaf. It's the palate that really brings things up a notch with its chalky texture, stony minerality, mouthwatering acidity and long, juicy finish.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a rich, layered wine offering sizable notions of oak within a powerful backdrop of Meyer lemon, melon and apple. It has dense concentration and richness that finds balance in underlying acidity and a mineral tease of crushed rock.

title: Pierre Amadieu 2016 Domaine Grand Romane  (Gigondas)
description: Opulent and ripe, this full-bodied red is packed with fleshy black cherry and plum flavors. It's an open-knit, easy wine but freshened by hints of bramble and crushed mineral freshness. Ripe, sinewy tannins accentuate its supple, yielding mouthfeel. It's ready to drink now but should hold well through 2026.

title: Summers 2016 Villa Andriana Vineyard 20th Anniversary Charbono (Calistoga)
description: This obscure variety thrives in small amounts in the appellation and is done justice by this bottling. A fruity palate of cherry, vanilla and strawberry is complemented by lavender and white pepper. Soft in texture, it's lovely and lingering on the palate.

title: Tonello NV  Lessini Durello
description: Lemon zest and bread crust aromas follow through to the vibrant, creamy palate along with mature yellow apple and a hint of wild herb. A tangy mineral note evoking oyster shell closes the finish while bright acidity and a silky mousse provide the backdrop.

title: Travaglino 2012 Monteceresino Rosé Brut Metodo Classico Pinot Nero (Oltrepò Pavese)
description: Savory and juicy, this radiant sparkler has berry, bread crust and baking spice aromas. On the tangy palate, a silky mousse provides the backdrop for succulent strawberry, pomegranate and a hint of hazelnut.

title: Château Maison Noble Saint Martin 2016  Bordeaux
description: Bold tannins, rich wood flavors and equally rich black fruits have produced a powerful wine. Its richness and concentration are going to yield an impressive wine as it develops. Drink from 2022.

title: Gruet NV Sauvage Rosé Sparkling (America)
description: The aromas are fresh in this pale-salmon sparkling wine, showing yellow cherries, lillies and fresh baked rolls. The bubbles are pillowy in feel, while bright, tingling acidity wakes up the palate that offers flavors of brioche, lemon zest, juicy strawberry and cherry. It finishes on notes of yeasty brioche and preserved lemon.

title: Jaffelin 2015 Sur les Grèves-Clos Sainte Anne Monopole  (Beaune)
description: This firm, smoky wine is still showing its wood aging. It has richness to go with that wood, giving the potential for a powerful, ripe and juicy wine from 2023.
designation: Sur les Grèves-Clos Sainte Anne Monopole

title: Letrari 2009 Brut Rosé +4 Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: Made with Chardonnay and Pinot Nero, this has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of red berry and bread crust. Reflecting the nose, the racy, linear palate offers suggestions of sour cherry, toasted nut and tangerine rind alongside small, continuous bubbles.

title: Llopart 2015 Brut Reserva Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Light strawberry and raspberry aromas are a touch jammy and sweet smelling. This Monastrell-based rosé is slightly aggressive but not coarse on the palate. Peachy, melony flavors are more generic than specific, while this finishes clean and easy.

title: Madame Veuve Point 2016  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune
description: This young wine comes from vineyards in the hills west of Beaune. It delights in the red fruits of the vintage, balancing the fruit with spice and some firm tannins. It needs to age and should be drinkable from 2021.

title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2016 Bianco White (Pomino)
description: A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Bianco, this has a delicate fragrance of orchard fruit and white flower. The vibrant, savory palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, citrus and a touch of thyme, while fresh acidity provides the framework.

title: Margerum 2017 Riesling (Santa Barbara County)
description: Bright and chalky aromas of orange blossoms and lemon-lime soda are nearly effervescent on the nose of this bottling from Kick-On Ranch. There is solid tension to the sip, where slightly sweet apple, peach and candied-lemon flavors ride buoyant acidity.

title: Nicosia 2017 Fondo Filara  (Etna)
description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this has pretty scents of wild berry, blue flower and aromatic herb. Savory and easygoing, the palate doles out juicy black cherry, clove and star anise, while a salty note backs up the close. Smooth tannins provide light support.

title: Oltrenero NV Brut Metodo Classico Pinot Nero (Oltrepò Pavese)
description: Delicately scented, this offers aromas suggesting white flower, red berry and a whiff of bread dough. The vibrant palate evokes pomegranate, peach and tangerine alongside a silky mousse. A slightly bitter walnut note lingers on the finish.

title: Parusso 2013 Metodo Classico Brut Nebbiolo (Vino Spumante)
description: This lively sparkler opens with understated aromas suggesting chopped dill, wild berry and a whiff of toast. The vibrant palate delivers juicy red cherry, blood orange, nutmeg and a hazelnut note alongside a rather vigorous perlage and firm acidity.

title: Peltier 2017 Estate Grown Vermentino (Lodi)
description: Herb, chalk and white-pepper notes make this light- to medium-bodied wine unusual and interesting to taste. It shows that Lodi has a hipster side. There is a lean texture, a little nip of mineral flavor and a nice touch of bitterness on the palate.

title: Piandaccoli 2011 In Primis Red (Toscana)
description: A blend of 70% Sangiovese, 20% Pugnitello and 10% Foglia Tonda, this offers aromas of dark berry, cedar and leather. The firm palate evokes mature black plum, clove and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Rotari 2011 Alpe Regis Extra Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Made entirely with Chardonnay, this vivacious sparkler has aromas of bread crust, orchard fruit and a whiff of citrus. Reflecting the nose, the vibrant palate delivers toasted hazelnut, ripe yellow apple and lemon zest set against bright acidity and a continuous perlage.

title: Santa Ema 2015 Rivalta Limited Selection Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Herbal berry and heavy oak aromas are common for Chilean blends like this, which is led by Cabernet Sauvignon. A saturated palate shows tartaric acidity that's so juicy that it seems out of place. Cherry and plum flavors are electric due to said acidity. Wrapping things up, this is scratchy on the finish.

title: Sunday Mountain 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Showing the restraint of the vintage, this wine offers notes of guava, lemon verbena and white spice. Prickly acidity weaves into a chalky wet-stone note on the palate, finishing long, citrusy and mouthwatering.

title: Sylvaine et Alain Normand 2016  Mâcon La Roche Vineuse
description: An attractive, crisp wine with lively fruit and a tight, mineral texture, this is structured and perfumed. Drink this bright wine now.

title: Tenuta di Fessina 2015 Erse  (Etna)
description: Aromas of scorched earth, leather, garrigue and dark culinary spice lead the way. The bright palate is rather lean, offering dried cherry, raw cranberry, a hint of star anise and a salty note alongside dusty tannins and surprisingly lively acidity.

title: Terra Costantino 2016 De Aetna  (Etna)
description: Made with organically cultivated grapes, this has aromas of dark-skinned berry, blue flower, Mediterranean brush and baking spice. It's straightforward and savory, doling out juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry, star anise and clove alongside lively acidity and taut, polished tannins that give it a drying finish.

title: Vincent Girardin 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Pommard)
description: This wine has structure and a firm edge of tannins. It also offers rich fruits and layers of smoky acidity. These elements suggest a wine for aging. Drink from 2023.

title: Vivaldi 2015 Ai Colli  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
description: Aromas of mature black-skinned berry, mocha and tobacco emerge from the glass. The chewy palate delivers ripe black cherry, licorice and a hint of cocoa alongside smooth tannins.

title: Le Casque 2017 Adrian White (Sierra Foothills)
description: Soothing and creamy to sip, this medium-bodied blend of white Rhône grape varieties has subtle fruit flavors but a very appealing, rich texture that coats the mouth and lingers on the finish. It tastes lush, figgy and indulgent.

title: Madame Veuve Point 2015  Puligny-Montrachet
description: From the rich 2015 vintage, this is a full, ripe wine. Honey and creamed-apple flavors are made richer by the touches of nectarine and light acidity. It offers hints of toast as well as spice. Drink now.

title: McPherson 2016 Grenache Blanc (Texas)
description: Wet rock, stone fruit and papaya aromas are anchored by lemon pith on the nose. The palate opens with grapefruit, lemon, shale, clementine peels and yellow apple. A chalky mineral base is nearly creamy, with some zest on top tons of tingling acidity. A white pepper note leads to a long, tingling lime-juice finish that's invigorated by a chalky mineral edge.

title: Merotto NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)
description: Aromas of white rose and orchard fruit lift out of the glass. The aromas carry on to the silky, vibrant palate along with yellow apple, yellow peach and a candied almond note.

title: Pacific Rim 2017 J Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: After showing a touch of reduction out of the gate, the aromas open to show notes of orange rind and citrus. It drinks off dry, with an appealing balance of stone fruit and citrus flavors that persist on the long finish.

title: Pecchenino 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Toasted oak, hazelnut and pressed wildflower aromas lead the nose. The smooth, rather lean-bodied palate offers bread crust, mature yellow apple and hint of citrus alongside and elegant perlage and racy acidity.

title: Stefano Antonucci 2015 Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: Delicately scented, this offers pressed chamomile, Spanish Broom and tropical fruit aromas. The rich, juicy palate offers pineapple, yellow peach and candied citrus alongside somewhat tangy acidity.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Swanson 2017 Pinot Grigio (San Benito County)
description: A slightly pink shade of yellow in the glass, this fresh bottling offers aromas of red apple and citrus spray on the nose. The mouthfeel is rounded and smooth, carrying flavors of peach, lime zest and a touch of salinity.

title: Tenuta Sant'Antonio 2015 Selezione Antonio Castagnedi  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
description: Aromas of dark berry, cedar and a balsamic note lead the nose. The full-bodied palate offers ripe black plum, mocha and a tobacco alongside firm tannins.

title: Travaglino 2014 Cuvée 59 Metodo Classico Sparkling (Oltrepò Pavese)
description: Vibrant and tangy, this has aromas of yellow stone fruit, citrus and a whiff of crusty bread. It's bright and juicy, with golden apple, peach and lemon drop alongside crisp acidity and a lively perlage.

title: Villa Sandi NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)
description: Honeysuckle, acacia and white stone fruit aromas delicately shape the nose. On the foaming palate, vibrant acidity brightens ripe yellow apple, Bartlett pear and a candied citrus zest note.

title: William Heritage 2015 Estate Reserve Brut Rosé (Outer Coastal Plain)
description: Aromas of croissant and golden raspberry are delicate on the nose. Bright, rich flavors of cherry and papaya on the palate are laced with grapefruit acidity and an underpinning of biscuit dough. Somewhat frothy bubbles are persistent but light, while a strawberry flavor emerges on the finish.

title: William Heritage 2017 Estate Grown Pét-Nat Rosé (Outer Coastal Plain)
description: A quiet melon aroma can be teased from the glass with some swirling. Juicy lemon, clementine and ripe strawberry flavors migle with a grassy note on the supremely refreshing palate that displays tingling, delicate bubbles. Fresh squeezed lime and watermelon notes are endless.

title: Pacific Rim 2017 Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas are vibrant, with notes of tangerine peel, lime zest and jasmine. It drinks medium sweet, with plentiful stone fruit and citrus flavors, with zippy acidity on the finish. Yum.

title: Artesa 2016 Estate Vineyard Block 92 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This wine opens in high-toned aromas of jasmine and apple blossom and is textured on the palate. It takes on a full-bodied ripe concentration of baked apple and tropical flavors wrapped in sweet oak.

title: Barnett 2015 Merlot (Spring Mountain District)
description: Made with 13% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Cabernet Franc, this is juicy in cherry and berry, a fruit-forward and roundly soft wine that's pleasantly structured, full bodied and fresh.

title: Berberana NV Gran Tradición Rosé Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: A bold pink color and friendly aromas of stone fruit and red plum get this rosé off to a good start. A dry, fresh, citrusy palate is in good shape, while this tastes of orange and snappy red fruits. No funk or bitterness on the finish is a plus.

title: Bodegas Eidosela 2017 Ethereo Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Oily aromas of citrus peel and vanilla cookie are a touch green and herbal. This Albariño feels chunky and round, with flavors of lemon and green herb. On the finish, green notes of oregano and thyme are as prominent if not more so than fruit.

title: Butternut 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine has aromas like toasted bread and black pepper, followed by ripe blackberry flavors and a firm structure of grippy tannins and mild acidity. It is medium to full bodied and offers plenty of character, so don't let the screwcap be a negative.

title: Domaine Sophie Cinier 2017  Mâcon-Fuissé
description: Textured as well as fruity, this is already a delicious, crisp wine. It has a good balance between citrus acidity and riper pear flavors. The wine is fresh and ready to drink.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Deep aromas of boysenberry, slate and pine show on the nose of this bottling from an appellation in San Benito County. Turned loam flavors arise on the earthy palate, which also offers dark cherry, strong acidity and firm structure that still needs some time to smooth out.

title: Folie à Deux 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is an easygoing approachable wine that's soft and supple in texture. Well integrated, it has a generous ripeness of black plum and mocha that plays well on the palate.

title: Glazebrook 2016 040°S-177°E Regional Reserve Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)
description: Medium gold in color, this Hawke's Bay Chard starts a bit reductive at first, eventually showing notes of lemon, lime, pineapple, nuts, toast and butterscotch. There's nice citrusy zing on the palate although the oak is a little clunky.

title: Kitson 2016 Black Knight Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From an organically farmed, high-elevation site east of the Petaluma Gap, this is a moderately light, delicate wine with cherry fruit and wisps of baking spice to offer. It retains an impressive grasp of minerality that tastes of crushed rock.

title: Lexicon 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine is shy at first, whispering notes of lemon, grapefruit, tomato leaf and jalapeño. It is chalky in texture, with those grapefruit and green notes running through to a finish that shows a bit of bitterness.

title: Llano Estacado 2015 Harvest Reserve Tempranillo (Texas)
description: Aromas of crushed blackberry, pomegranate and blueberry are fleshed out by white pepper. Crushed-velvet tannins and structured, balanced acidity house flavors of red cherry, plum, bay leaf, white pepper and leather.

title: Lodi Estates 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a good, solid choice that will be versatile at the table. Fresh black-cherry and red-cherry aromas and flavors ride on an appetizing structure of light tannins and good acidity.

title: Madame Veuve Point 2015 Climat Epenottes  (Beaune)
description: Bright red-fruit tones dominate this attractive, forward wine. With a touch of tannins, it shows potential. For the moment, the fruitiness is all, but wait for the wine to fill out and get the richness of the vintage. Drink from 2021.

title: Maison Bouey 2016 Château Baruaud  (Bordeaux)
description: Ripe fruit and fine tannins are well balanced in this rich wine. With its acidity and juicy black-currant fruits, the wine is already delicious. Drink this attractive wine from 2021.

title: Maude 2017 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)
description: This is an aromatic style that bursts with exotic notes of lychee, papaya and guava. These tones lead into a creamy mouthfeel that shows some ripness and plenty of fruit weight but doesn't go overboard. Not overly complicated but likable nonetheless.

title: McManis 2017 Certified Sustainable Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Very fruity and fresh, this light-bodied wine shows vivid floral and apple aromas and flavors. It's attractively clean, snappy and straightforward.

title: Medlock Ames 2015 Kate's and B's Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Sticky in blueberry, coffee and leather, this wine presents as full bodied and big in style, with a savory smoothness on the texture.

title: Messina Hof 2016 Artist Series Sangiovese (Texas High Plains)
description: Ripe blueberry, prune and baked blackberry aromas are a touch soft on the nose. Ripe blueberry and pomegranate flavors are juicy and come with plenty of acidity, while gritty tannins bring along black pepper spice. Mouthwatering cranberry acidity surrounds sandy tannins and black pepper on the lingering finish.

title: Navas 1212 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Blackberry and cassis aromas are clean and fruity, but only moderately intense. A pulpy, fruit-filled palate is on the grabby side, while this tastes of leathery berry and black plum. Notes of chocolate and oak spice are apparent on the finish.

title: Nicosia 2012 Contrada Monte Gorna  (Etna)
description: Ripe black-skinned fruit, baking spice, French oak and camphor aromas take shape in the glass. The linear, lean-bodied palate reflects the nose, offering vanilla, oak-driven spice and strawberry compote alongside close-grained, drying tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Zinfandel (Mendocino)
description: This non-oaky wine is somehow brawny and pretty at the same time. It offers wonderful cherry-like floral aromas and equally focused bright flavors, along with a definitely dry palate and full body.

title: Paul Cheneau NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Reserva Méthode Traditionnelle Sparkling (Cava)
description: Aromas of white bread, white flower and dried mango lead to a citrusy palate with pulpy weight but also foaminess. Candied white fruit flavors lack specificity, while this shows mild pyrazine-based bitterness on the finish.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Brut Reserva Méthode Traditionnelle

title: Quady 2016 Elysium Black Muscat (California)
description: Quite sweet but not heavy in body, this fruity, rich and concentrated wine is filled with sweet plum and bright cherry flavors, has a sugary texture and lingering finish.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Founding Farmers Zinfandel (St. Helena)
description: Earthy and brimming in crisp red fruit, this is a floral, somewhat ethereal wine that's powerfully built in ripe plum and licorice that finishes in grippy tannin.

title: Balderdash 2013 Trademark Red Grenache (Edna Valley)
description: There is intense color and even a dark-chocolate kick on the nose of this bottling, along with more usual aromas of baked berry, plum jam and clove. The tannins are a tad sticky on the sip, carrying boysenberry flavors and plentiful acidity.

title: Balletto 2015 Cider Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a medium-bodied white offers plenty of personality, displaying tones of vanilla wafer and Meyer lemon. These flavors combine effortlessly on the palate to provide a well-balanced experience.
designation: Cider Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Balletto 2016 Emerson Block Burnside Road Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is earthy, ripe and lush in texture. The palate is velvety and generous, displaying dark cherry and raspberry flavors, with lavender, rose petal and earthy forest-floor tones backing it up.
designation: Emerson Block Burnside Road Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Barberani 2014 Luigi e Giovanna  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)
description: Delicate scents evoking yellow stone fruit, pressed flower, beeswax and crushed herb lift out of the glass. The bright, linear palate delivers mature apricot, tangerine zest and a hint of white almond alongside vibrant acidity.

title: Bisol 2017 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)
description: Delicate scents of banana, honeysuckle and tropical fruit lead the nose on this foaming wine. The off-dry palate offers ripe white peach, pineapple and a dollop of vanilla pastry cream alongside a silky mousse.

title: Bodegas Muriel 2017 Pazo Cilleiro Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Nectarine and tangerine aromas are bright and clean. On the palate, this is plump yet balanced by a zip of acidity. Orange, nectarine and honey flavors finish with length and a sense of healthy ripeness. Drink now.

title: Cavicchioli 2017 Vigna del Cristo  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)
description: Celebrating the 30th vintage of this bottling, this wine opens with delicate scents of violet, strawberry and a whiff of baking spice. On the ripe palate, fresh acidity lifts mature black cherry, raspberry and candied tangerine zest before the dry finish.

title: Château Bolaire 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Ripe and spicy, balancing tannins with dark fruits, this wine has excellent potential. It is solid and concentrated. Tannins from the wood and from the black fruits have come together well. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Lauduc 2016 Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This is a ripe, full-bodied wine. With fine tannins and rich black-currant fruits, it is concentrated and complex. Ripeness shines through the tannins to give a wine with aging ability. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Roques Mauriac 2016 Damnation  (Bordeaux)
description: Mint aromas and the wood flavors of this wine give it a sweet character that contrasts with the juicy fruits and good acidity that come through strongly. This ripe, balanced wine will develop well. Drink from 2021.

title: Corteforte 2009 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Ripe dark fruit, cedar and a balsamic note lead the nose on this big, brawny red. The densely concentrated palate offers raisin, blackberry jam, licorice and mocha framed in tightly wound tannins.

title: Domaine Coste Caumartin 2015 Le Clos des Boucherottes Monopole Premier Cru  (Pommard)
description: Sourced from a 4.5-acre vineayrd, this wine is ripe and juicy, with attractive fruits and generous tannins. Currently, the bold fruits are coming through strongly. Drink from 2023.
designation: Le Clos des Boucherottes Monopole Premier Cru

title: Domaine de Beaumalric 2016 L'Extrait Red (Beaumes-de-Venise)
description: Sourced from vineyards planted on clay and chalk hills, this intensely ripe wine offers layers of blueberry and preserved blackberry flavors accented by licorice and dried herb. It's a plush, fruity wine rimmed with ripe, silky tannins and best enjoyed now–2025.

title: Domaine de la Jobeline 2016 Clos des Chanaux  (Mâcon-Verze)
description: Spicy and nutty is this wine's meme. Punctuated with fresh apple and green-plum flavors, it is crisp while also having some complexity. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Domaine de la Tourade 2015 Red (Vacqueyras)
description: Base notes of earth and garrigue lend complexity to flavors of ripe, roasted black cherry and strawberry here. It's full bodied and mouthfilling but elegantly balanced by fresh acidity and fine, firm tannins. A stately wine that drinks well now but should improve through 2026.

title: Domaine les Amouriers 2015 Les Genestes Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: Integrated aromas of toast, spice and bramble accent plump black cherry and berry in this 50-50 blend of old-vine Grenache and Syrah. It's a penetrating, hefty wine framed by firm, grippy tannins and pert acidity along with enticing kicks of olive and earth that linger on the finish. Hold till 2019; it should drink nicely through 2028.

title: Domaine Serrigny 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune
description: This rich wine is dense with both tannins and ripe fruit. Plenty of black-cherry acidity along with a solid, firm texture will let it age well. This wine brings out both the ripe fruit of the vintage and smooth character of the appellation.

title: Duckhorn 2015 Merlot (Atlas Peak)
description: Grown at high elevation, this is 100% varietal. Thick in mocha, oak and dusty sage, it speaks to strong tannin and oak, providing a punch of full-bodied ripeness and chocolate-covered plum.

title: En Garde 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Thick and dense in blue fruit and billowy tannin, this is a well-made, hyper ripe red, generous in oak and a lasting thread of leather and black pepper.

title: Francesco Bellei 2016 Ancestrale  (Lambrusco di Modena)
description: Strawberry, crushed herb and bread crust aromas follow over to the savory, softly sparkling palate along with watermelon and a hint of minerals. Tangy acidity provides fresh support.

title: Albert Bichot 2016  Santenay
description: This village Santenay is soft and creamy. Attractive apple fruits and good acidity cut through the richness. Smooth and just lightly juicy, the wine will be ready from 2019.

title: Bodegas Muriel 2015 Finca de la Villa Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy aromas of ripe berry fruits blend well with spicy oak and vanilla notes. A lively palate with bright acidity puts out flavors of spiced plum, tomato, red currant and dried earth. This is a classic Rioja crianza that's honest, fresh and eminently drinkable over the next few years.

title: Bodegas Ondarre 2014 Rivallana Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry fruit aromas are more foresty and mulchy than bright and fresh. A tight, drawing palate is tannic and high in acidity. Like the nose, this tastes saucy, earthy and tomatoey, while a steady finish confirms that this is traditional Rioja reserva.

title: Cantina d'Isera 2012 Brut Riserva Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Aromas of dried field flowers, bread crust and white orchard fruit appear in this bright, linear sparkler, made entirely from Chardonnay. The vibrant palate offers Golden Delicious apple, lemon zest and toasted hazelnut alongside lively bubbles.

title: Cantine Russo 2011 Mon Pit Brut Rosé Metodo Classico Nerello Cappuccio (Vino Spumante)
description: Made with Nerello Mascalese planted on the slopes of Mount Etna, this has aromas and flavors of red berry, peach, violet, crushed stone, bread crust and fennel. It's bright and refined, with a creamy mousse and a tangy finish of salted almond.
designation: Mon Pit Brut Rosé Metodo Classico

title: Centovigne 2013 Il Centovigne Red (Vino da Tavola)
description: Black-skinned berry, dark culinary spice and new leather aromas lead the way. The firm, rather lean-bodied palate offers cherry, cranberry and star anise alongside close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.

title: Château Bellevue Claribes 2016 Prestige Merlot  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Juicy, rich and with layers of wood and tannins, this is a concentrated wine. The toasty wood-aging flavors are still prominent, giving the wine a bitter edge at this stage. That will blow off as the wine matures and black-currant flavors takes center stage. Drink this wine from 2020.

title: Château Clos Junet 2016  Saint-Émilion
description: Powerful and dense, this wine has an extracted character, with licorice and dark chocolate flavors. It is young and hopefully the bitterness will go, because the fruit and generous tannins are looking good. Wait until 2022.

title: Château de Chazoux 2016 Cuvée la Baronne  (Mâcon-Villages)
description: This full-bodied, honeyed wine is rich and generous. Apricot and peach flavors are cut by acidity that is warm and perfumed. The wine is fruity while also having toast and almond flavors at the end. Drink now.

title: Château du Vrai Caillou 2016 L'Optimé Cabernet Franc  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This is a rare wine: 100% Cabernet Franc doesn't normally happen in Bordeaux. Attractive and perfumed, it is still young, with ripe smoky fruit and layers of wood aging that will easily integrate as the wine ages. This ripe wine will be ready to drink from 2021.

title: Château Penin 2016 Grande Sélection  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Ripe, full and juicy, this is already a delicious wine. Firm tannins form a dry backdrop to the black-currant and berry fruits with their balanced acidity. Drink this wine from 2022.

title: Domaine Carrette 2017  Mâcon-Milly Lamartine
description: Crisply textured, this is a refreshing, citrus- and apple-flavored wine. A touch of spice as well as lively acidity gives the wine a refreshing quality. Drink the wine now.

title: Domaine le Clos de Caveau 2015 Carmin Brillant Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: A blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah, this is an intensely primary wine offering easy black cherry and berry flavors. It's juicy and mouthwatering with rounded acidity and a finish gripped by fine, persistent tannins. Enjoy now–2022.

title: Domaine les Ondines 2015 Passion Red (Vacqueyras)
