description: Lifted notes of violet and bramble accentuate this plump, pretty wine. Juicy black cherry and raspberry flavors are persistent and primary on the palate. It's an approachable but elegant wine with fine, deeply integrated tannins. Enjoy now through 2024.

title: Domaines Devillard 2016 Domaine de la Garenne  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This rich wine is concentrated and still young, but hints at good minerality. It shows a complex balance between acidity and ripe yellow fruits, with a taut, nervy texture that will soften. The wine has dense fruitiness and will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Felsina NV Brut Metodo Classico Sparkling (Vino Spumante)
description: Aromas of red berry, white stone fruit, vanilla and a yeasty whiff of pastry dough follow over to the vibrant palate along with toasted hazelnut and a hint of candied citrus. A lively, continuous perlage carries through to the dry finish.

title: Franchetto 2013 Brut Riserva  (Lessini Durello)
description: Crushed rock, ripe orchard fruit, citrus and bread crust aromas slowly form the nose. Creamy and vibrant, the linear palate evokes yellow apple, lemon zest and a flinty mineral note set against racy acidity. An elegant perlage softens the firm finish.

title: Gruet NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (America)
description: The color of Versilia Peach roses, this sparkler offers quiet aromas of strawberry, plum and saltine cracker. The palate is delicate, showing strawberry, apple, biscuits and lemon juice flavors on a soft, fine mousse. It finishes on a squeeze of lemon and baguette, with a hint of watermelon.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2016 Barrack Family Estate Blanc White (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Sémillon in California is an interesting play that's still finding its footing. This blend of 68% Sémillon and 32% Sauvignon Blanc plays to the lighter, rather than to the unctuous side of the grape, with zesty aromas of grass, pear flesh and gardenia on the nose. The palate offers tart green-apple, lime skin and honeysuckle flavors.

title: Il Palagione 2017 Hydra  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: Delicate scents suggesting white spring flower, citrus and white stone fruit lead the nose. The bright, enjoyable palate doles out white peach, honeydew melon, lemon zest and a tangy hint reminiscent of oyster shell.

title: Domaine Fourrey 2017 Côte de Lechet Premier Cru  (Chablis)
description: This cool wine is typical of one of the more structured of the premier cru vineyards, enhancing the mineral character and tight green-fruit acidity. The balance comes from a touch of spice and hazelnut flavors. Drink the wine from 2020.

title: Domaine La Grangette 2016 La Grangette des Garrigues  (Gigondas)
description: Fleshy black cherry and mulberry notes burst from nose and palate of this red blend made from 90% Grenache. Small proportions of Syrah and Mourvèdre lend base notes of crushed earth, bramble and thyme. It's a full-bodied, robust wine but edged with soft, ripe tannins. Approachable now but should improve through 2026.

title: Dubl NV Brut Rosé Metodo Classico Aglianico (Vino Spumante)
description: You'll find inviting scents of bread crust, orchard fruit and Mediterranean brush in this southern Italian sparkler. The creamy palate doles out white cherry, strawberry, candied citrus zest and nectarine alongside a foaming mousse and bright acidity.

title: Encanto 2017 Encanto Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This enticing wine is savory on the nose, displaying light herb, fig and mineral aromas. Rich melon and crushed rock flavors yield a creamy texture.

title: Entrepreneur 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Well-defined acidity holds on with tenacity in this stylistically rich, thick and full-bodied reserve-level wine from the elusive appellation. Big tannins provide a gritty, leathery texture marked by notes of coffee, toffee and dried herb, the fruit concentrated in black cherry.

title: Frank Family 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Fleshy in fig, guava and a hearty helping of vanilla oak, this wine is of moderate build and lushly likable. The finish offers a sophisticated seasoning of anise.

title: Giornata 2017 Bianco Il Campo White (Paso Robles)
description: When looking for an affordable table wine with great packaging and unique flavors, opt for this blend of primarily Pinot Grigio and Falanghina, with touches of Vermentino and Verdelho. Aromas of light honey and Meyer lemon pith lead into a palate that is rich at the core with almond cream but surrounded by tangy grapefruit rinds.

title: Gramona 2005 Celler Batlle Gran Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Chiseled aromas of mineral, oyster shell, tangerine peel and lemon-lime are a fine lead into a mouthfilling palate with modest textural complexity. Yeasty flavors of white stone fruits are mature and nutty, while this top-end Cava is smooth on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2016 Vial Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: White spring flower and mature orchard fruit aromas lead the way along with a whiff of hazelnut. On the smooth, full-bodied palate, fresh acidity brightens juicy yellow apple, juicy golden pear and a hint of peach. A flinty note lingers on the close.

title: Kumeu River 2016 Coddington Chardonnay (Kumeu)
description: Located significantly further north than most of New Zealand's vineyards, Kumeu River's maritime influence is what helps this area remain cool. This single vineyard wine is shining in appealing salty, nutty characters that blend with pineapple, mango rind and lemon. The palate is still somewhat in its shell, however, making the oak and acidity stand out more than normal. Give this time to unravel and the fruit and honeyed characters should start to emerge. Drink 2019–2025.

title: Llopart 2011 Leopardi Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty sourdough aromas are fresh and mature at the same time. A full palate with integrated acidity offers fine balance, while this brut nature mixes a white peach flavor with a mild astringent note prior to a finish that's dry, steady and airy. Drink through 2021.

title: Lucien Muzard et Fils 2015 La Maladière Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: Full and ripe, this is a rich wine. Its structure is well embedded in the generous red fruits while the wood aging shows in the touch of smokiness. This full wine has a good future. Drink from 2023.

title: Martinelli 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a robust, generous and meaty red wine. On the palate, smoke and toasted oak tones support warm baking spice, black cherry and an undeniable earthiness of cardamom and forest floor.

title: Maso Martis 2014 Brut Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: Aromas of toast, bread crust and a whiff of orchard fruit guide the nose. On the bright palate, vibrant acidity and an elegant mousse provide the backdrop for yellow apple, white peach and a hint of bitter almond.

title: Navarro 2017 Late Harvest Sweet Muscat Blanc (Anderson Valley)
description: Sweet, delicate and beautifully balanced, this wine has pure peach, apricot and honeydew melon flavors, a smooth texture and tangy acidity underneath. It should be great with a cheese course.

title: Peju 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Stainless-steel fermented, this is a floral and balanced wine that displays great tension and texture. Fleshy in flavors of peach, lime zest and wet stone, it delivers a rounded feel that lingers on the palate.

title: Prima Materia 2016 Estate Barbera
description: High-powered berry and cherry flavors light up this very focused and purely fruity wine. It is quite full-bodied but not very tannic, and minimal use of oak in the winemaking yields a vibrant, uncomplicated character.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Olivier Ravoire  (Gigondas)
description: This is an intensely ripe, sultry wine that heaves with sun-kissed cherry and blackberry flavors. While full bodied and full of horsepower, the midpalate offers fresh acidity and ripe, plush tannins that linger elegantly. Ready now but should improve through 2026.

title: Rock Wren 2013 Syrah (Solano County Green Valley)
description: A dark color and intense blackberry aroma gets this wine off to an impressive start. Rich flavors of blackberry and black cherry flood the palate, backed by firm tannins and steady acidity. It's a big wine, not particularly oaky, but well poised and packs a lot of flavor.

title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2015 Reserva Brut Rosé Trepat (Cava)
description: Yeasty aromas include notes of compost and damp leaves. On the palate, this is crisp but also tomatoey in feel. Flavors of cherry tomato, citrus and green herb settle on a tart, dry, limited finish. This is 100% Trepat.

title: Amisfield 2016 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)
description: Beneath a sulfur blanket there are aromas of ripe pear and guava. The palate is slightly creamy texture, but the acidity juts out above it, making the wine seem overworked and a little unbalanced.

title: Auclair 2015 Heart of the Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Baking spice, vanilla, licorice and dried cherry aromas are followed by dried-out-seeming fruit flavors. Dry tannins and cranberry flavors fill it out. It seems quite evolved for its age.

title: Balderdash 2014 49 Mulberry Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Overextracted aromas of tangy black plum and blackberry jam show on the nose of this bottling. Ripe flavors of black-plum juice prove too tangy and nearly vinegar-like.

title: Casas del Bosque 2016 Gran Reserva Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
description: Gamy plum and red berry aromas are true to Pinot Noir but nothing special. A sappy palate goes flat with airing, while this tastes of oak, berries and clove. A woody tasting finish with persistent clove notes remains fairly flat.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2016  Viré-Clessé
description: This soft, unfocused wine has toastiness and almond flavors but not much in the way of fruit. Drink the wine now.

title: Château La Rose du Pin 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Caramel and spice flavors give a curious edge to this wine. Dense tannins leave little sign of any fruit. It has too much structure.

title: Château Rauzan Despagne 2016  Bordeaux
description: Acidity shows strongly in this wine along with the dry tannins. It has weight, suggesting ripe fruits that need to develop. Drink this wine from 2021.

title: Domaine de la Jobeline 2016 En Prévisy  (Mâcon-Verze)
description: This soft wine is open, ripe and bright with apple flavors. Its softness is underlined by spice and toastiness in the background. Drink the wine now.

title: Domaine de la Terrasse 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: This is a dry wine, closed and very firm. Its tannins come from the ripe Merlot fruits that were extracted too much. It should soften to bring out the blackberry flavors, but it is likely to remain austere.

title: Domaine des Crets 2016 Climat En Bout  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)
description: Lightly toasty, this wine is both crisp and fruity It has acidity, touches of apples and a nutty minerality at the end. Drink now.

title: Domaines Devillard 2016 Domaine des Perdrix Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne)
description: A blend from a number of different parcels in Primeaux-Prissey just south of Nuits Saint-Georges, this wine is juicy and fruity. Crisp acidity gives a lift at the end. Drink now.

title: Gordon Estate 2014 Estate Grown Petit Verdot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of soil, violet, herb and cherry lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors that trail on the finish. It seems slightly evolved for its age.

title: Horse Valley 2015 Single Vineyard Nisovo Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Danube River Plains)
description: Garnet in the glass, this Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of black cherry, black pepper and cassis. In the mouth, there are flavors of black cherry, plum and black raspberry.

title: Kim Crawford 2016 Small Parcels Wild Grace Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)
description: This is an ultralush wine, harking back to Chardonnay from several decades ago. A buttered popcorn note overwhelms the nose, nearly overpowering the peach and pineapple tones. The palate is rich and opulent, with the oak and malolactic influence sitting heavily on the tongue. Those fans of Chardonnay from the '80s and '90s will find this wine a trip down memory lane.

title: Kim Crawford 2017 Rosé (New Zealand)
description: This is a fairly simple, fruit-forward wine that mixes a tomato leaf quality with ripe watermelons and red berries. There's weight and fruit concentration on the palate but there's a nice balance of acidity as well.

title: Krásná Hora 2016 Blanc de Noir Rosé (Moravia)
description: This rosé is made from Pinot Noir and has interesting yet pleasant aromas of sweet cherry and fermented apple cider. In the mouth, there are flavors of dark fruits including black cherry and black plum.

title: Landon 2016 Bingham Family Vineyards Viognier (Texas)
description: Pear and apricot aromas are joined by a soapy gardenia note. The palate is ripe and loaded with peach, guava, lemon and rose. Blood orange acidity moves to a finish of apple and blossoms.

title: LangeTwins 2017 Estate Grown Musqué Clone Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: This light-bodied wine is grassy in aroma, has lean veggie and lemon flavors and a fairly crisp mouthfeel.

title: Messina Hof 2017 Dry Style Pinot Blanc (Texas)
description: A floral and herbal nose delivers rose, white pepper and lime. The palate offers plenty of acidity but is gentle and soft in feel, with ripe lime and grapefruit flavors that are rounded out by a blossomy note. A dry, citrus finish shows astringent acidity and a white pepper tone.

title: Sean W. McBride 2016 Filigreen Farm The China Block Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Plush and full-flavored, this ripe and fruity wine tastes like black cherries and red-cherry jam, has a smooth, lightly tannic texture and soft acidity.

title: Stoneburn 2014 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: A slight aroma of cinnamon adds interest to a nose of red berries, green herbs and meat. The tannins are fine and gracefully thread together the earthy, savory, red fruit combo on the palate. This is tightly wound and could withstand a few years of cellaring, but at such an affordable price, it's likely to be knocked back sooner than that.

title: Tantara 2015 Mateo Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)
description: Very plump berries are cut by underlying aromas of stinging nettle and uncracked peppercorns on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Classic flavors of boysenberry with white pepper dust and dried herbs show on the palate, where acid cuts into a thicker mouthfeel.

title: Telescope 2014 Red (Thracian Valley)
description: This Bulgarian red blend is garnet colored, with aromas of smoked meats, red plums, saddle leather and cedar. In the mouth, there are flavors of black raspberry and red plums with a touch of brown baking spices in the finish.

title: Tosti 2011 Cuvée Giulio I Metodo Classico Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)
description: Made with 100% Pinot Nero, this has aromas of toast, bread crust and citrus. The linear palate reflects the nose, offering toasted hazelnut, white stone fruit and a hint of tangerine zest alongside a light perlage.

title: Victorine de Chastenay 2013 Brut Millésimé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
description: With some age in the bottle, this wine shows sophisticated maturity while still keeping plenty of fruitiness. Crisp but creamy, it offers a rich texture and is ready to drink.

title: Viña Chocalan 2014 Alexia Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The spicy, foresty aromas on this Bordeaux-style blend are easily identifiable as Chilean, as are the cool, herbal black fruit scents. A pushy palate with narrow tannins feels like it's collapsing, while this tastes peppery and spicy. A pinched, gravelly finish is a carry over from before.

title: Viña Mayor 2016 Tinto Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jammy plum and spice aromas show earthy grit upon deeper inspection. A full, fruity palate offers plenty of size and weight, while this tastes of blackberry, coffee and chocolate. Pulpy berry fruit flavors narrow down on the finish.

title: Wolff 2015 White Wolff White (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Vibrant aromas of lime blossom, lemon balm and a wet stone minerality show on the nose of this unique blend of 56% Marsanne, 29% Albarino and 15% Grenache Blanc. It's very grippy on the palate, with crushed gravel and lemon glaze flavors.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Dry Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)
description: This wine is a long-running success story for the winery. It carries aromas of citrus zest and freshly sliced apples on the nose. The palate shows good balance through crisp acidity and a medium body, tempered slightly by 4 g/L residual sugar.

title: Château Brulesécaille 2017 Blanc de Brûlesécaille Grand Réserve  (Côtes de Bourg)
description: Rich and creamy, this offers a touch of spice and plenty of baked-apple and creamed-pear flavors. The wine is tangy, zesty with pepper and crisp fruits. It should be ready from 2019.

title: Pacific Rim 2017 Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas are vibrant, with notes of tangerine peel, lime zest and jasmine. It drinks medium sweet, with plentiful stone fruit and citrus flavors, with zippy acidity on the finish. Yum.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2017 Esencia Godello (Bierzo)
description: This barrel-fermented Godello doesn't pull any punches with its oak: The nose is woody and dominated by oak grain. A tight, linear palate is agile and fresh, not heavy or resiny. Flavors of lime, green apple and raw wood fade out on a tangy, popping finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Art of the Cooper 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Strong and delicious oak flavors dominate this full-bodied and rich-tasting wine, keeping true to its name. Cedar, cinnamon and vanilla light up the aromas, while maple, brown sugar and clove flavors overlay jammy black-cherry notes. Moderate tannins are softened by a light sense of sweetness on the palate and finish.

title: Bonpas 2016 Grand Cardinal Red (Beaumes-de-Venise)
description: Hints of olive, coffee and cacao accent plump blackberry and mulberry flavors in this fruit-forward, full-bodied wine. It's approachable and soft but not jammy or confected. A touch of dried thyme and soft, fine tannins linger on the finish. Enjoy now–2023.

title: Borgo Paglianetto 2015 Rewine  (Verdicchio di Matelica)
description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this opens with aromas of yellow peach, chamomile and apricot. The structured palate offers citrus, marzipan and a touch of raw almond on the finish alongside fresh acidity.

title: Cà d'Or NV Noble Cuvée Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Ripe white stone fruit, acacia and toasted bread crust aromas come to the forefront. The bright palate offers ripe Golden Delicious apple, candied citrus zest and toasted hazelnut alongside a continuous perlage.

title: Casata Monfort 2012 Brut Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: Wildflower, acacia, white stone fruit and citrus aromas mingle with a whiff of bread crust. On the linear palate, an elegant mousse and fresh acidity support Golden Delicious apple, citrus zest and toasted walnut alongside a hint of honey.

title: Cecilia Beretta 2013 Terre di Cariano Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, mature dark-skinned fruit and cooking spice lift out of the glass. The ripe palate delivers raisin, licorice and dried sage alongside grippy tannins.

title: Château de Ferrand 2014 Le Différent de Château de Ferrand  (Saint-Émilion)
description: From vines situated just west of the small city of Saint-Émilion, this estate has produced a fruity wine. Its fruity character is typical of the vintage, berry flavors and acidity cushioning the tannins and wood accents. It's a juicy wine to drink now.
designation: Le Différent de Château de Ferrand

title: Paltrinieri 2017 Leclisse  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)
description: Made by the firm that helped put quality Lambrusco on the map, this delicious, stunning wine opens with enticing scents of wild berry, rose petal and citrus. The aromas carry over to the elegant, foaming palate along with juicy strawberry, creamy nectarine, grapefruit and a sprinkling of white pepper. A silky mousse gives it an irresistible texture, while fresh acidity keeps it balanced.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Sourced from a mountainous site, this wine is brimming in mineral aspects of volcanic ash and crushed rock. Tangy and expansive on the palate, it offers persistent tones of flowers, ginger and lavender that accent rich baked plum. Enjoy 2021–2031.

title: Château de Montmirail 2016 Cuvée de Beauchamp  (Gigondas)
description: Hints of crushed stone, savory dried thyme and lavender accent lush blackberry and cherry flavors in this wine. A blend of Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah, it's lavishly textured but anchored by restraint and earthiness. It drinks beautifully already but should improve through 2028.

title: Black Kite 2016 Kite's Rest Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Good balance and a plethora of juicy, ripe fruit flavors highlight this full-bodied wine. It has generous black cherry and light baking-spice aromas, plenty of cherry and sour cherry in the flavors and a moderately tannic texture livened by good acidity.

title: Boekenoogen 2016 3 Clone Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Elegant aromas of black raspberry, wild mint, tarragon and mossy earth show on the nose of this clonal blend. Earthy thyme and cherry-tomato flavors play against the cranberry and raspberry fruit of the palate, with bright acidity driving deep into the finish.

title: Château de Saint-Aubin 2015 La Pièce sous le Bois Premier Cru  (Meursault)
description: Under winemaker Nadine Gublin's hand and new ownership, this four-acre former Charles Blondeau-Danne Père property delivers from the start offering both great richness and a tight texture. It is concentrated with mineral texture giving a balanced, rich wine that also has freshness. It sings of attractive fruits and structure as well as immediate drinkability.
designation: La Pièce sous le Bois Premier Cru

title: Daou 2015 Micho Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dark yet pure aromas of blueberry, black pepper, olive and savory roasted beef show on the nose of this blend of 57% Merlot and 43% Cabernet Sauvignon. It's thick and lavish on the palate, with sticky tannins and dark berry and charred meat flavors that make the mouth stand at attention. Drink 2020–2035.

title: Domaine Antonin Guyon 2015 Clos des Chênes Premier Cru  (Volnay)
description: This wine has both power and the richness of the vintage. It has the potential to be opulent, full and delicious. Give this ripe wine with dense red fruits time. Drink from 2024

title: Domaine Brusset 2016 Les Hauts de Montmirail  (Gigondas)
description: Crisp black plum and blackberry aromas are tinged with violet, spice and crushed mineral on the nose of this vibrant, perfumed wine. It's supple and plump, offering plumes of rich blackberry and plum flavors, but there's a firm mineral backbone as well, along with fine, upright tannins. Lovely already but will improve through 2030.

title: Domaine des Bosquets 2016 Le Plateau  (Gigondas)
description: Hints of sweet licorice and spice mark this intensely ripe but stately wine made from predominantly Mourvèdre. Compared with the producer's other Gigondas bottlings, La Plateau has a depth of minerality and distinct freshness of acidity. A potent yet graceful wine edged by fine, persistent tannins. Enjoy now–2030.

title: Easton 2015 Rinaldi Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: Hardly a run-of-the-mill wine, this potent liquid exudes tobacco and flint aromas that join with wood smoke, cocoa and blackberry flavors to make it dramatic and spicy. Full body and firm tannins build great structure to pair with indulgent proteins and give it the stuffing to age. Best from 2022.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Rochioli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: The beautiful Rochioli site is divinely represented here, offering a lush, plush wine with an effusive nose of spicy oak. On the palate, the acidity is firm and focused, adding to a complex layering of texture and well-defined flavors of green apple, grapefruit and lime.

title: Kumeu River 2016 Hunting Hill Chardonnay (Kumeu)
description: This single-vineyard wine hums on the nose but sings on the palate. Aromas of roasted, salted nuts, delicate orange and lemon peel seem to float in midair. On the palate, the toasty oak may be in plain view, but it's beautifully balanced by river stone minerality, crystalline acidity and a satiny mouthfeel that never seems to end. Drink now–2025.

title: Maso Martis 2014 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: Elegant and silky, this lovely sparkler opens with aromas of wildflower, crushed herb, orchard fruit and a yeasty hint of bread dough. Made with 70% Pinot Nero and 30% Chardonnay, the vibrant, creamy palate shows red cherry, Gala apple, white peach and tangerine zest alongside bright acidity and an ultrafine perlage. A mineral note lingers on the dry, juicy finish.

title: Pierre Amadieu 2016 Romane Machotte  (Gigondas)
description: There's a deeply satisfying interplay of texture in this robust yet elegant wine. Its black plum and berry flavors are concentrated and plump but anchored by brisk acidity and firm, fine-grained tannins. It's rolling and rich yet full of tension and vibe. Drinks well already but could gain complexity through 2026 and hold a few years further.

title: Rockpile 2016 Black Sheep Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: A 100% varietal wine made in magnums only, this is the owner and winemaker's amusing ode to his own position within his large family, choosing winemaking over grape growing, the choice of all his brothers. It is brightly layered and brooding in berry and spice, with lovely soft grooves of cinnamon, nutmeg and black pepper. The tannins are polished and supportive.

title: Small Vines 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine opens with a gorgeous, memorable nose of biscotti and hazelnut before unleashing a palate of defined tension and acidity. Light and bright, it has focus and an endearing freshness amidst a powerful embrace of tannin that amplifies its structure.

title: Small Vines 2016 TBH Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Robustly layered in crisp apple, lime and wet stone, this wine offers an intensity on the midpalate of grit and grip before easing into a thirst-quenching fistful of acidity. Complex and structured, it shows potential for aging; enjoy best from 2021–2031.

title: Spottswoode 2015 Lyndenhurst Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This remains one of the most impressive wines at its price point—a varietal wine blended with small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, from both the producer's estate and other pedigreed sites. Tense acidity buoys a brawny tannic profile that settles into lushness texture, highlighted in black fruit, butter, gunpowder and plum.

title: Domaine La Bouïssière 2016  Gigondas
description: Whispers of dried thyme, rosemary and wild mint extend from nose to finish in this supple, silken blend of Grenache and Syrah. It's a penetrating wine full of succulent black cherry flavor but keenly balanced, too. The finish is marked by rambling minerality and very fine, soft tannins. Pleasurable already but will improve through 2030.

title: Cantina di Carpi NV Brut Piazza Grande  (Lambrusco di Modena)
description: Rose petal, wild strawberry and cherry aromas carry over to the bright palate along with a hint of white pepper. It's elegant and easy drinking, with a light mousse and fresh acidity.

title: Al-Cantàra 2015 Lu Veru Piaciri  (Etna)
description: Aromas of toast, red berry and Mediterranean herb lead the nose. The bright, easygoing palate offers red cherry, wild strawberry and star anise alongside polished tannins and bright acidity.

title: Al-Cantàra 2017 Amuri di Fimmina e Amuri di Matri Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Made entirely with Nerello Mascalese, this bright rosato has aromas of red berry, Spanish broom and a whiff of wet stone. The straightforward, tangy palate offers white cherry, peach and citrus alongside a saline note.
designation: Amuri di Fimmina e Amuri di Matri

title: Andis 2016 d' Amador Barbera (Amador County)
description: This crisp, lip-smacking red wine has lots of cherry and cranberry flavors, light to medium body and good balance. It's an appetizing mealtime wine that doesn't steal the show.

title: Antichi Vinai 1877 2013 Pietralava  (Etna)
description: Smooth and easygoing, this juicy blend of Nerello Mascalese and Nerello Cappuccio doles out crushed raspberry and ripe black cherry flavors accented with notes of dark baking spice. Polished tannins provide lithe support. Drink through 2021.

title: Artesa 2016 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This is a full-bodied white made in a bigger style, its flavors leaning into caramel apple, vanilla and sweet oak. It benefits from accents of gingersnap and nutmeg.

title: Balderdash 2016 Truth Serum Albariño (Edna Valley)
description: Wet river stones, key lime and exotic apple aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's very dry on the palate, offering broad flavors of yellow pear, lemon zest and grapefruit rind.

title: Bee Hunter 2016 Docker Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (Mendocino)
description: This wine was released a year later than most. It has a light copper color, mild raspberry aromas and lively peach and raspberry flavors. Medium body and a bit of nice viscosity gives it a substantial mouthfeel that helps it stand out.

title: Betz Family 2016 Domaine de Pierres Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This is the inaugural offering of this wine, with the fruit coming from the winery's Ancient Stone Vineyard in the Rocks District. Aromas of fresh and grilled asparagus are at the fore, followed by mortared herb, black pepper, ash, flower and olive. In keeping with the vintage, the flavors are lighter styled, showing a soft texture, trailing toward the finish.

title: Borgo Maragliano NV Brut Chardonnay (Vino Spumante)
description: Made with the Charmat method, this has aromas of dried tropical fruit, citrus and a leesy whiff of bread dough that carry over to the fresh palate along with mature yellow apple and lemon drop. A silky mousse softens the hazelnut finish.

title: Buttonwood 2017 Musque Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)
description: Grassy aromas met with cut limes on the easy nose of this bottling from the historic winery on Alamo Pintado Road. Granny Smith apple flavors consumer the sip, which is smooth and refreshing.

title: Cantina di Sorbara 2017 Omaggio a Gino Friedmann  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)
description: This foaming red opens with heady aromas of fragrant purple flower, rose and wild berry. On the tangy palate, bright acidity boosts juicy red cherry, wild strawberry and a yeasty hint of bread dough before the crisp finish.

title: Cesarini Sforza NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Trento)
description: Fruity aromas of red berry and peach mix with a yeasty whiff of bread dough. On the palate, fresh acidity and vivacious bubbles brighten juicy cherry, Rennet apple and a hint of bitter almond.

title: Château Clos Moulin Pontet 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Fresh wood flavors of mint mark this wine. To balance, it also offers black fruits and acidity that give freshness and a rich aftertaste. Drink from 2022.

title: Château de Costis 2016  Bordeaux
description: Fine, dusty tannins give this wine a warm feel. Its rich structure is matched by the ripe blackberry fruits and given a lift by acidity. Drink from 2021.

title: Château de Juge 2016  Bordeaux
description: The good quality of this vintage is very present in this ripe, juicy wine. Smooth, rich tannins are contained in warm, succulent Merlot fruitiness and acidity. This already enjoyable wine will be even better from 2019.

title: Château de Terrefort-Quancard 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This rich wine has hints of toasty wood coming through attractive black-currant flavors. Ripeness and fruit density cope with the tannins, turning this into a powerful, solid wine. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Fonfroide 2016  Bordeaux
description: From vines situated in the heart of the Entre-Deux-Mers region, this wine is structured and firmly tannic. The tannins just avoid bitterness through the potential of the ripe black-currant fruits and acidity. It's a wine to age; drink from 2020.

title: Château Haut-Bicou 2015  Bordeaux
description: Made from organically grown grapes, this wine is soft and generous, filled with ripe black fruits and juicy acidity. It offers berry flavors and a warm, rich structure, with tannins lifted by the backdrop of fresher fruit. The wine will develop quickly. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Haut Grand Champ 2016  Bordeaux
description: Ripe fruit vies with firm tannins to produce a wine that is structured and also rich. As the two elements develop, this will become a full and powerful wine. Drink from 2021.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 J.D. Hurley Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The aromas of cedar and cigar box consume the dark fruit on the nose of this bottling. Similar wood-spice and pine-oil flavors are wrapped around the palate, with flashes of black plum and tobacco trying to emerge.

title: Black Box 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)
description: Neutral aromas are largely clean and barely suggest white peach. This boxed SB is plump and citrusy on the palate, with citric flavors that turn a bit green and grassy on the back side.

title: Blue Victorian Winery 2016 Barbera (Suisun Valley)
description: A heavy oak influence gives this full-bodied wine smoky, charred aromas and flavors that dampen the fruity components that may have been in the grapes. It's bold and spicy.

title: Borgo Maragliano 2013 Brut Nature Giuseppe Galliano Sparkling (Vino Spumante)
description: Aromas of toasted bread crust carry over to the lean, racy palate along with bitter walnut and mature yellow apple skin. It's vibrant and dry, with firm acidity and vigorous bubbles, but it lacks fruit.

title: Casa Silva 2018 1912 Vines Sauvignon Gris (Colchagua Valley)
description: Melony aromas are bright and clean, but simple. A fresh, firm palate is blazing with acidity, while this old-vines Sauvignon Gris tastes of grapefruit at first, then more like grass. A pyrazinic finish flattens out quickly, indicating that this is basic more than elevated.

title: Château Carignan 2017 L'Orangerie de Carignan Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This wine comes from a 160-acre vineyard just east of Bordeaux city. Half-and-half Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, it has a mineral edge as well as tightfruits. The herbal flavors, bright acidity and crisp aftertaste are attractive now.

title: Château Grand Abord 2017  Graves
description: Dominated by 65% Sémillon, this wine is ripe, with a creamy texture and rounded fruits. It's all about green plums with touches of apricot, spice and balanced acidity. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Grand Métairie 2017  Entre-Deux-Mers
description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Muscadelle, this easily combines herbal flavors with an attractive riper, perfumed character. The wine is crisp, full of acidity and ready to drink.

title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2016 Bordeaux de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Bordeaux)
description: This fresh, fruity wine has good acidity and soft tannins. The attractive juicy character partners with a backbone of tannins. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Moulin de Vignolle 2016  Bordeaux
description: An attractive smoky aroma is followed by ripe tannins and juicy black-currant fruit. The wine is fresh and fruity, with gentle tannins that will soften soon. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Tour de Bonnet 2016  Bordeaux
description: This juicy, fruity wine from the André Lurton group offers attractive red fruits and plenty of acidity. It has a poised, light feel, crisp and lightly textured at the end. Drink from 2020.

title: Collier Creek 2016 Old Press Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Soft-textured and definitely fruity, this easy-going non-oaky wine is charming for its fresh raspberry aromas and red-fruit flavors. The texture is smooth and non-tannic.

title: Concha y Toro 2016 Marques de Casa Concha Merlot (Maule Valley)
description: Generic black fruit aromas are earthy and oaky. A crisp, smacking palate is short on body and stuffing, while this tastes tart and snappy, with tomato and herbal red plum flavors. A short, scouring finish is indicative of moderately ripe Merlot.

title: Coto de Hayas 2017 Garnacha Rosado (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of rose petals and punchy but generic citrus fruits lead to a chunky palate with good acidity. Flavors of citrus skin and lime show a slight herbal green side, while this is plump but balanced on the finish.

title: Destello NV Burt Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Sourdough and white fruit aromas are comported. Moderate acidity means the palate on this brut reserva is good but not clearly defined. Apple and lime flavors are slightly green in front of a finish that barely registers.

title: Domaine Vessigaud 2016 Haut de Fuissé  (Mâcon-Fuissé)
description: Bright, lightly textured and with good acidity, this wine offers citrus and green-plum flavors. A good touch of minerality gives the wine extra shape. Drink now.

title: Formation 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Quite light in the glass, this twist-top bottling shows hints of hibiscus, cranberry and damp herbs on the nose. The palate offers tart flavors of tomato and orange rind, lifted by fresh herbs.

title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2017 Kimmeridgien Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: Kimmeridge chalk, named after a village in Dorset in southern England, is the principal soil type in Chablis. This wine, although a Burgundy appellation, celebrates the soil with its mineral edge among all the ripe yellow fruits and acidity. Drink the wine now.

title: Prat Sura 2015 La Cuvée Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: A blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah, this luscious red bursts with ripe cherry and pomegranate flavors. Sourced from vines that average 40 years in age, it's concentrated and nuanced with hints of violet and wild mint. The finish is supple and edged by ripe, polished tannins. Enjoy now–2025.

title: Pride Mountain 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Generous in strong fruit flavors of cherry liqueur and blueberry jam, this is a full-bodied expression of the grape blended with small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. The tannins are powerful and opulent.

title: RhonéA 2015 Création Grenache-Syrah (Beaumes-de-Venise)
description: A blend of Grenache and Syrah sourced from a variety of this appellation's diverse soil types, this is a spicy, perfumed wine boasting unctuous black cherry flavor. It's silky in texture yet briskly balanced, finishing on fine, ripe tannins. An easy-drinking sip to enjoy now–2025.

title: Rijckaert 2017 En Crêches  (Saint-Véran)
description: Luscious and rich, this wine has a mineral edge that will allow it to age. Tropical fruits combine with fresh citrus to add fruitiness to the structure. Drink from 2019.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Old Kraft Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)
description: With a charred, meaty nose, this wine has a strong tannic profile and thickness of fruit, layering from blueberry to plum. It remains concentrated and thick on the palate through highlights of black pepper, cinnamon and clove.

title: Rockpile 2016 Jack's Cabin Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: Juicy black fruit and big oak give this 100% varietal wine a notable opulence around deep layers of mocha, dark chocolate and nutmeg. It is full bodied but not overbearing, showing balanced lushness.

title: Sangiacomo 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is sourced from three of the family's best coastal sites: Roberts Road, Fedrick and Amaral Vineyards. Earthy, spicy and floral in rose and lavender, it has an enduring and endearing softness on the palate and crisp focused flavors of blueberry, nutmeg and vanilla.

title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This has a yeasty nose and intense opening acidity that mellows in the glass. Earthy and complex, it's unabashedly lush and full bodied, with spicy highlights of rhubarb, pomegranate and orange peel.

title: Spy Valley 2015 Southern Valleys Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Heady aromas of ripe blue and purple fruit, florals and spice flow into a palate that offers sikly, fine-grained tannins. The oak turns a little bitter on the finish. There's power to this Pinot, but elegance too. Drink now–2023.

title: Stewart 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine that celebrates its strength and softness in equal measure, this wine delights in crayon wax, dried herb and red currant, the initial elements complemented in black plum, clove and cedar. Savory and tannic, it shows a balanced approach to its full-bodied ripeness on the lasting finish.

title: Stolpman 2017 Roussanne (Ballard Canyon)
description: A dark shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of orange cream, salted lemons, concentrated melon and a light brush of oak. There is good grip and a decent sizzle to the sip before it settles into fleshy fruit, offering dried peach, sea salt, mango and savory roast chicken flavors.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Santo Spirito  (Etna)
description: Aromas of dark spice, menthol, wild berry and French oak slowly appear in the glass. The taut, linear palate evokes cranberry, raw strawberry, star anise and blood orange set against vibrant acidity and tight, fine-grained tannins that need a few more years to unwind. Drink 2021–2026.

title: Tenuta Sant'Antonio 2013 Selezione Campo dei Gigli  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, mocha and dark fruit lift out of the glass. The dense palate offers black currant jam, roasted coffee bean and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2015 The Hermit Reserve Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a blend of 50% Merlot and 50% Cabernet Franc sourced from throughout the county. Sanguine, it offers a juicy midpalate marked by cranberry, red currant and graphite, the acidity tight and firmly focused, allowing for a lasting freshness on the finish.

title: Via Romano 2016 Vermentino (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a richly textured and well-concentrated wine that brings a lot of substance to each sip. It combines savory herb and mineral flavors with mild fruity notes and a hint of fennel, all carried by a smooth and broad texture.

title: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Verdot  (Bordeaux)
description: In this wine, mint aromas from wood aging come through strongly while the fruit is elegant and structured. Together they make a stylish wine, rich while balanced, and full of fruit as well as structure. Drink from 2021.

title: Villa di Corlo 2017 Corleto  (Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro)
description: This deeply colored, frothy wine opens with aromas of iris, blackberry jam and baking spice. It's crisp, savory and dry, doling out prune, dried black cherry, star anise and white pepper set against bright acidity and dusty tannins.

title: Wait Cellars 2016 Los Amigos Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Russian River Valley)
description: Sizable, dry tannins wrap around a core of leather and dried herb before a juicy midpalate unleashes flavors of blue fruit and plum. This wine is light on its feet and lingers on tones of cloves and herbs.

title: Yves Giroux 2016 Vers Chânes  (Mâcon-Fuissé)
description: This is a full-bodied wine, packed with ripe fruits with a strong mineral edge. It has an intense tang from sweet orange zest that gives both texture and ripeness to the wine. Drink now.

title: Zenato 2014 Brut Metodo Classico  (Lugana)
description: White stone fruit, bread crust and almond aromas carry over to the sparkling palate along with white peach and candied citrus. Bright acidity and lively, refined bubbles lift the bitter almond finish.

title: Rewe 2013 Gran Reserve Carmenère (Lontué Valley)
description: Flabby berry aromas include an earthy note of compost. This Carmenère is dense and monoline, with sucking tannins. Stewed plum and berry flavors finish without much more than rubbery residual tannins. Drink now or never.

title: Rigid Elm 2016 Barrel Reserve Red (Danube River Plains)
description: This red blend consists of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. There are aromas of black cherry, coffee and espresso and flavors of black plum and blackberry in the mouth. The finish is juicy and fruit filled.

title: Schuchmann Wines 2016 Pirosmani Saperavi (Kakheti)
description: Aromas of black cherry and nectarine pave the way for flavors of cherry, white peach and toffee with a touch of salinity. Tannins are a tiny bit gritty, a sensation that is washed away by the bright cherry finish.

title: Shannon 2015 Two Bud Block Reserve Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: Heavy oak spices dominate this full-bodied wine giving it plenty of vanilla, cinnamon, wood smoke and black pepper in the aromas and flavors. Beneath the oakiness and firm tannins, the berry flavor that the varietal is known for is rather hidden.

title: Sylvaine et Alain Normand 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Mâcon La Roche Vineuse)
description: This wine is concentrated and rich, packed with tropical fruits cut with acidity. This ripe and full wine is ready to drink.

title: Te Pa 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Marlborough)
description: This ballerina pink-hued rosé is fermented and aged in oak. The oak influence is subtle, showing not in flavor but in texture, giving the wine a soft, creamy feel that's nicely balanced by crunchy acidity. Bright strawberry, guava and floral notes offer something that's not overly complicated but completely enjoyable.

title: Valdivieso 2015 Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Damp plum and berry aromas are herbal and a touch murky. A plump, slightly stewy palate delivers herbal berry and mint flavors along with leafy green notes. This is Chilean Cabernet in all forms, take it or leave it.

title: Vara NV Silverhead Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Bready apple aromas suggest good quality. In the mouth, this is a foamy Cava with bold acidity. Lemon and orange flavors are fine but basic, while this reverts to dry and bready on the finish.

title: Victorine de Chastenay NV Rosé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
description: Ripe red fruits dominate this creamy, bubbly wine. Its acidity is balanced by the smooth, soft texture with red-currant flavors and an zesty edge. Drink this festive wine now.

title: Viña Maipo 2013 Gran Devoción Carmenère-Syrah (Maule Valley)
description: Herbal aromas of blackberry, mint, cocoa and oak spice lead to a palate with astringency and wiry acidity. Olive, oak spice and briny red plum flavors are a touch raw, as is the finish on this blend of Carmenère and Syrah.

title: Winery by the Creek 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Franc (Fair Play)
description: Powerful in structure and quite ripe and monolithic in flavor, this full-bodied wine tastes like black cherries and light oak spices and has a firm texture backed by moderate tannins.

title: Yves Giroux 2016 Les Raidillons  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Light and fruity, this wine has layers of attractive acidity along with a mineral texture that keeps it on its toes. The wine's freshness makes it attractive and ready to drink.

title: Celene NV Cuvée Royale Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)
description: A pale-colored blend of Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this is soft and just off dry. It has plenty of ripe raspberry flavors and a crisp, yeasty aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Victorine de Chastenay NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
description: Bright and fruity, this crisp blend of Chardonnay and Gamay is soft and packed with apple flavors and acidity that are lifted by an orange-zest aftertaste. Drink this wine now.

title: Bailly-Lapierre 2017 Sauvignon Blanc  (Saint-Bris)
description: This small enclave of Sauvignon Blanc in the north of Burgundy has much, tastewise, to do with Sancerre. This wine offers crisp acidity and white-currant flavors cut with lemon juice and filled out with hints of white fruits. Drink the wine now.

title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
description: This light-pink-colored blend of Pinot Noir with a touch of Gamay is soft and fruity. Red-berry flavors shows against a background of perfumed acidity with a soft, ripe aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Barberani 2016 Castagnolo  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)
description: Scents of wildflower and orchard fruit lift delicately out of the glass. On the palate, bright acidity accompanies yellow pear and citrus zest.

title: Cà d'Or NV Brut Nobl Rosé  (Franciacorta)
description: Red berry, orchard fruit and bread crust aromas lead the nose. On the lively palate, steely, continuous bubbles and bright acidity provide the backdrop for sour cherry, strawberry and a hint of toasted hazelnut.

title: Cantine Russo 2014 Mon Pit Balnc de Blancs Metodo Classico Sparkling (Vino Spumante)
description: A blend of Carricante and Catarratto cultivated on Mount Etna, this has aromas of Spanish broom, orchard fruit, acacia honey and crusty bread. The aromas follow over to the lively palate along with toasted almond and yellow apple. It's edgy, with vibrant acidity and vivacious beading.
designation: Mon Pit Balnc de Blancs Metodo Classico

title: Carminucci 2017 Belato  (Offida Pecorino)
description: Aromas of jasmine and white peach emerge from the glass. The easygoing palate offers Golden Delicious apple and pink grapefruit, while a ginger note marks the finish.

title: Miro 2016 Reserve Mounts Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an earthy brawny red wine with bold ripe characteristics of leather, espresso and black cherry. It broods intensity and big flavor.

title: Palagetto 2014 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: Aromas of French oak, vanilla and a whiff of paraffin lead the way. The aromas carry over to the rather lean palate along with butterscotch, vanilla, bitter almond and a note of candied tangerine zest but not much fruit richness. Drink soon.

title: Palliser Estate 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)
description: This is a vegetal style from the bottom of New Zealand's South Island. Snow pea and bell pepper notes lead the way, with passionfruit in the background. The palate is creamy in feel, but it's balanced by lifted acidity and more fruit-driven flavors.

title: Paltrinieri 2017  Lambrusco di Sorbara
description: White rose and strawberry aromas carry over to the dry, softly sparkling palate along with hints of culinary spice and blood orange. Tangy acidity lifts the juicy finish.

title: Producta Vignobles 2016 Château Timbau  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Bold tannins are the dominant character of this wine. Its weight comes as much from its structure as from the fruit that is still suppressed and needs time. Drink from 2022.

title: Rod McDonald Wines 2017 Mister Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)
description: In the warmer climes of Hawke's Bay on the North Island, much of New Zealand's (a k a Marlborough's) classic green vegetal notes are gone. The wines exhibits more tropical fruit characters, displaying ripe mango, peach, and lychee notes that are balanced by lifted acidity.

title: Stedt 2016 OR Sparkling Rosé (America)
description: Produced from Gamay Noir grown on both sides of the Columbia River, this bursts with scents of apple blossoms and cherries. The deep color and slight bitter-skin flavor suggest that it spent some time macerating prior to fermentation. What it lacks in finesse it makes up for with fruit power.

title: Te Pa 2017 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)
description: This is reductive at first, masked by onion and plastic aromas. It does blow off with some with time in glass to reveal peach, pear and floral notes. The palate is less weighty than the nose suggests although there's some viscosity to the texture that's nicely balanced by tingly, citrusy acidity.

title: Terra d'Oro 2016 Barbera (Amador County)
description: This is a good wine that balances ripe berry flavors with lively acidity and medium body. It tastes like sour cherries and raspberries and has a lightly tart mouthfeel.

title: Univitis 2016 Château le Clairiot  (Bordeaux)
description: A structured wine, still on the young side, this has the potential of rich black fruits and ripe tannins. Made with nearly 60% Merlot, this jammy, generous wine will be ready from 2019.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2017 Clos de Mont-Rachet  (Mâcon-Villages)
description: This round, smooth wine shows a good balance between acidity and ripe apple fruits. It is an easy wine, fruity, touched by caramel and ready to drink now.

title: Vignobles Bulliat NV Brut Nature  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
description: It may have no added dosage, but this wine is so ripe with warm fruits it doesn't need it. The texture is soft and open, full of white fruits and attractive acidity. Drink this wine now.

title: Warr-King 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Aromas of raspberry and cherry compote along with baking spice lead to somewhat lighter styled red and black fruit flavors, with the concentration not always seeming to be there. The tannins are a bit wound up at present.

title: Warr-King 2015 Grand Rouge Red (Red Mountain)
description: Light aromas of herb, cherry and raspberry are followed by full-bodied, dark fruit flavors backed by lightly chalky-feeling tannins and a warm finish. The fruit seems a bit desiccated.

title: Caduceus 2014 Merkin Vineyards Tarzan Red Tempranillo (Cochise County)
description: This offers aromas of brown sugar and gingersnap tinged with blackberry. The palate echoes the nose, showing more brown sugar and wild blackberry notes joined by vanilla and sweet baking spice. The tannins are soft and velvety, with plenty of acidity for balance. Drink now–2025.

title: Château Picon 2016 Cuvée Louis  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Wood aging shows strongly here with toasty flavors and spice. At the same time, the wine also has hints of its fruity potential. Put the two together and the wine will be ready from 2023.

title: Cantina di Sorbara 2017 Emma Frizzante Amabile  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)
description: Aromas of wild rose and red berry follow over to the bright, light-bodied palate along with raspberry compote and crushed strawberry. A note of candied tangerine zest and vanilla close the finish. It's fun and refreshing.

title: Argillae 2016  Orvieto
description: Spring blossom and orchard fruit aromas lead the nose. On the bright, linear palate, vibrant acidity offsets notes of white peach, pineapple and citrus.

title: Black Cottage 2017 Rosé (New Zealand)
description: This delicate, light-toned rosé offers up red berry and watermelon characters. It's dry, crisp and refreshing—everything you'd want on a hot summer's day.

title: Casa Silva 2016 Los Lingues Vineyard Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: One of Chile's most classic Carmenères is about as ripe as you're going to find from 2016, a year with severe weather issues at harvest. This is reasonably structured, with spicy, peppery plum and red berry flavors matched by fully toasted oak. Raw intensity on the finish is more demanding than usual.

title: San Pedro 2017 1865 Selected Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Plum and berry aromas are solid but nothing beyond ordinary for Cabernet. A tannic, pulling palate is drying, while this tastes woody more than fruity. Overall, this is fine but highly generic and overoaked for what it is.

title: Scacciadiavoli NV Brut Metodo Classico Sparkling (Vino Spumante)
description: Aromas of yellow apple, toasted nut and a yeasty whiff of bread crust come together on this. The aromas carry over to the lean palate along with a dollop of vanilla and a hint of bitter walnut. Bright acidity and vigorous, steely bubbles provide the vivacious backdrop.

title: Union de Producteurs de Saint-Émilion 2015 Château Hautes Versannes  (Saint-Émilion)
description: Produced in a vineyard at the base of the hill of Saint-Émilion, this accessible wine is soft, ripe and fruity. It has a generous texture from the vintage and bold black fruits spiced with wood aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Vignobles André Lurton 2017 Chateau Goumin  (Entre-Deux-Mers)
description: This perfumed wine is full of fruit and with an attractive aromatic character from the Muscadelle in the blend. The dominant Sauvignon Blanc gives herbal crispness to the bright aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Vins El Cep 2016 Kila Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty, bready aromas include a not-shy note of scrambled eggs. A pulpy palate is balanced but doesn't stir much interest. Stone fruit and mild citrus flavors are highly basic.

title: Borgo La Caccia NV Kames Brut Sparkling (Vino Spumante)
description: This has subdued aromas of chamomile flower, yellow apple and a whiff of toasted bread. On the palate, bright acidity lifts toast, mature yellow apple, bitter walnut and a candied citrus note alongside vivacious bubbles.

title: Bravante 2013 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)
description: Dusty with highlights of cedar and sage, this full-bodied wine presents as somewhat dull on the palate—a soft, rounded and approachable expression of jammy blueberry.

title: Casa Donoso 2013 D Limited Edition Red (Maule Valley)
description: Cedary aromas of dried berry and plum are leafy, earthy and raw. In the mouth, this is dominated by shearing acidity that creates scratchiness. Citrus and sour cherry flavors land on an acid-dominated finish. Freshness is good, but this Bordeaux blend goes a little too far in that direction.

title: Château la Favière 2015  Bordeaux
description: Eighteen months in wood was perhaps too much for this wine. It is now dominated by toasty wood flavors and dense tannins. Spice, pepper and a bitter edge come before the fruitiness. It will soften, but it seems that woodiness will always be there.

title: Château Léognan 2017 Renaissance Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This is the white wine in a trio of bottlings produced by the Miecaze family of Château Léognan. It is poised, fruity and crisply fresh. Citrus acidity and touches of apricot and green plum are balanced by a round, textured aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Clifford Bay 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: From the relatively cooler maritime climes of the Awatere Valley in Marlborough, this Sauvignon leads with green vegetal notes of snow pea and green bell pepper, backed up by lemon-lime and grapefruit. The palate slippery with some fruit sweetness and rather searing acid. Stylistically it feels a little forced.

title: Domaine du Roc des Boutires 2016 En Bertilionne  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This wine is almost too soft, with superripe grapes that are missing out on acidity. It does have plenty of richness, with full apricot and pineapple flavors. Drink the wine now.

title: Domaine Massin 2014  Chablis
description: This wine proves that even simple Chablis can age well. The intense crispness has diminished to give a wine that has almonds, touches of spice and an edge of honey. Drink now.

title: Espiritu de Chile 2016 Premium Collection Assemblage Red (Curicó Valley)
description: Berry and cassis aromas are mildly damp and rubbery, while in the mouth this is chunky, with abrasive tannins. Plum and berry flavors are short and basic, while this is a bit unruly on an edgy finish. This is Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot.

title: Esser 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Yellow apple and sweet oak aromas make for a pleasant if not particularly complex aromatic entry to this bottling. Ripe apple and pear meet with sweet buttercream on the palate.

title: Gianni Tessari NV Brut Metodo Classico  (Lessini Durello)
description: This has aromas evoking medicinal herb and adhesive bandage that follow over to the palate along with citrus zest, powdered sage and bitter walnut. Vigorous bubbles and racy acidity provide the lively backdrop.

title: Horse Valley 2015 Single Vineyard Nisovo Vineyards Merlot (Danube River Plains)
description: This single-vineyard Bulgarian Merlot has aromas of cotton candy, ripe cherry and fruits of the woods. In the mouth, there are flavors of ripe cherry, black berry and cassis.

title: Hunter's 2014 Jane Hunter Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: From one of New Zealand's celebrated vintages, this Pinot should be showing some age but it still feels pretty youthful. There are notes of rich, ripe cherry, cola, black pepper and a woody, cedary spice. The palate is plush and satiny, and here its age shows a touch with fruit heading more into the dried spectrum than fresh. It finishes a little on the woody side. Overall it's lacking in some of the complexity and balance one would hope for by this stage.

title: Kirkland Signature 2015 Signature Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This is a full-bodied, boldly ripe Cabernet Sauvignon. Soft layers of dark cherry and plum are well integrated and contrasted against dusty crushed rock and toasted oak.

title: Malibu Rocky Oaks 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A deep shade of pink, this bottling from Pinot Noir grapes shows very subtle red-fruit aromas on the nose. There is decent texture on the sip, but the flavors are muddled and slightly rusty.

title: Château de la Cour d'Argent 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This aromatic wine with fine fruits and rich tannins is still at an early stage in its development. It shows dryness as well as richness and needs a few years. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Fonfroide 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Light and fruity, this wine is dominated by fresh Sémillon flavors. Citrus and a hint of potential creamy richness balance the wine between a smooth texture and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château Rouquette 2017 Sauvignon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This soft wine conveys pineapple and ripe white-currant fruitiness along with citrus acidity. Warm, open and rounded, it is ready to be drunk now.

title: Collier Creek 2015 Red Wagon Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: An aroma like toasted almonds and wood smoke meets spiced plum and red-cherry flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It's an oaky version that maintains pretty good balance.

title: DiLuca 2016 Rosso Black Label Red
description: Plum skin and pomegranate lead the nose while white pepper and raw oak take on an earthy edge. The soft-bodied palate is awash in silky tannins, with intense flavors of vanilla, oak and green tobacco leaf over black cherry and plum. There is a spicy kick on the finish, with more vanilla and baked black plum.

title: Dutton Estate 2016 Thomas Road Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This is a big ripe red wine moderate in structure that offers fleshy mouthfuls of cola and black cherry.

title: Ferraud et Fils 2017 Le Chai des Platanes  (Mâcon-Villages)
description: A bright, fresh and crisp wine, this is totally ready to drink. It has good acidity as well as minerality.

title: Filodivino 2015 Filotto  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
description: Aromas of scorched earth, ripe yellow apple and a whiff of toasted nut lead the nose. On the medium-bodied palate, fresh acidity offsets dried yellow peach, a hint of citrus zest and bitter almond. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit flavors.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: Gordon Estate 2014 Estate Grown Traditions Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of 48% Cabernet Sauvignon and 38% Merlot, with the balance Malbec and Petit Verdot. Aromas of mushroom, dried herb, wet gravel, spice and cherry lead to ripe cherry and soy flavors. The palate brings a sense of elegance and appeal.

title: Jules Taylor 2017 OTQ Single Vineyard Rosé (Marlborough)
description: This Pinot Noir-based rosé offers ripe notes of almost candied strawberries, raspberries and watermelons, with a strawberry leaf finish. The fruit sweetness on the palate is weighty but the acidity keeps things under control.

title: K Squared Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Honey-dipped pineapple and guava, with a touch of fig give this wine a fruity midpalate. This has a moderate structure and a lingering note of anise.

title: Kunde 2016 C.S. Ridge Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: Thick and oaky, this estate wine evokes caramel and pineapple-upside-down cake—its texture lushly unctuous and rich.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Laurent Dufouleur Aux Vignes-Rondes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: This wine is something of a disappointment for such a prestigious appellation. A red fruit flavor, gentle tannins and spice contrast with a tough, extracted texture that lingers.
designation: Laurent Dufouleur Aux Vignes-Rondes Premier Cru

title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2017 Domaine des Coteaux du Val Lamartinien Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Pierreclos)
description: A touch of spice gives an edge to the bright, crisp texture of this wine. It offers freshness, lively acidity and immediate drinkability. Enjoy it now.
designation: Domaine des Coteaux du Val Lamartinien Les Charmes

title: Matetic 2015 Corralillo Chardonnay (San Antonio)
description: Cidery apple aromas come with a hint of barrel smoke. A medium-to-full palate offers adequate acidity, while this older-vintage Chardonnay tastes of generic white fruit, bitter oak and honeyed sweetness. A slight sticky finish is less than fresh.

title: Matua 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine is initially a bit reductive. It veers towards the green spectrum, showing notes of bell pepper, tomato leaf and grapefruit. There's a biting, slightly underripe quality to the acidity and that is ultimately balanced out by a slightly rounded texture. It finishes on a citrusy tang.

title: Mengler Family Wines 2016 Alegria Vineyards Sangiovese (Russian River Valley)
description: With an ashy undercurrent of char and smoke, this wine offers medium-bodied layers of dried cherry and leather, finishing with a lasting note of black pepper.

title: Monowai 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)
description: Fruity but not bombastically so, notes of apple, guava and peach lead into a palate that is creamy-textured thanks to some time spent on lees. The palate is back by enough acidity to remain refreshing yet the finish is abrupt.

title: Paddy Borthwick 2017 Paper Road Sauvignon Blanc (Wairarapa)
description: This wine balances loads of peach and pineapple tones with a touch of green bell pepper. The palate is a bit disjointed, with the ripe fruit and bright acidity not quite gelling.

title: San Pedro 2016 1865 Selected Vineyards Carmenère (Maule Valley)
description: Slightly oxidized berry and prune aromas include overt oak and a more vague hint of asphalt. A full, chunky, sticky palate delivers a mix of herbal berry flavors and oak-based clove, and that's more or less how this finishes.

title: Château Gabachot 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Fruity and ripe, this wine is developing fast. Its tannins are already soft, giving an attractive red-fruit-flavored wine. Drink from 2021.

title: Clotilde Davenne 2015 Cuvée Paradoxe  (Mâcon-Villages)
description: This wine is soft and ripe with smooth fruits, touches of caramel and honey, and good acidity. Drink now.

title: Crowded House 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This needs time in glass to aerate and to show its passionfruit, pineapple, grapefruit and green herbed characters. Even then, the acidity is a little searing, just barely kept in check by some fruit weight.

title: Domaine Dujardin 2015  Monthélie
description: Full bodied with plenty of tannins, this wine is firm and still with its dry core. It needs plenty of time for any fruit to show, although it seems it will always have a dry edge.

title: Errazuriz 2016 Syrah (Aconcagua Costa)
description: Jumpy aromas of iodine, foxy berry fruit, green herb and gamy meat are all over the place. This Syrah from a rain-plagued vintage feels wide, grabby and tannic. Gamy, herbal berry flavors finish minty and oaky. For a tough El Niño year, this is good, but that's it.

title: Fetzer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Light in color and flavor, this wine smells tangy and citrus-like, and tastes lean and low in fruit and acidity. It's clean and simple in character.

title: J. Bouchon 2016 Canto Norte Red (Maule Valley)
description: Raspberry Kool-Aid aromas don't suggest anything serious. This blend of Merlot and Cabernets Sauvignon and Franc is chunky and blocky in feel, with little shape to the palate. Minty red fruit flavors wrap up on a sticky, tannic finish.

title: Jack's House 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine seems sweet due to candied-fruit aromas and flavors and oaky spices like vanilla and maple. It is medium bodied and soft in texture for the varietal.

title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Lenoir  (Mâcon-Villages)
description: Ripe and fruity, this wine has apricot and apple flavors and a soft texture that just hints at minerality. Drink now.

title: Kirkland Signature 2017 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)
description: Aromas of honeysuckle, green apple and citrus lead the nose. On the simple palate, fresh acidity accompanies pineapple and lemon zest.

title: Llano Estacado 2014 THP Montepulciano (Texas High Plains)
description: The nose offers aromas of Marasca cherry, candied orange and sharp angostura bitters over subtler tones of sawdust and aged oak. Fairly tart upfront in flavors of plum and red cherry, the palate is bolstered by sandy tannins and tangy acidity.

title: Marcel Couturier 2016 Les Longues Terres  (Mâcon-Loché)
description: A full bodied and ripe wine, this is rich and concentrated. The tropical fruits and spice give it a full character that does not leave enough opportunity for balanced acidity. Drink now.

title: Maryhill 2015 Elephant Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)
description: High-toned apple and cherry aromas are followed by a scratchy feeling palate marked by gritty tannins. The tannins don't seem to have fully ripened, and the variety is hard to find.

title: Messina Hof NV G-S-M (Texas)
description: Aromas of peppercorns, earthy licorice, pumpernickel and black currant are intriguing on the nose of this blend of 45% Syrah, 35% Mourvèdre and 22% Grenache. Ripe fruit flavors are propped up by juicy acidity over sandy tannins. This remains juicy towards the finish, with a touch of peppery spice.

title: Ramón Raventós 2015 Brut Inicial Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny, pickled aromas are challenging. On the palate, this is initially foamy and then dull. Apple, green herb and vanilla flavors carry over to the finish. As a whole, this brut is just good enough but has faults.

title: Sumarroca NV Insito Reserva Extra Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny citrus aromas pass muster while dealing a note of compost. A fair palate rates as basic. Dry, spicy lime and apple flavors are slightly bitter on a finish that's fresh and forward.

title: Totara 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Relatively quiet on the nose, this wine offers notes of red current and strawberry, backed by a savory spine. The palate is on the hot side and lacking some of the elegance, with woody drying tannins that are on the clunky side. The fruit feels a little sour on the finish, too.

title: William Fèvre 2015 La Misión Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Raspberry and strawberry aromas include a note of tomato sauce. This feels fairly spineless, but not outright flat. Herb-infused flavors of berry fruit and bell pepper finish steady but are devoid of complexity.

title: Château de Hartes 2016  Bordeaux
description: Soft, fruity and open, this wine has attractive red-berry flavors and light tannins. It should develop quickly. Drink from 2020.

title: Château La Rose Montauran 2016  Bordeaux
description: This wine has soft tannins and juicy acidity. It is light and fruity, with an open character that means it will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Alara 2016 Sangiovese (San Benito County)
description: Dark strawberry, gingerbread spice, toast and gravel show on the nose of this relatively light bottling. Rounded and ripe plum and boysenberry flavors are lifted by cinnamon spice on the palate.

title: Albino Armani 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: Dark berry, tobacco and baking spice aromas lead the nose. The robust palate offers dried black cherry, clove and black pepper alongside bracing tannins.

title: Balletto 2016 Cider Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy in white pepper and black tea, this is an effusive, intriguing and fruit-shy wine that's strong in tannin and power.

title: Bianchi 2017 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)
description: Clean aromas of pear flesh, citrus skins and creamy white fruit show on the nose of this bottling. Broad flavors of poached pome fruit are cut by tangy grapefruit elements, proving quite complex for an often simple grape.

title: Bucci 2014 Pongelli  (Rosso Piceno)
description: Made with Montepulciano and Sangiovese, this has aromas of dark berry, tilled soil and allspice. The savory palate offers juicy sour cherry, clove and white pepper balanced by freshness and supple tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Cà d'Or 2016 Blanc de Blancs  (Lessini Durello)
description: Made entirely with native grape Durello, this svelte sparkler opens with aromas of field flower, Anjou pear and a hint of honeydew melon. On the polished, refreshing palate, bright acidity and a silky mousse lift creamy apple, white peach and tangerine alongside a hint of tangy minerals.

title: Casata Monfort NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Baked bread, ripe orchard fruit and pressed chamomile aromas lead the way while the vibrant palate shows mature Golden Delicious apple, pear and candied citrus. A continuous perlage provides the backdrop.

title: Cascina Bric NV 460 n.8 Brut Rosé Pret-a-porter Metodo Classico  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)
description: Rose, wild berry, crushed herb and hazelnut aromas take center stage. Vibrant and linear, the palate offers wild strawberry, pomegranate and clove alongside vibrant acidity and a lively perlage. It finishes on an almond note.
designation: 460 n.8 Brut Rosé Pret-a-porter Metodo Classico

title: Castello Montauto 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano
description: This opens with aromas of white spring flower and yellow stone fruit. The savory palate offers yellow peach, Bartlett pear and citrus while a bitter almond note signals the close.

title: Cavicchioli 2014 Rosé del Cristo Metodo Classico Brut  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)
description: Aromas of toasted hazelnut, nectarine and a whiff of vanilla lead the nose. On the bright palate, a soft perlage underscores white cherry, pink grapefruit and a hint of candied citrus. It's crisp, with vibrant acidity.
designation: Rosé del Cristo Metodo Classico Brut

title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This Boissonneau wine is all about up-front fruit. Blackberries, black currants and good acidity dominate the tannic structure and dry core. The wine is bold, ripe and fruity. Drink from 2022.

title: Château des Laurets 2015  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion
description: This dense wine is packed with firm tannins and concentrated fruit. A blend of ripe Merlot and perfumed Cabernet Franc, it has weight, with layers of black-plum skin flavors and dark tannins. With its firm dry core, it is still young. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Féret-Lambert 2016 Costes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This wine is certainly structured, but the ripe fruitiness is most prominent. Red-berry flavors and acidity are important elements in this full, rich wine with hints of wood aging. Drink from 2022.

title: Clos des Rocs 2016 Les Mûres  (Pouilly-Loché)
description: Full and rich, this wine comes from the producer's 2.5-acre organic vineyard. Now mature and ready to drink, it combines ripe yellow fruits with a strongly mineral texture.

title: Corteforte 2011 Terre di San Zeno  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Earthy aromas of truffle, new leather and ripe black fruit lead the nose. The firm palate doles out ripe black plum, blackberry and cinnamon alongside smooth tannins.

title: Domaine de la Charbonnière 2015 Tradition Grenache-Syrah (Vacqueyras)
description: There's a sweet blackberry and mulberry attack to this ripe blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah. It's a primary, intensely fruit-forward wine, gilded by soft, pliable tannins and just a hint of garrigue. Its youthful exuberance is best enjoyed now–2022.

title: Domaine des Bernardins 2016 Red (Beaumes-de-Venise)
description: A splash of white Grenache added to this otherwise typical red Grenache blend lends a touch of freshness to plump, slightly preserved flavors of dried plum and cherry jam. It's an easy-drinking, intensely fruity wine accented by a hint of truffle. Enjoy now–2023.

title: Domìni Veneti 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: Aromas of forest floor, leather and ripe dark-skinned fruit lead the nose. The chewy, monolithic palate evokes dried black cherry, clove and a dollop of vanilla alongside firm tannins.

title: Fiddletown Cellars 2017 Zinfandel Rosé (Amador County)
description: This wine tastes mellow and feels smooth, bringing white peach and light raspberry flavors to the palate. It has medium to full body and a pleasantly rich mouthfeel.

title: Finca Azaya 2016 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: Sweet-smelling raisin, prune, licorice and chocolate aromas are fully ripe. In the mouth, this is plump but firm, with scratchy tannins. Prune, mocha and chocolate flavors are consistent with the nose, while this holds onto a raisiny sense of ripeness on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: Château Beauséjour 2014 Old Vines  (Puisseguin Saint-Émilion)
description: Rich, concentrated and structured, this wine comes from 80-year-old vines grown organically and spent 24 months in wood. It needs to age, but already the black-currant fruit glows with crispness and acidity. Wood and tannins are still softening, so drink this wine from 2022.

title: Domaine Anderson 2015 Walraven Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: A deep gold color and effusive aromas of dough, toast and butter start this wine off with a bang. The flavors are rich, vivid and nicely oaky, giving up butterscotch, toast and lemon curd along with softer vanilla and pear tones. It is generous and rich in texture.

title: Domaine des Amouriers 2015 Signature Red (Vacqueyras)
description: Whiffs of charcuterie, thyme and rose petal perfume this seductive blend of Grenache, Syrah, Mourvèdre and Cinsault.
